loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal, Panamericana se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Luna Radiante. Se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. 
Un ejemplo claro es María René A. Gpmzales de 27 años, ingresó al grupo a trávés  de su mamá quien ya pertenecía a la Asociación. Maria se dedica a vender ropa deportiva hace 10 años con el apoyo y enseñanza de su madre, con el crédito que esta solicitando tiene planificado comprar busos, chamarras y poleras para porteriormente venderlos en la feria 16 de Julio. María tiene que combinar la adminsitración de su negocio con el cuidado de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Luna Radiante” meets every two weeks in the Regional Office, Panamericana. They formed a group because of their need for capital that would allow them to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have different businesses in the areas of production, services and shop keeping. A clear example is María René A. G. who is 27 years old. She joined the group though her mom who already belonged to the Association. María has worked selling sports clothing for 10 years with the support and guidance of her mother. She plans to buy sweatshirts, jackets and t-shirts with the loan she is applying for and later sell them at the July 16th fair. María has to combine running her business with caring for her 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Las Amigas De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, se reúne la Asociación Comunal LAS AMIGAS DE JUAN PABLO.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
Un ejemplo claro es Nicolasa O. E. de 47 años, vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, está con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 5 años aproximadamente, ella tiene el negocio de atención de fotocopiadora y elaboración de folder. Esté último negocio es el que mayor rentabilidad tiene y el préstamo solicitado piensa invertir comprando tarjetas y láminas con los cuales elabora los folder que después los vende a librerias, puestos de libros, oficinas y otros. Como es un negocio de producción cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
In the Juan Pablo Multi Service Center, the Community Association Las Amigas de Juan Pablo (friends of John Paul) meet. The members of this association have various businesses in sales, production and services. A good example is Nicolasa O. E., 47, from a neighborhood outside the city of El Alto. She has been with the Pro Mujer family for about 5 years. Her business is working with a photocopier and making notebooks. This last business is the most profitable, and the loan that she is asking for will be used to buy cards, and sheets of paper so that she can make folders, and later sell them to bookstores, book stands, offices, and others. Since it's a production business she depends on the help of her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic supplies

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, Trabajando para el Futuro (Working Toward the Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Luz’s group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their four children.

Luz is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small neighborhood general supply store that she runs out of her home, by purchasing necessary products for sale such as clothes, beans, sweets (candies) and other comestible items as well as a blender.

Luz will use the profits to improve the life of her family: buy better food and clothes, fix a window and buy school supplies. Hoping her children will grow up to be good people, she dreams of a computer for them and a better education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy beans, sweets, clothes and a blender for her small neighborhood variety store

loans.name: San Ramon Solidarity Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario San Ramón está conformado por Delmir Raquel y Martha Lorena. Ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Delmir  de 28 años, dio inicio con este negocio con fondos propios como es la venta de comida, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad donde también ofrece comida a los trabajadores del ingenio y se ha expandido a otras zonas. En cambio su otra amiga Martha de 54 años se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 25 años y con la ayuda necesaria ha realizado los esfuerzos necesarios para mejorar cada día. Es así que el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima en cada una de sus actividades. Sueñan con tener suficiente capital para realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
The San Ramón Solidarity Group is composed of Delmir Raquel and Martha Lorena. Each dedicates herself to different economic activities. Delmir, age 28, started her food-selling business with her own money more than 10 years ago. Since she started her business, she has begun to sell food to local machinists and has expanded her business to other areas. In contrast, her other friend Martha, age 54, has sold bread for 25 years and with the necessary help, she has been able to muster the necessary effort to make every day better. For these reasons they seek more funds to buy raw materials for each of their activities. They dream that they will have sufficient capital to make some improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital/ Business expansion

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe Group

texts.en:
Elena is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza y Fe (Hope and Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Elena’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and her six children.

Elena is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza – she is very excited for this opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her small general neighborhood store by purchasing necessary products such as clothes, flip-flops and other things.

Elena will use the profits to expand her business and hopes to have enough money to make improvements to her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, flip-flops, and other items for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 39 años. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taller de mecánica. Hace más de 10 años que tiene esta gran habilidad con este negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes recurren a José Luis porque tiene mucha  habilidad en interactuar con sus clientes además es el primer crédito que realiza en fundación, por lo que se siente muy feliz con esta oportunidad que se le está brindando. No ha sido fácil continuar con esta actividad pues los desafíos que ha enfrentado han sido el tiempo porque no puede entregar sus pedidos por las diferentes piezas que algunas veces no tiene. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos, pinturas, acetileno entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
José Luis is 39 years old and runs a mechanics shop. He’s been doing this for more than 10 years and has lots of experience. Most of his customers return to him because of the way he is able to interact. This will be his first loan through the foundation and he is very happy to have this opportunity. He faces the challenge of not being able to deliver some of his services because he lacks the proper materials. He will use the money from this loan to buy spare parts, paints, and acetylene, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es:
Don Elvis es padre de familia de tres hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios. 
El señor Elvis trabaja en su negocio propio desde hace varios años, como cadete de taxi, carro que logro comprar con apoyo de sus hermanos que están en otro país. 
El cual fue una gran ayuda y oportunidad para tener el sustento diario de alimentación. Lo difícil que abecés solo logra para la gasolina y no alcanza para otros gastos, así como también hay días buenos, es un trabajo cansado y riesgoso ya que mucho somos asaltados por los delincuentes. Con este financiamiento hará mantenimiento a su carro en la suspensión y dirección del vehiculo para seguir dando un eficiente servicio de carrera de taxi. gracias a estos prestamo logra hacer este mantenimiento rutinario para manejar su transporte de trabajo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Elvis is the father of three children, he and his wife work to support their children with their studies. Elvis has worked in his own business for many years, as a taxi driver, with a car he was able to buy with the help of his brothers who are in another country. The assistance from his brothers was a great help and opportunity to provide daily nourishment for his family. The difficult thing is that sometimes he only has money for gasoline and not enough for other expenses, so while there are good days, it is a tiring job and is dangerous now that many of drivers are assaulted by delinquents. With this financing, he will do maintenance on his car’s suspension and steering so that he can continue providing efficient taxi service. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to do routine maintenance so that he can keep his transportation in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi Maitenance: Suspension and Steering

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de 26 años de edad. Dedicada al negocio, el cual ha aprendido de sus padres, que han aportado para que administre su propio negocio de ropa y variedades. Desde hace varios años logro esta venta de ropa que ha venido incrementando con financiamiento, el cual ha logrado el objetivo ya que le ha invertido en variedades como: venta de cosméticos,
Perfume, zapatos, para poder lograr vender ya que solo la venta de ropa no le da por la mucha competencia que tiene, pero no se deja de vender. Con este préstamo lograra la compra de ropa interior, compra de tintes de cabello, cosmético variados, como ropa para dama.
Sus planes es poder mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas, y poder ayudar a sus padres en los gastos. ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 26 year old young woman who started her own clothing and accessory business. She learned this trade from her parents and has grown her business with the help of some financing. It has also allowed her to expand into other areas, such as the sale of cosmetics, perfume, and shoes because she has lots of competition selling just clothing. She will use the money from this loan to buy undergarments, hair coloring, cosmetics, and ladies clothing. She plans to balance her sales and be able to help her parents with their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jesucristo Es La Puerta Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the coordinator of her group, Jesucristo es la Puerta (Jesus Christ is the Door), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Nadia’s group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure alone with her two children.

Nadia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothes-sales business by buying necessary supplies: pants, blouses, shorts, skirts and other articles.

Nadia will use the profits to improve the life of her family and further grow her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, shorts, skirts, etc. for her small clothing business

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es: Erika Lissette tiene 29 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella ya tiene experiencia con financiamientos, pues ha demostrado que la buena administración es la clave del éxito para su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y el destace de cerdo, pues es una joven que le gusta diversificar su actividad cada día más, por lo que es necesario aprender diferentes negocios para mejorar su condición económica. Por lo que sale a ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante pero con muchas ganas de mejorar.  Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como pintura de labios, perfumes, colonias, tratamientos entre otros. Sueña seguir manteniendo los negocios pues ambos son muy rentables.
texts.en:
Erika Lissette is 29 years old, and is caring for 2 children. She has previous experience with microfinance loans, and has shown that good management is the key to the success of her business. Her business activities include the sale of cosmetics and the butchering of pigs. She is a young woman who likes to diversify her activities continually, and she has to keep learning different business skills in order to improve her economic situation. She sells her products in the street, but always with the hope of improving herself. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase basic materials such as lipsticks, perfumes, colognes, cosmetic treatments, and other items. It is her dream to maintain both businesses, as they are both quite profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Iván de 42 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Alejandrina es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, en formato DVD, aprovechando las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Pichanaki para vender su producto, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y que es un negocio muy rentable. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, aunque le sea difícil tener que armar todos los días su puesto de venta, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda de videos más adelante, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 40-year-old mother, who lives in her own home with 42-year-old husband Ivan and her two children. They are the principal inspiration for her hard work and happy spirit. Alejandrina sells films, documentaries, cartoons and music on DVD at Sunday markets in Pichanaki, where demand for these products is high and business is very profitable. She has been working in this business for two years. She likes her work very much, particularly since it allows her to decide her own working hours. Setting up her stall every day is a chore but she accepts this is her job and something she has to do. In the future, she would like to set up a video store and improve her income. This is her second loan with MFP, which she is ready to pay on time, since she does not want to let down her business partners. With the two thousand soles she has requested, she will buy more DVDs to offer a greater range to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more DVD films and documentaries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To secure capital for business development

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria Mancillas tiene ya mas de diez y ocho años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya le esta haciendo falta y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio. 
Doña Rosa Maria ha tenido ya cinco préstamos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Maria has been selling groceries for more than eighteen years, and the business is her family's source of income. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise that she lacks because she does not want to take money out of the business. She plans to pay the loan with a portion of the earnings from the business. Ms. Rosa Maria has already had five loans with FVP which she has paid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Corazones De Turi (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Corazones de Turi esta formado por 12 socias que estan en la lucha por obtener mejores días para sus familias,  viven en la comunidad del mismo nombre de su banco comunal en  la parraoquia  Turi ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, limita al norte con la ciudad de Cuenca, al este la parroquia  Valle, al sur la parroquia Tarqui y al oeste la parroquia Baños. El centro parroquial se ubica a 200 m. de la ciudad de Cuenca considerada un balcón donde concurren cuencanos,  turistas nacionales y extranjeros a recrearse con el hermoso panorama de la tercera cuidad más importante del Ecuador; la iglesia parroquial y la loma de Hitocruz son otros lugares muy atractivos para los turistas.

En esta ocasión nos acompaña una amiga de una de nuestras socias que esta interesada en saber como funciona el sistema con Espoir,  de izquierda a derecha es la señora de sombrero verde y un chal rojo sobre el hombro.

La señora  Adriana D. vive en la comunidad Corazón de Turi, este es  su primer crédito en la fundación y se entero por medio del curso de tejido y manualidades al cual asiste, ella  se dedica a la crianza de animales como borregos, chanchos, cuyes, pollos y vacas vendiendo la mitad de la leche en la comunidad y la restante es para su consumo, se ha dedicado a esta actividad hace 5 años.

Adriana tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, su esposo es  albañil y como aun no tienen casa propia vive en casa de la abuelita de su esposo a la cual hacen compañía. Con su crédito  comprará crias de pollos  y materiales para construir un galpón para criar mas cuyes.

Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.

La señora Johanna Z.  vive en la comunidad  Corazón de Turi,  tiene 22 años de edad, casada y fruto de su unión conyugal concibió un niño que ahora tiene cuatro años y esta en el quinto mes de gestación del segundo hijo, su esposo trabaja como albañil y viven en casa de sus papás compartiendo los gastos hasta llegar a tener su casa propia que es su  mayor sueño.

Este es su primer credito y como la mayoria de mujeres de su comunidad se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos los  que  vende en sus necesidades a sus vecinos de la comunidad y tambien para el consumo de su hogar,  con el dinero que  reciba comprará un chancho y el alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazones de Turi is made up of twelve members who are fighting for better futures for their families. The members live in a community having the same name as their communal bank, in the parish of Turi. Turi is located south of the city of Cuenca, and is bordered on the north by Cuenca, on the east by the parish of Valle, on the south by the perish of Tarqui, and on the west by the Parish of Baños. The central parish is located 200 meters from the city of Cuenca, and it is considered a great vantage point where locals and tourists come to enjoy the lovely panoramic view of the third most important city in Ecuador. The perish church and the hill of Hitocruz are other locations which are very popular with tourists. On this occasion we were accompanied by a friend of one of our members who is interested in learning about the program offered by Espoir [the field partner]. From left to right, she is the lady with the green hat and the red shawl on her shoulder. Mrs. Adriana D. lives in the community Corazon de Turi, and this is her first loan in the program. She discovered the program while attending a course on knitting and crafts. She raises animals like lambs, pigs, cuyes [guinea pigs; sometimes raised for their meat in parts of Latin America], chickens, and cows for milk. She will sell half the milk in the community, and keep the rest for herself. She has already been doing this for about 5 years. Adriana is 23 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 1. Her husband is a mason. They don't yet have a house of their own, so they are living in the home of her husbands Grandmother, keeping her company. She will use the loan money to purchase chickens to raise, and materials to construct a shed where she can raise more cuyes. Her goal is to someday own a house of her own. Mrs. Johanna Z. lives in the community Corazon de Turi, she's 22 years old, married, and she and her husband have a 4 year old son. She is also five months pregnant with their second child. Her husband works as a mason. They live in the home of his parents, (sharing all the expenses with them) until they own a house of their own, which is their biggest dream. This is her first loan, and like most women in her community, she raises pigs and chickens, some of which she sells to her neighbors in her community, and the rest are consumed by her household. With the money she receives, she will purchase a pig, and the food to raise it.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock,  feed, and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase Brazilian clothing for the season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Josefa es una mujer de 50 años de edad, trabajadora desde su juventud, procreo tres hijos, y junto a su esposo trabajan en recorrido escolar y taxi también
Por muchos años trabajo como afanadora en una universidad, al renunciar le dieron una buena liquidación  y ahorro de su esposo logro comprar el carro con el adjetivo de mejorar su vida para el futuro de sus hijos como la de ella ya que estaba cansada ya. 
Con los ahorros del taxi compraron un microbús pequeño un poco viejo ya que lo tienen de recorrido escolar y desean dar mantenimiento para una mejor función y mejor servicio.
Con este préstamo comprara piezas nuevas para cambiar a ambos vehículos como: valinera de patente, juego de chispero, platino y enderezado, amortiguadores para mejorarlos y poder seguir trabajando ya que es su fuente de ingresos de cada día.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 50 year old woman who has been working since her youth. She has three children. She and her husband work in school transportation. They also work with a taxi. She worked for many years as a cleaning lady in the university. When she resigned they gave her a good settlement. She used that and savings from her husband to buy a car. Her objective was to improve life for herself and her children in the future. She was tired. With the savings from the taxi they bought a small minibus. It is a little old; they use it for school transportation. They want to give it maintenance so that it will work better and give better service. She will use the loan to buy new replacement parts for both vehicles. She will buy things ball bearings, spark plugs, contact points, and shock absorbers. She will also pay for body work. She will do this to improve the vehicles and to keep working. This is her source of daily income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new parts like ball bearings, spark plugs, contact points, and shock absorbers, and body work for her vehicle.

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Maximia Maria tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues comenzó con pocos productos, pues se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a vender sus productos en la calle, ya que le resulta mucho más favorable así pues obtiene más clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de bolsos, sabanas, calzado, perfumes y toallas ya que ser acerca la festividad del día de la Madre y tiene bastantes pedidos. Sueña con mejorar su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Maximia Maria is 34 years old, living with her two children who are still minors and in her care. She earns her income through the sales of general merchandise. For more than seven years, she has had this business which began with a few products. Later waking up at 5:00AM to sell her products in the street, proved to be favorable and increased her clientele. The loan is for her to buy bags, sheets, footwear, perfume, and towels as the Mother's Day holiday is approaching and she has many orders. She dreams of improving her humble accommodations.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags, sheets, footwear, perfume, and towels

loans.name: Señor De Wimpillay Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Señor de Wimpillay está formado por mujeres luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias, viven en el mismo barrio del mismo nombre de su banco comunal que se encuentra ubicado en la margen derecha del río Huatanay de la ciudad del Cusco. Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios como por ejemplos: Carpintería de madera, venta de helados, atención de centro de mensajes, gasfitería, soldadura, venta de frutas y venta de chicha.  Wimpillay es una de las zonas rurales más pobres del distrito de Santiago de la  ciudad del Cusco donde no existen oportunidad de trabajo y las autoridades muy poco hacen  por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría de los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios y hace de esa forma quieren sacar adelante a sus familias.      

La señora Isabel es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 42 años vive en la margen derecha del rio Huatanay y con su esposo trabajan en la tienda donde venden comestibles, ellos acomodaron una habitación en la casa para expender sus productos a sus vecinos. La socia es fundadora del banco comunal y con su entusiasmo empezó a motivar  a sus vecinos para que se integren al banco comunal y tener un gran número de socios. Isabel requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche y muchas cosas más.    
(En la parte inferior de la fotografía aparece la socia María Elena,  la socia se retiro de la reunión porque estaba apurada y se le tomó la foto solo a ella antes que se tomará la fotografía grupal).
texts.en:
The Señor de Wimpillay Communal Bank is made up of a lively and charismatic group of strong, hardworking women that are looking for ways to provide for their families every day. Their neighborhood, that has the same name as their communal bank, is located on the right bank of the Huatanay River in the city of Cusco. Retail trade constitutes the majority of their economic activities. They also offer services such as: carpentry, the sale of ice, central messaging services, plumbing, welding and the sale of fruits and meats. Wimpilliay is one of the poorest rural areas in the Santiago district of Cusco where work opportunities do not exist and the authorities do very little to support the residents. For this reason the majority of the residents started their own businesses in order to provide for their families. Isabel is from the city of Cusco. She is 42 years old and lives on the right bank of the Huatanay River. She and her husband have set up a store in one of the rooms in their house. They work together here selling their products to their neighbors. She is a founding member of the communal bank and with her enthusiasm has motivated her neighbors to become members of the communal bank to increase the number of members. Isabel is requesting a loan in order to augment her business capital. She wants to buy sacks of rice and sugar, cans of milk and many other things. (Member María Elena appears in the lower portion of the photo. She had to leave the meeting early because she was in a hurry. The photo of her alone was taken before the group photo).

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Isabel is requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, cans of milk and many other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase supplies for candy store

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 52 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Artemio de 54 años y sus 3 menores hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Domitila se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en Pichanaki, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y para ella lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, pese que éstos químicos afectan su salud. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras y de esa manera aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siente que éste aporte lo ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Domitila, 52 years of age, is a cheerful and hard-working mother to her family. She lives in her own home along with her husband Artemio, 54, and their three minor children for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Domitila works in the cultivation of coffee and bananas. Every day, very early in the morning, she works in her field, knowing that the money she obtains for her products will depend heavily on the quality of her harvest. She sells her products in Pichanaki, where better prices are offered. What she enjoys most about her work is the harvest, since it is then that she feels that the months of labor have come to fruition. She has worked in this business for three years and the most challenging part of her work is fumigating her land as the chemicals are damaging to her health. In time she hopes to buy new land and in this way increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She feels that this contribution will help her greatly in the progress of her work. In her Communal Bank she is deeply loved by the rest of the members, since she is highly supportive of them. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she will buy more natural and chemical fertilizers to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase natural and chemical fertilizers to improve the quality of the land

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
El señor Santos Javier G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo construir la barda alrededor de su vivienda.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para los acabados de interior de la cocina de su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga  de una compañía de trasporte.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Cynthia Aurora Barba esposa del señor Santos Javier ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita a si vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos Javier Guzman is grateful for your support of his previous loan with which he was able to build a fence around his home. He is requesting a new loan to finish the interior of his kitchen. He plans to repay the loan with his earnings as a transport truck driver for a transport company. His wife Cynthia Aurora Barba is in the photo because he was at work on the day of the visit to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completion of kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es: Kari Marina tiene la edad de 40 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy importante pues sus logros son necesarios para mejorar cada día. Sus clientes siempre llegan buscando los productos básicos que son necesarios para el hogar. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a una pulpería, ya que ha sido la fuente de ingresos del hogar. El destino del crédito es para la compra granos básicos, frutas, verduras, leña, golosinas y detergentes. Ella sueña con seguir ampliando su negocio aun más.
texts.en:
Kari Marina is 40 years old. She is caring for 2 children. Since her success is necessary to improve each day, the experience that she has gained in her business has been very important . Her customers always come looking for basic household products. Her source of household income has been her general store that she started more than 11 years ago. She will use the loan to buy basic grains, fruits, vegetables, firewood, candy and detergents. Her dream is to expand her business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kari Marina will use the loan to buy grains, fruits, vegetables, firewood, candy and detergents to sell in her store

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 45 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridas hijas y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Gladis es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos y clientes, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y para ella lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. En adelante espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio. Este su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladis is 45 years old and a hard working, loving mother. She lives in her own home with her two lovely daughters and her greatest desire is to offer them a better quality of life. Gladis’ grocery store is one of the most shopped in the neighborhood. Her friendliness, charisma, and good service have made her store a favorite among her neighbors and customers who make their purchases early in the morning, because hers is the first store to open and the last to close. What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her neighbors about the things that go on in the neighborhood. She has been doing this for two years and what she finds most challenging is having to remain in her store all day so that her sales don’t drop. In the future she hopes to grow her business so that it becomes the primary outlet in her neighborhood. This will be her second loan though MFP and she knows that if she makes her payments on time, she will be eligible for other loans in the future, and she will also not cause problems for her communal bank. The other members like her very much. She will use the money from this loan to increase her stock of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles unos buenos estudios. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Lidia abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación que tiene con sus clientes, sin embargo lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para poder vender más productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo, en su grupo comunal es muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 28 years old and is a very hard working and loving mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, 42 year old Edgar, and her four children to whom she wants to provide a good education. Every day she opens her grocery store early in the morning in order to service her neighbors. She is a very able salesperson who knows how to treat her customers. She usually convinces them to buy just a little more. Her store is very well stocked and she manages it well. What she enjoys most about her work is the relationships she has with her customers. Her biggest challenge is having to stay in her store all day. Eventually she hopes to expand her store in order to be able to sell more items. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is prepared to save a bit each day in order to be able to make her payments. She is very responsible within her communal group. She will use the money from this loan to increase her grocery inventory and stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: Elena Marisol tiene la edad de 32 años, Ella en la actualidad necesita su crédito para comprar artículos, porque de esta manera sus clientes pueden ver la rapidez que tiene para conseguirles el producto. Su sueño es establecer una tienda en donde pueda ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos. Fue así con su esfuerzo que dio inició con un catalogo y hoy, para poder diversificar su oferta, maneja diferentes productos. Gracias a este negocio pudo ayudar a que sus hijos sigan adelante. El financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Elena is 32 years old and she needs this loan in order to buy products so that her customers can see how quickly she is able to fill their requests. Her dream is to open a store where she can offer a large variety of products. It was with this effort that she began her catalog sales and now she is able to offer a more diverse selection of products. Thanks to this business she was able to help her children get ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona tiene 44 años vive con sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo su actividad económica es a la venta de mercadería en general. Pabla tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que ha sido de mucho apoyo. Sus inicios se dan por que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y ella tenía que buscar la forma de mantenerlos, así es que decide que esta actividad es de gran ayuda. El crédito será invertido en la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y lápiz labial.
texts.en:
Pabla is 44 years old and lives with her two children. She sells general merchandise and has been working with the foundation for a long time. It has provided her with much support. She began after she was abandoned by the father of her children and needed to find a way to support them. This business has been a great help. She will use the money from this loan to invest in t-shirts, pants, skirts, and lip pencils.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia V. P. es madre soltera. Tiene 1 pequeño hijo. Vive en casa propia, la que se encuentra ubicada en el sector Hacienda Vieja. Trabaja como obrera de campo en la empresa fundo Checas. La Sra. es una persona muy emprendedora, con ganas de sacar adelante a su hijo, y que gracias a su empeño y dedicación logró juntar un dinero y empezar a construir su casa. Requiere el crédito para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño como nos manifiesta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Julia is the single mother of a young son. She lives in her own house, located in the Hacienda Vieja sector. She works as a field hand for the Checas company and is a very enterprising woman with a desire to help her son get ahead. After putting forth great effort, she was able to save up enough money to begin having her house built. She needs this loan in order to finish. She tells us that her dream is to finish building her house in order to provide her son with a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support she has gotten by means of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Lilia Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Lilia tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda. Vive en casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y son solteros. Es jubilada desde hace 26 años. Requiere el crédito para terminar la construcción de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy trabajadora, que le ha  brindado una buena  educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra. Lilia agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 62-year-old widow. She lives in her own home with her 3 grown children, who are all single. She has been retired for 26 years. She is requesting this loan to complete the construction of her home. She is a very hard-working woman, who strove very hard to offer her children a good education. She hopes to gain a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish the construction of her home. Lilia is grateful for the help offered through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Casimira, 54, is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo (Success with Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Casimira’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure.

Casimira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a cafeteria by purchasing cups, flour, bread and a toaster.

Casimira will use her profits to save toward her dream of opening a small general store in her home, which would give her two stable incomes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bread, cups, flour, and a toaster

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
C. is a humble woman who appears in the photo in front of her own house. She is the mother of a teenage child who attends the local public school.

To help be responsible for her family, C. has for years been engaged in a business producing Khmer noodles. In addition, she built a small pigpen where she raises pigs for extra income. She has a life partner in her husband who assists with her with the business activities.

C. requests a loan to purchase female pigs for her stall. She will raise the pigs to produce piglets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase female pigs

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Chek T., age 53, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Since 1998, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with three children who are secondary school students.

In addition to her pig-raising trade, Chek T. and her husband always produce Khmer noodles and sell them in bulk to middlemen who then take the noodles to retail at the market. Recently, Chek T. used all of the raw materials from her stock and she wants to resupply by asking for this loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make more Khmer noodles

loans.name: Exito Con Cristo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Casimira, 55, is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo (Success with Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Casimira’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure.

Casimira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a cafeteria by purchasing cups, flour, bread and a toaster.

Casimira will use her profits to save toward her dream of opening a small general store in her home, which would give her two stable incomes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy cups, bread, flour and a toaster

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: Mrs. P., 34, a domestic farmer whose husband appears on the left in the photo, owns a medium pigpen that she built behind her house. To earn a living, this mother of three school-aged children breeds a few pigs with the help of her children. Her husband catches fish from the river, a difficult job given that he lacks essential equipment.  Therefore, Mrs P. is requesting a loan to buy a boat  for his business.

loans.use: To buy a boat.

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Modesta, 53, is the coordinator of her group El Señor es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Modesta’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro de Macoris, an area known for its baseball stars and economic depression, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her son.

Modesta is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a variety of products including shampoo, perfumes, towels, juice, bread and also a toaster to toast the bread.

Modesta will use the profits to send her child to high school. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, perfumes, towels, juice, bread and a toaster

loans.name: Mout

texts.en:
Mr. M., 53, resides in Kompong Tom Province and earns a low income. He is a good and determined father who has tried to feed his seven children since they were young. Two of them are now married; the remaining five are single. His wife is a rice cultivator. To pursue a daily income, M. works as a day laborer who is also hired by people to do anything for a fee. 

M. says that the current income is not enough to support them, so he decided to request a loan of $600 to purchase a horse with a cart attached for the propose of starting a taxi service. By doing this, he hopes he will have ability to generate more income to help meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart for use as a taxi

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group Amor y Esperanza (Love and Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their five children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by purchasing a packet of used clothing that comes from places like the salvation army in the US. She will use the profits to purchase construction materials to finish construction on her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A packet of used clothing

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en:
Mr. Phoem L. is a married man whose his wife appears on the right of the photo here.  A father of three, he has one school-aged child, while the other two are now married. Phoem L. is a requirement worker. Additionally, he and his wife have other income from producing and selling Khmer noodles. 

Phoem L. has a problem: his old motor breaks often when he uses it to deliver the noodles to the market to sell, so he is applying for a loan to repair his broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom N. is the mother who is blessed with six teenage kids. Four are employed at different occupations, while the other two are attending school. Mom N., age 47, owns a medium-sized piece of farmland that she raises pigs and crops on to earn a living. She also gets some money from her husband’s job. He climbs palm trees to tap to juice and boil it into sugar for sale. Mom N. is taking out her first loan for capital to begin raising a few pigs in a stall she built. (Mrs. Mom N.’s husband appears in the photo above.)

loans.use: To begin raising a few pigs

loans.name: Pablo Armando

texts.es: Pablo tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa alquilada, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, el se dedica al transporte, adquirio su vehiculo hace 7 meses aproximadamente, con ahorros de trabajos anteriores y con ayuda de su conyuge quien tiene una bodega en su domicilio aproximadamente 3 años , solicita el credito para compra del soat y mantenimiento de su vehiculo su sueño es poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo is 30 years old; he lives in a rented house with his partner, and he has a 3-year-old son. He works in transport; he acquired his vehicle about 7 months ago with savings from previous work and with help from his partner who has had a general store in her home for approximately 3 years. He is asking for credit to purchase SOAT Compulsory Automobile Accident Insurance and to maintain his vehicle. His dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of SOAT automobile accident insurance and tools for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana S. B. is a hard working mother who tries her best in order to improve her farming business for the benefit of her family. Hard work and patience are her foundation in achieving a good life. Lack of business capital encouraged her to seek financial support from Kiva lenders. The loan she is using amounts to 43,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the lenders and is helping her improve her business by purchasing different commodities needed for farming. 

This loan was a great help in the maintenance of their farming business particularly in their rice production by purchasing fertilizers and rice seeds. Aside from farming, she also sells Avon Products as supplementary source of income. Luciana is thankful for the support of ASHI and is hoping to further improve their crop production in the future through work and continuous assistance of the lenders. This would not only provide her with happiness in life, but would also make her business improve and make more profit, which will allow her to support the basic needs of her family.

Her long term goal is to have their own tricycle transport business (three-wheeled vehicle) for additional revenue to build a sustainable life that is out from  under the umbrella of poverty. Through hard work and focus, Luciana is determined to improve her standard of life with the kind-hearted support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase different commodities needed in her farming business

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um V. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Um V. has been married for years and has eight children. Two of her children are married and six are single. Most of her children are working at different jobs. In addition, her husband is skilled at making furniture by hand. He turns the wood into furniture and sells the furniture to people who need it to decorate their houses. Um V. sees that her husband’s business is profitable, and she hopes to sustain it by accumulating a larger quantity of essential accessories using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accumulate more essential accessories

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes R., 34, lives in Kompong Tom province. She owns a small store next to her house where she makes and sells fritters to her neighbors to generate a daily income. Mrs. R. lives with her mother, who stays at home making silk palm mats to sell.  Mrs. R. was married, but is now divorced and doesn't  have any children. Mrs. R. will soon be cultivating rice crops during the approaching farming season. Due to a  lack of capital, Mrs. R. would like to purchase some equipment to support her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng S. is a local farmer and her husband is skilled at building houses, both wooden and stone houses. They live with four children in the province of Kompong Tom. One of the children is not longer in school and is currently working as a construction worker. The other three children are students. Because of their increasing cost of living, Heng S. wants to expand her farming business to meet the family’s expenses. Therefore, Heng S. is asking for a loan to grow additional potato crops on her farm land.

loans.use: To grow potato crops.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en: S., 51 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She plants her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow rice by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has two children. One child is married and lives away from home, while the other one works on the farm. Her husband appears on the left of the photo and raises ducks.  He breeds ducks for eggs. As the duck raising trade is very profitable, S. is taking out this loan to buy more ducklings to raise.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings to raise

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Mrs. Tan N. is 31 years old. She earns about US$ 2 a day from raising pigs. Tan N. lives with two children who are enrolled school, in the commune of Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Song, 34 years old, is a construction foreman. Tan N. requests a loan to be used as capital to begin investing in a fish-selling business. She hopes this will provide her with additional income.

loans.use: To start up a fish-selling business.

loans.name: Antonino

texts.en:
Antonino B., 50, is from the village of Holy Friday. He is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Antonino owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Antonino has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns close to 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Antonino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Antonino is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Antonino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun N. is a 32-year-old farmer who lives in a commune located in Kampong Tom Province. She makes about $1 per day from selling vegetables that she grows. She also receives about $2.50 per day from her husband’s fishing.

This couple has given birth to three children, two of whom are students and one who is not enrolled in school, and all are dependent on them. Chhoeun N. requests a loan to purchase a boat for her husband to use to fish along the river.

loans.use: To purchase a boat.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. L. is a 39-year-old widow and a laborer. She is also hired by people to do anything, typically earning about $2 USD per day. L. currently feeds two young children, both of whom go to school. She lives with her father and her young sister, who also share responsibility for the family by working at different jobs. Her father sells natural medicine and her sister is a garment factory worker. L. sees that her father’s business is profitable and she hopes to sustain it by asking for a loan to accumulate more raw materials for her father to produce medicine to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to produce medicines

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. S., aged 30, owns and operates a handicraft business making and selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that her husband weaves or she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She and her husband also take time to sell retail by using their horse-drawn cart as transport. It takes a week to sell all their rattan. S. has received orders from her customers but she lacks the capital to satisfy her customers' needs. For this reason, S. has decided to request a loan to purchase a larger amount of raw materials so she can weave many sets of rattan cupboards to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase larger amount of raw materials

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mr. B., aged 30, operates his own small business planting various crops. He harvests and sells the crops to buyers when they come to maturity. B. has a life partner in his wife (who appears in the photo above) who assists him in growing the crops. The couple helps each other in order to feed their young child, who is enrolled in school. As he hopes for a good result in this cultivation season, B. is applying for assistance on Kiva to grow potato crops. He is hopeful that the loan will provide good benefits that will enable him to meet his family’s financial crisis and pay his loan installments.

loans.use: To grow potato crops

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush M. lives in Vanadzor city with her mother. She has a higher education in the field of economy.
For many years, Siranush has been running a trading business. She trades in clothes and crockery in her shop in Vanadzor city. She imports crockery from Yerevan and clothes from foreign countries. Siranush’s niece helps her in the business, so some business income goes to Siranush's brother's family. Siranush is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to import an assortment of summer clothes for her business.

loans.use: To import an assortment of summer clothes for her business

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en: Rubik B. is 26 years old and lives in Lchashen village, Sevan area. He is married and has two children. For about ten years, Rubik has been engaged in farming. He has six cows, three calves, and a plot of his own land. Rubik and his wife cultivate their land and keep their animals. With their profit from farming, they take care of their young family. Rubik is aksing for a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy four cows to develop his stock-breeding.

loans.use: To buy four cows to develop his stock-breeding

loans.name: Johamy Concepción

texts.es: Johamy Concepción H. D. A. D. 35 años D. edad, es madre D. dos hijos D. 9 y 6 años D. edad, con quienes resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo quien trabaja como motorista del transporte público. Johamy posee un comedor, en el cual se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo hace diferentes tipos D. bebidas como: café, chocolate y frescos naturales, los cuales comercializa en el mercado regional D. La Libertad, ella posee muchos clientes los cuales son trabajadores y propietarios D. otros puestos en el mismo mercado, así mismo Johamy sale a los diferentes pasillos y secciones del mercado para ofrecer las bebidas y otros platillos típicos que elabora, con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima para la elaboración D. desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo para comprar más fruta y café para elaborar las bebidas que comercializa. Debido a que posee varios años D. contar con este negocio, ella es muy conocida en el lugar, así mismo es vista como una mujer muy responsable, digna D. admirarse, ya que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Johamy Concepción H. D. A. is 35 years old and the mother of two children (ages 9 and 6). They resiD. in the Department of La Libertad. Her husband works as a public transportation driver. Johamy manages a diner where she is in charge of making breakfasts and lunches. She also prepares different types of beverages such as coffee, hot chocolate, and natural soft drinks. Her business is located at the regional market of La Libertad. She has many customers who are employees or business owners who operate vending posts at the same market. Johamy also delivers to different corridors and sections of the market to increase her sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire a large quantity of ingredients for preparing breakfasts and lunches. In addition, Johamy will buy more fruit and coffee for preparing the beverages that she sells. She has been in business for several years, so she is well-known in the area. Many view her as a responsible woman who is worthy of admiration. She strives to get ahead so that she can proviD. her young children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing breakfasts, lunches, and beverages

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es: Sonia Margarita S. J. de 32 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Masahuat, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz, y se dedica a la venta de cocos, agua embotellada, jugos y otras bebidas más. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La venta de Sonia esta ubicada en la carretera al aeropuerto de El Salvador, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes son salvadoreños que vienen del extranjero, los cuales aprovechan a tomar la deliciosa agua de coco, así mismo vende con personas que se dirigen hacia Zacatecoluca y personas que si dirigen a otros pueblos los cuales se encuentra en las cercanías, sus ventas son bastante estables, sobretodo por las personas que viajan hacia el aeropuerto ya que por lo general son familias bastante grandes las que se detienen a comprar sus productos. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar cocos por mayor, así mismo comprar más agua y refrescos, todo con el fin de aumentar sus ventas. Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza día con día por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, ya que la responsabilidad es exclusiva de ella, debido a que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Sonia Margarita S. J. is 32 years old and resides in San Pedro Masahuat, which is located in the Department of La Paz. She sells coconuts, bottled water, juices, and other beverages. Sonia is a responsible and hardworking woman who lives with her three school-age children (ages 16, 14, and 8). Her vending post is located along the highway on the way to the airport in El Salvador. Most of her customers are Salvadorans who arrive from abroad and take advantage of the delicious coconut water. Sonia also sells to people traveling to Zacatecoluca and other nearby towns. Her sales are fairly stable since people traveling to the airport are accompanied by their large families and find it necessary to stop in order to buy her products.

Sonia is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy coconuts in bulk. She will also purchase more water and soft drinks so that she can increase her sales. Sonia is a hardworking person who strives each day to provide her three children everything they need. Since she is a single mother, Sonia is exclusively responsible for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts & bottled water

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: María Hilda Del Transito

texts.es: María Hilda del Transito P. de 55 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a vender deliciosos tamales, los cuales son hechos de masa de maíz, en la cual se coloca pequeños trozos de pollo y se envuelve en hojas de huerta de guineo, y luego se cocinan. María vive junto a su hija quien trabaja como profesora, y junto a su nieto de 11 años de edad, el cual esta al cuidado de María. Ella se encarga de elaborar y comercializar los tamales de forma ambulante por diferentes caseríos del departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual también habita junto a su familia. Debido al delicioso sabor de los tamales, cuenta con una cantidad de clientes bastante grande, por lo que la venta es bastante estable, y la cual le permite contar con el dinero suficiente para tener una vida digna, es por ello que María desea contar con un préstamo de Integral, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, hojas de huerta de guineo, leña, pollo y algunas verduras para elaborar más tamales, de esta forma ella podrá mejorar sus ventas y así mismo su estabilidad económica, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para tener todo lo necesario para vivir desea mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Hilda del Transito P. is 55 years old and a cheerful hardworking woman. She sells delicious tamales which are made of ground corn, contain small pieces of chicken, and wrapped and cooked in banana leaves. María lives with her daughter, who is a teacher, and cares for her 11 year old grandson. She is in charge of producing and selling tamales as a traveling vendor in the different villages throughout the Department of San Miguel. María and her family live in this same area. Due to the great taste of her tamales, she has been able to attract a large customer base and maintain stable sales. This allows her to earn sufficient income to have a decent life.

For this reason, she is applying for a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can by corn in bulk, banana leaves, firewood, chicken, and some vegetables for making more tamales. This will enable her to improve her sales and achieve financial stability. Since this is her only source of income, María wants to do everything necessary to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making tamales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of produce like potatoes, maize and cassava to sell

loans.name: María Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: María Alicia del Carmen B. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, ella es una persona muy responsable, alegre y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, lugar el cual vive junto a sus dos nietos D. 10 y 5 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y quienes están al total cuidado D. ella, debido a que la madre resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, por lo que la señora María es la que vela por el bienestar D. los pequeños. Es por esta razón, que el negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación ya que le permite poder cuidar a sus nietos y así mismo obtener el dinero necesario para llevar el sustento diario hasta su mesa. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la tienda, comprando productos comestibles como, arroz, frijoles, huevos, pan y otros más, así mismo comprar detergentes, bebidas y otros productos, los cuales son D. primera necesidad, María posee muchos deseos D. salir adelante y poder brindarle una vida mejor a sus nietos.
texts.en:
María Alicia del Carmen B. D. M. is 60 years old and resides in the town of Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She is a responsible, cheerful, and hardworking person who has a store where she sells basic necessities. María operates her business out of her home, where she lives with her two grandchildren (ages 10 and 5) who are in school. She is taking care of them since their mother lives in the United States. Sra. María is always looking after the welfare of the little ones. Having her business in her home enables her to watch them and still generate the necessary income to proviD. for their daily needs.

María is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store. She will buy food products such as rice, beans, eggs, bread, and other items. In addition, María will purchase detergents, soft drinks, and other products considered to be basic necessities. She has tremendous desire to succeed and proviD. a better life for her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aftandil

texts.en:
Aftandil R. is 30 years old and an internally displaced person from Djabrail town, in the Kharabakh region. He now lives in Absheron region with his parents. He is not married. 

Two years ago Aftandil took out his first loan to buy a second cow. Since then, his dairy business has expanded to include five cows, three of whom are offspring of the original two. Aftandil is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to buy an additional cow. He’d like to expand his small business. Currently, he provides fresh milk and yogurt to his neighbors and local stores, a natural alternative to prepackaged dairy products. 

Aftandil's other job is doing construction work. He hopes that by expanding his dairy business he will be able to dedicate himself full time to his cows.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine A. was born in 1959. She lives in Ijevan city with her son, daughter-in-law and her two grandchildren. Karine works in a military unit as a cook and simultaneously, she is engaged in pig breeding and beekeeping; her son helps her a lot in these businesses. Karine says that beekeeping is very laborious, and at the same time it’s a very interesting business.    

Karine asks for a 450,000 AMD loan to buy 4 or 5 pigs for her farm and to buy wax paper for her beehives.

loans.use: To buy 4 or 5 pigs for her farm and wax paper for her beehives

loans.name: Talex

texts.en: Talex Mamamdov, a 32-year-old internally displaced person from the region of Fuzuli, is single and lives in the Absheron region.  For 10 years he has been teaching children how to play the accordion, and he also composes melodies for the instrument., enjoying both aspects of his work.  With a current total of 15 students, Talex is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy another accordion so that children who do not have their own can also play.

loans.use: To buy another accordion

loans.name: Kyenda Abavubuka Group, Mubende

texts.en:
M. Ssula, a pharmacist, aged 34 years, is hardworking and determined to transform his business and his status as long as he still lives. The married father of two children, with other dependents from his late brother, has been running a clinic and a drug shop of human medicine from Kyenda Trading Centre in Mubende District for close to eight years. From this he has been able to educate his children who are still undergoing tuition at different institutions of learning.

With this loan, Ssula is very optimistic about restocking his business with more drugs and looking forward to turning it into a big pharmacy. This will enable him to earn more revenue and also be able to sustain his family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for his clinic

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen H. is 34 years old, and he lives in Tsakhkunk village, Sevan area. His family consists of his wife, 3 children, his parents and his grandmother. He has higher education in the field of jurisprudence, but he hasn't any experience in his specialty. For about 10 years, Karen has been engaged in farming: he has a plot of land, some cows, calves, sheep and lambs. With income from farming, Karen provides for his big family’s needs and also he further develops his farming. 

In order to increase his family's revenue, Karen intends to organize potato growing, so he needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy seed potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds to begin growing potatoes

loans.name: Kagorogoro Ii Tukwatanise, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
N. Topoista is a hardworking and an ever-optimistic 35-year-old married mother of seven, aged between 23 and 10 years. She operates a growing produce business in Kagorogoro Trading Centre, dealing in dry food cereals. With a business longevity of ten years, she has managed to significantly sustain and improve her family’s welfare status.

To all appearances, Topoista’s future business prospects look rosy with close to 120,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly from her business. She envisions an even greater profit as she gets this loan, anticipating being in position to buy more merchandise for the business. This will enable her to expand her business and also be able to earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

Topoista says that her previous business was selling tomatoes and it's from this business that she saved to start her new business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Kiwojjolo Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
It’s decline of day, the sun is in its twilight zone and the skies are darkening, but 24-year-old M. Irene is still working vigorously at her roast banana stall in Namawojjolo. Her animal spirits, lively nature and energy are reliable stocks in trade she has employed to win laurels from her customers.

The roast banana delicacy is in high favor with many travelers along the road Irene operates next to. The inclination she has towards her job has, over the last five years, played heavily into her hands. With no previous business experience, getting into her stride was a tall order, given the financial drawbacks that she faced at the onset.

With this loan, Irene says she wants to buy more bananas to roast. With increased savings, she plans to buy a plot of land as well as to expand her business. She has benefited from taking loans, since she now owns a cow that gives her milk to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for roasting

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
As a mother, Iluminada’s biggest dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to provide her children with a decent life. In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have access to capital for the maintenance of her businesses. Her previous loans from ASHI were carefully utilized as additional rolling working capital for her tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) transport business and for operating a passenger jeepney (a small bus). The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and allow them to set aside savings for the future. She is requesting a loan of PhP 45,000 to pay for a renewal of city plates (LTO-Land Transportation Office-registration) and purchase spare parts for the maintenance of their tricycle and jeepney. 

Iluminada hopes that her business will become successful someday. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of her four children from college and to see them find a good job. She also dreams of having a store selling poultry feed someday to save for her family’s future. Iluminada wants to thank ASHI and Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan.
