Firyal's son, Ali, finished high school and took a one-year barber's course. Firyal's husband rented a shop for his son so he could start working and help the family cover their household expenses. After few years, Ali, the son, needed new tools, so Firyal came to FATEN and took a $1,500 loan to purchase the tools he needs and improve the shop.

Ali is known for his good reputation, smile, and good skills. Ali appears in the picture cutting a customer's hair.

loans.use: Purchase new tools for her son's barber shop

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 39 years old and an internally displaced person from the region of Nagorno-Karabaka. He lives in the Absheron region and has three children. Azer’s business is a small vegetable and fruit store that provides his neighborhood with produce. Azer is committed to selling his produce at affordable prices to his neighbors. To do this, he must wake up early on many mornings and drive long distances to buy from suppliers with the best prices. 

Azer has been in this business for many years and enjoys it deeply. He first learned about the different varieties of produce when he worked in a Ukrainian bazaar for 9 years.  Since returning home to Azerbaijan Azer has sold dishes and cooking pots. Four year ago he started selling vegetables. He prefers selling vegetables and is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to increase the variety of the produce he sells. This would be his first loan.

loans.use: to increase the variety of the produce he sells

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 44 years old and lives in Baku city. She is married and has two daughters aged 12 and 18. She tutors students in Azerbaijani history and helps older students prepare for university examinations. Kamala works eight hours every day from her home. She loves teaching and thinks that all children in Azerbaijan should know their history.
Kamala is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy books for her students. She would like to have at least one book for every two students. She has many students and so needs many books.

loans.use: To buy books for her students

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 26 years old and single. He lives in Baku city with his parents. He works as an independent contractor and takes great pride in his work. Rustam M. learned how to build from his grandfather, who also build houses. He enjoys working and has many happy customers.
Rustam is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more tools for his construction business so that he can take on more work and expand to work with other men.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his construction business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
EL Señor Luis Avilés López tiene 30 años y convive con la señora Costa Corrales Peña por más de 8 años total tiene 2 hijos dependientes de el, que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser como ama de casa y cuidado de sus animales. 
                                                                                                                                                                                       El señor Luis Avilés López vive hacia el norte de Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Jatun Rumy zona rural, el crédito está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Luis Avilés López utilizara este crédito para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) para agrandar más su producción agrícola.      
                                                                                                                                                              El señor Luis Avilés López nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir más cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficies sus cultivos de producción agrícola (aumento la producción), porque son los primeros de la canasta familiar a nivel Bolivia, a la vez es un recurso económico para mantener la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Avilés López is 30-years-old and has lived with Ms. Costa Corrales Peña for more than 8 years. He has two dependent children who are currently in school. Mr. Avilés López grows potatoes, broad beans, and root vegetables. He sells them at the weekly food market in Colomi. His wife helps him with the farming in addition to maintaining the house and taking care of the animals. Mr. Avilés López lives in the north of Colomi, Segunda Candelaria, in the rural township of Jatun Rumy. He is taking out the loan from CIDRE and he will use it to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) to enlarge his agricultural production. Mr. Avilés López tells us that his dream is to continue improving his economic resources so that his children can continue studying and become professionals. He'd also like to improve his quality of life to live more comfortably with his family. And, finally, he tells us that he will plant his crops on more productive areas because they are the primary component of a family's basic expenses in Bolivia as well as being an economic resource in maintaining the security and health of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Judi Del Carmen

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA  JUDI DEL CARMEN O. A. TIENE 34 AÑOS Y VIVE EN EL BARRIO SAN ANTONIO DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA, LA SRA. JUDI ES CASADA CON EL SEÑOR SANTIAGO BARRIOS CARI Y VIVEN EN CASA DE SU MADRE . LA SRA. JUDI TRABAJA EN LA ALCALDIA DE TARIJA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A TEJER PRENDAS DE VESTIR JUNTO CON SU MADRE , ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN DESDE HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO.                                                                              

LA SEÑORA JUDI FORMO UN HOGAR DONDE TIENE UNA HIJA DE 6 AÑOS Y EN UN FUTURO  SUEÑA TENER NIETOS, ELLA NOS CUENTA QUE LA CASITA DONDE VIVEN ESTA MUY VIEJA Y ESTAN EN CONSTRUCION DE UNA NUEVA DONDE LE FALTARON RECURSOS PARA LA CONCLUSION DE LA OBRA, ES POR ESO QUE AHORA SOLICITAN UN CREDITO QUE SERA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCION PARA DE ESTE MODO TERMINAR CON EL SUEÑO QUE TIENE DE TERMINAR DE CONTRUIR SU CASITA PARA DARLE COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA EN ESPECIAL A SU MADRE.

                                                                                                                                                               LA SEÑORA JUDI NOS CUENTA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES PODER COMPRARSE UN LOTE DE TERRENO PARA QUE SEA FELIZ ELLA Y SU FAMILIA Y NO SUFRAN POR FALTA DE UNA CASA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judi del Carmen O. A. is 34 years old and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Tarija. She is married to Mr. Santiago Barrios Cari, and they live in her mother’s house. Mrs. Judi works in the Tarija mayor’s office, and she also works weaving clothing together with her mother, which they have been doing for a long time. Judi has set up a home where she has a 6-year-old daughter, and in the future, she dreams of having grandchildren. She tells us that the small house in which they live is very old, and they are in the process of constructing a new one, but the family was missing the resources necessary for the completion of the project. For this reason, they are now asking for a loan which will be used to purchase construction materials so that Judi can achieve her dream to finish the construction of her house to give her family, especially her mother, the comfort of a home. Judi tells us that her biggest dream is to be able to buy a plot of land so that she and her family can be happy and they do not suffer from not having a home.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and completion of home's construction

loans.name: Casto

texts.es:
EL Señor Casto C. P. tiene 41 años y casado con la señora Rosa Camacho Calicho por más de 15 años total tiene 4 hijos dependientes de el, que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser como ama de casa y cuidando de sus animales.   
                                                                                                                                                                                     El señor Casto C. P. vive hacia el norte de Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Rodeo Alto zona rural, El señor Casto C. P. utilizara este crédito la compra de un lote de terreno agrícola para agrandar más su producción agrícola.  
                                                                                                                                                                 El señor Casto C. P. nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales y que sean mejor que él, también mejorara su calidad de vivienda para vivir más cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficie sus cultivos de producción agrícola que es el recurso económico para mantener la seguridad alimentaria de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Casto C. P. is 41 years old and has been married to Ms. Rosa Camacho Calicho for more than 15 years. He supports his four children, who are all in school. He is a farmer of potatoes, fava beans, oca [a type of yam grown in the Andes], and ulluco. He brings these to sell at the weekly market in Colomi. His wife helps him with the farming, in addition to maintaining the house and taking care of their animals. Mr. Casto C. P. lives towards the north of Colomi, Segunda Candelaria, in the rural township of Rodeo Alta. He will use this loan to buy a plot of farmland, to expand his agricultural production. Mr. Casto C. P. tells us that his dream is to continue improving his economic resources so that his children can keep studying, become processionals, and be better off than he is. He also dreams of improving his quality of life, so he can live more comfortably with his family. Lastly, he tells us that to plant his crops over a greater area will be the economic means to maintain his family's food security.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JOSE CARLOS C. G. TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD Y VIVE EN LA ZONA DE SENAC EN EL BARRIO LUIS DE FUENTES DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA, JOSE AUN NO ES CASADO NI TIENE HIJOS , VIVE EN LA  CASA   DE SUS PADRES . JOSE DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS QUE TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA DE SERVICIOS DE AGUA CON EL CARGO DE ENCARGADO DE MANTENIMIENTO TECNICO DESEMPEÑANDO SUS FUNCIONES CON MUCHA DEDICACION Y RESPONSABILIDAD. 
                                                                                                                                                            JOSE TIENE PENSADO FORMAR UN HOGAR EN UN FUTURO PROXIMO TENER HIJOS Y NIETOS. JOSE SEGUIRA ACOMPAÑANDO A SUS PADRES PORQUE ES EL UNICO HIJO QUE ESTA A SU LADO. EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO SERA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE REPUESTOS DE SU VEHICULO EL CUAL ES SU MAYOR HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO OUES LAS DISTANCIAS QUE TIENE QUE RECORRER SON MUY GRANDES PARA REALIZAR LOS TRABAJOS DE MANTENIMIENTO DE SISTEMAS DE AGUA.
                                                                      
JOSE NOS CUENTA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES PODER DARLES TODA LA COMODIDAD A SUS PADRES PARA QUE SEAN FELICES. TAMBIEN NOS DICE QUE EL PROXIMO CREDITO QUE SOLICITE LO UTILIZARA PARA PODER MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SU CASA
texts.en:
Jose Carlos is 33 and lives in the Senac area of the Luis de Fuentes neighborhood in Tarija. Jose is single with no children, and lives with his parents. For the past three years Jose has worked for an aqueduct in charge of technical maintenance with great dedication and responsibility. Jose has plans to form a family soon and have children and grandchildren. Jose will stay with his parents as he is the only child caring for them. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy replacement parts for his vehicle, which is his most important work tool since he needs to travel vast distances to perform maintenance on the aqueduct. Jose tells us that his dream is to provide everything his parents need to be happy. He also tells us that the next loan he requests will be for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Tusubira Women's Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
45-year-old Sarah K. exudes diligence. For this widowed mother of three, being a stickler for hard work has laid for her a rock solid foundation for short and long term success.

To shoulder her family responsibilities, Sarah has, for the last four years, been plying her plastics-sales business in the heart of Lugazi Town. In a week, she says she makes profits to the tune of 100,000 shillings and with this, she has managed to establish a firm foothold for her business in a highly competitive business genre.

By virtue of this accomplishment, and with her determination, Sarah’s future prospects are looking good. With the support of this loan, she sees herself restocking her plastics-selling shop with items like basins, jerry cans and buckets.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics like basins, jerry cans and buckets for her shop

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Being single and the sole provider of her 44-year-old mother and 15-year-old niece, Merlita M. has enjoyed being productive as a woman. In 2009, she joined ASHI and has received loans since then. Because of that opportunity, she was able to finance a small business vending/selling food. At first, the food she produced was being sold to people in her village. Through her hard work and determination to rise above poverty, along with her family, she tried to build up a savings fund from her small profit to sustain her business. Eventually, her business grew a bit. Now, she is renting a small stall at the public market to display food for sale. 

With the loan she is requesting presently, Merlita wishes to increase the variety and amount of food she sells to supply the demands of her growing number of customers. Then her profit will also increase and she will be able to improve their lives little by little.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina R., 55 years old, is a widowed woman who supports her family by engaging in buying and selling seaweed. She lives in Brgy Dungo-an Manjuyod, Negros Oriental with her two adult children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her seaweed buy and sell business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 28,000.

Marina is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can continue her buy and sell business. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mamacha Rosario - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mamacha Rosario está formado por mujeres y hombres luchadores, alegres y carismáticos que buscan día a día la manera D. salir adelante con sus familias, viven en el distrito D. Huancarani D. la provincia D. Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Huancarani está ubicado a más D. 3600 metros sobre el nivel mar. Huancarani es zona rural como muchas en el Perú donD. la pobreza es extrema y la falta D. oportunidad son  los principales problemas  que atraviesa la población para salir adelante y para el colmo las autoridades muy poco hacen  por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría D. los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios. Entre sus actividades sobresale la agricultura, ganadería y la elaboración D. artesanía que realizan las personas mayores o mujeres pues el resto D. la población diariamente salen a comunidades donD. realizan diferentes actividades económicas como: transportistas D. carros, compra y venta D. madera, elaboración D. artesanías, empleados en actividades D. comercio, servicios y principalmente como trabajadores D. la construcción.

El señor Claudio, tiene 41 años, vive en la ciudad D. Huancarani, es casado tiene  6 hijos y su principal actividad económica es la carpintería y su esposa Virginia se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía. Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera.  

(Los socios Efraín, Juan Carlos y Nazario aparecen en la parte inferior D. la fotografía pues pidieron permiso para retirase D. la reunión).
texts.en:
The Mamacha Rosario community bank is maD. up of hard-working, charismatic, happy men and women struggling everyday to succeed along with their families. They live in the Huancarani district of the province of Paucartambo in the Cusco department. Huancarani is more than 3600 meters (11,800 ft) above sea level. Huancarani is a rural area like many in Peru where extreme poverty and the lack of opportunities are the greatest obstacles that the residents face in succeeding, and if that weren't enough the authorities do little to support them. For that reason the majority of the residents started their own businesses. Chief among these are farming, raising cattle, and making crafts---done chiefly by the elderly or women since the rest of the population heads to other communities where activities incluD.: driving, lumber traD., craft making, business and service employment, but mainly construction work. Claudio is 41, lives in Huancarani, is married with 6 children and makes a living as a carpenter, while his wife, Virginia who makes crafts. Claudio needs the loan to buy more wood. (Partners Efraín, Juan Carlos and Nazario appear in the lower part of the photograph as they asked for permission to be excused from the meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more wood

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Madame Minata  C. est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère 5 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari avec ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire  au  quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Technicien Supérieur de Santé de formation,  elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Elle eu plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière jusqu’à son mariage. Elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus  telle la vente de jus de fruits,  des eaux glacées, des pâtées, avant  d’opter pour le commerce d’habits. 
Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis maintenant  4 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
Dans le dessein de faire face à la demande clientèle,  elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 54 mois. 
Après avoir 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour, acheter 50 mètres de bazins riches et 10 pièces de pagnes wax.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou. Madame Minata  C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (payement des factures d’électricité, savons et médicaments). 
Son ambition est  de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Minata C. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in the Médine district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Trained as a higher healthcare technician, she very soon started off in commerce with her mother, who used to sell condiments. She has had several years of apprenticeship at her mother's side until her marriage. Minata ran several revenue-generating businesses, such as selling fruit juices, ice water, and pâtées, before opting for the clothing business. She has been in this business for four years now and enjoys a large customer base and great recognition. With plans to address customer demand, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 54 months. After three solidarity loans and three individual loans, all repaid, she is on her fourth individual loan. She plans on using it for buying 50 meters of riche damask fabrics and 10 bolts of wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She stocks up locally in Ségou. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed of women and men. Minata hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will enable her to meet certain expenses (paying the electricity bill, soap, and medicines). Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing to sell

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Rokiatou C. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari avec ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle  au  quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Rokia a abandonné l’école en classe de 7ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier par volonté parentale. Elle commença tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait les articles divers de commerce et cela jusqu’à son mariage. Elle mena plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus avant  de choisir de s’installer dans le commerce de l’achat vente de chaussures. Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis 6 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Elle tient place en plein cœur du marché Château, dans une position qui lui permet de réaliser de bon chiffre d’affaire journalier.  
 Dans le dessein  de diversifier et de faire face à la demande clientèle,  elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est en relation depuis 12 mois. Après 2 prêts solidaires tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 30 paquets de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Madame Rokiatou C.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA,qui lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (habillement, savons et médicaments). Son ambition est  d’ouvrir une boutique d’habits et de chaussures.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokiatou C. is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family in the Pelengana Nord district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She dropped out of school in the 7th grade (education system of Mali) to get married according to the wishes of her parents. She soon started a business with her mother, who used to sell various commercial goods until her marriage. Rokia ran several revenue-generating businesses before settling on the buying and selling of shoes. She has been in this business for six years and enjoys a large customer base and great recognition. She has a place right in the middle of the Château market that allows her to achieve good daily sales. With plans to diversify and to cope with customer demand, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for twelve months. After two solidarity loans, all repaid, she is on her first individual loan. She plans on using this loan to buy 30 packets of shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells to a customer base composed mostly of women. Rokia plans on making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will enable her to meet certain expenses (clothing, soap, medicine). Her ambition is to open a store for clothing and shoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibrahim Dembélé  est marié à une femme et  père de 4 enfants. Il est né à Koutiala vers 1980, une des préfecture de Sikasso (3eme région administrative de la république du Mali).  Il vit à Loulouni ville dans une famille monogame.
Après des années d’apprentissage auprès d’un maître en construction métallique en Côte d’Ivoire, Ibrahim revient au pays natal pour s’installer à son propre compte.
Il y’a maintenant sept ans, qu’il fait des prestations de services, telles la confection de portes, fenêtres, chaises métalliques etc). Il est très sollicité et apprécié pour la qualité de ses prestations qu’il accomplit avec réussite compte tenu  de son expérience à la matière.
Ibrahim Dembélé est à sa première collaboration avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et souhaite maintenir cette relation afin de mieux  satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroitre. 
Il compte utiliser son prêt pour s’équiper en achetant, un ciseau et un équipement qui permet de plier les feuilles de tôles noires pour le bon déroulement de ses activités. 
Il s’approvisionnera en république de Côte d’Ivoire où le coût reviendra moins cher dans les quincailleries spécialisées en équipements de construction métalliques. Il confectionne et répare les portes, fenêtres etc, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  
Il  espère avec ce prêt réaliser  mensuellement 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour payer la location de l’atelier, payer un apprenti et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il ambitionne  avoir le matériel complet nécessaire pour son activité.
texts.en:
Mr Ibrahim Dembélé is married and father to four children. He was born around 1980 in Koutiala, one of the prefectures of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He lives in Loulouni town in a monogamous family. After years of apprenticeship with a metallic construction professional on the Ivory Coast, Ibrahim came back to his country of origin to set up his own business. For seven years now he has been offering services, such as making doors, windows, metal chairs etc. He is much sought after and appreciated for the quality of his services which he performs successfully owing to his experience in the profession. Ibrahim Dembélé is participating in the loan program of the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, for the first time and wants to maintain this relationship in order to satisfy his customer base which is constantly growing. He gets his supplies in the Republic of the Ivory Coast, where the cost in hardware stores specialised in metallic construction equipment is lower. He makes and repairs doors, windows etc. for cash for a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, of which part will be used to pay the rent on his workshop and to pay an apprentice, while the rest will be saved, since his ambition is to have the complete amount of equipment necessary for his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane Dramé est un célibataire résidant dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est très vite initié à l’activité d’achat et vente de téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur,etc.) il y a environ dix ans. 
Son activité est menée dans une boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et surtout de transporteurs. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Il est à son premier prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, à Bamako, 15 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façades, 20 chargeurs, 18 paquets de carte mémoire, 4 cartons de batterie, 2 douzaines d’écouteurs etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Ousmane Dramé was born on October 19, 1988 in Zégoua (at the Mali - Ivory Coast border). He is single and lives in a traditional extended family in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Hamidou Ousmane did not have the opportunity to pursue his schooling. Ten years ago he very rapidly initiated himself to the purchase and sell of mobile phones and their accessories (front covers, batteries, charger, headphones etc…). Hi activity takes place in a shop at the bus station in Sikasso. His customer base is mostly travelers and transporters. He is very much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products. In order to better meet his ever increasing customers’ demand, he decided, a few months ago, to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan and he plans on using it to buy, in Bamako, 15 mobile phones of different brands, 2 boxes of front covers, 20 chargers, 18 packs of memory card, 4 boxes of batteries, 2 dozen headphones etc… With this loan, he is planning to make a monthly profit of 180 000 Francs CFA. It will be used mostly to increase his working capital, to contribute to the family’s expenses and to pay his loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Boré a un peu plus de 41 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Oumou Boré décida finalement de initier à une activité de restauration depuis maintenant plus de quinze ans. Son activité est menée toutes les nuits devant le domicile conjugal à Wayerma I Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses plats alimentaires, diverses et variées. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 5 ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt,  30 poulets, 2 sacs de pomme de terre,   27 paquets de spaghetti, 50kg de poissons frais, 35kg d’haricot, 42 sachets d’attièkè, 28kg d’haricot vert et un stock de banane plantain. 
Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Oumou Boré is little older than 41 and lives with her husband and her seven children in Wayerma I, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, she decided in the end to introduce herself to the restaurant business over fifteen years ago. Her business is in operation every night in front of her conjugal home in Wayerma I Sikasso, where she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her diverse and varied dishes. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five year ago. After eight solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district, she is now on her fifth individual loan. All the previous loans were repaid properly. She plans on using this current loan to buy 20 chickens, 2 sacks of potatoes, 27 packets of spaghetti, 50 kg of fresh fish, 35 kg of beans, 42 pouches of attièkè (cassava couscous), 28 kg of green beans, and a stock of plantains. She purchases her goods locally and accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women, young people (unmarried), and especially night owls. She envisions making a monthly profit of 170,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for increasing her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the restaurant

loans.name: Yèrèye Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Yèrèye sont mariées dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Konodimini, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage, de mariage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers.  
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 7ème cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les six précédents.
Madame Habi Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 barriques d’huile d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en huile à Bamako et  revend en détail à domicile et au marché du village à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Madame Habi Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour épargner afin d’avoir des petits équipements pour agriculture (charrues et charrette) et assurer les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women of the Yèrèye group are all married and live in monogamous families; they are on the average 40 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Konodimini, the main locality in a rural community in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They all know each other as neighbors or relatives and work as vendors of various goods. In order to expand their business capital, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yirwaso and are now on their 7th solidarity [group] loan, having duly repaid the previous six. Mrs. Habi Traoré plans to use her share of the loan to purchase two barrels of peanut oil. She stocks up on oil in Bamako and sells it retail out of her home and at the village market to a customer base composed largely of women, for cash and sometimes on credit. Mrs. Habi Traoré plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African Francs, which will be put away in savings in order to purchase some farming tools (plows and a cart) and help provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing peanut oil [for resale]

loans.name: Djekabaara Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djekabaara sont mariées majoritairement dans des foyers monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers avec la préparation et vente des jus, la vente de céréales, de produits cosmétiques, de tissus etc.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Connue sous le nom de Oumou  la Glace à Hamdallaye, Madame Oumou S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ingrédients pour la préparation des jus de gingembre et d’oseille de Guinée : 10kg de gingembre, 3kg de feuilles d’oseille, un carton d’essence et un sac de sucre. 
Pour préparer un jus, elle broie le gingembre et le laisse au repos pendant quelques heures, elle recueille cette décoction par filtrage avec un tamis à maillon faible, elle rajoute à cette dernière du sucre, de l’eau et des essences en fonction du goût de sa clientèle. Ce mélange obtenu est ensuite repartis dans des plastiques et mis au frais. Mais quand c’est l’oseille, elle est d’abord bouillie pendant 2 heures au moins avant de suivre les autres processus de transformation. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et revend ses jus en détail à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et d’enfants, au comptant et à crédit. 
Madame Oumou S. compte réaliser un bénéfice de 27 500FCFA par mois en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour être épargné, payer les fournitures et les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of group Djekabaara are predominantly married in monogamous families with an average age of 35 years and 3 children. They all live in in the Hamdallay community of Segou town( 4th administravtive region of Mali) and they know each other through their income generating businesses at the Chateau market of Segou. This group of women trade in various items, preparing and selling juice, selling grains, cosmetic products,fabrics etc. With the aim of increasing their business and making durable their income generating activities, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle group loan. Known by the name Oumou la Glace at Hamdallaye, Madame Oumou S. intend to use her loan to buy some ingredients for the preparation of ginger juice and sorrel (drink ) of Guinea: 10kg of ginger, 3kg of sorrel leaves, a carton of essential oil and a bag of sugar. To prepare some juice, she grinds ginger and allow it to stay for several hours. She then collects this brew by filtration with a weak sieve link. She adds some sugar, water and some oil to it according to the taste of her client. This mixture obtained is distributed in plastic and allow to cool. But, with sorrel drink, it is first of all boiled for at least 2 hours before following the other processes of conversion. She gets her supplies on the spot at Segou and sells her juice at retail at home and in the Chateau market of Segou to a clientele composed of women, men and children for cash and credit. Madam Oumou S. intends to make an average profit of 27 500FCFA each month which will be used for saving and to pay for provisions and the school fees of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for preparing juice

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de quatre femmes mariées dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, de céréales, d’habits pour enfants, des condiments alimentaires, des pagnes teintés etc.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et d’améliorer leurs conditions socio-économiques, elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement les cinq précédents.
Madame Kadia S.  qui s’est spécialisée dans la vente de céréales est bien connue à Hamdallaye pour la qualité du riz (bien décortiqué et débarrassé des sons) qu’elle propose à sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 6 sacs de riz à Niono avec les riziculteurs en gros.  Elle revend  au marché Château dans un magasin situé en face du goudron au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47 000FCFA qui serait utilisé pour être épargné et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elles ont pour  ambition  d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
This Danaya group is composed of four married women living in monogamous families. Their average age is 37 and they have on average 4 children. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and met because they are neighbors. This group of women sell firewood, cereals, clothing for children, condiments, dyed cloth for traditional African clothing, etc. Wishing to increase their working capital and improve their socio-economic conditions, they joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 6th solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the five preceding ones. Mrs. Kadia S. who is specialized in selling cereals is well known in Hamdallaye for the quality of the rice (well hulled and cleaned of its bran) that she offers her ever growing clientele. She intends to use her loan to buy 6 sacks of rice in Niono, wholesale, from the rice growers. She sells it at the Château market in a store opposite the pavement, for cash and credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. Just like the other members of her group, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 47,000 F CFA which will be set aside as savings and used to cover day-to-day household expenses. The ambition of the members is to be able to buy a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying rice for resale

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allah Kan Dèmè est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou et d’appartenance à une même association des femmes du quartier. 
Elles mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax, de mangues,  de gousses d’arachide,  de popeline  et d’habits  pour enfants à l’image de Oumou D.. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
Madame Oumou D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants. 
Elle se ravitaille à Bamako en gros et revend ses habits à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Oumou D.  espère  réaliser un bénéfice de 28 000FCFA par mois en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des petits besoins du foyer et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Allah Kan Dèmè group is composed of six married women living mainly in monogamous family; on the average, they are 34 years old and have three children. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali) and know each other as neighbors, fellow vendors at the Château de Ségou market and members of the local women’s association. They sell and purchase wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], mangoes, unshelled peanuts, poplin fabric as well as children’s clothing, which is Oumou D.'s line of business, for example. Mrs. Oumou D. plans to use her loan to purchase 7 dozens of children’s outfits. She buys her goods wholesale in Bamako and resells them out of her home and as a street vendor in Ségou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed customer base. Mrs. Oumou D. hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 28,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards everyday household necessities and school fees of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothing [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está formado por mujeres y hombres luchadores, alegres y carismáticos que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Incas de la ciudad del Cusco. Las reuniones del banco comunal lo realizan en el barrio de Cotowincho que se encuentra a 15 minutos de Urubamba en la casa de la señora María. Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios. La provincia de Urubamba  está ubicada a 57 km. al noroeste de la ciudad del Cusco, por la via a Chinchero. Se encuentra a los 2,875 metros de altura, sobre una bella planicie en el valle que separa la Cordillera central de los Andes, de la Oriental; en la margen derecha del rio Urubamba. Los Incas, como grandes conocedores de la tierra, eligieron este fértil valle para establecer sus principales poblados, es por esto que la provincia de Urubamba está formada por los distritos donde se encuentran los principales monumentos arquitectónicos del incanato: Urubamba, Ollantaytambo, Chinchero, Huayllabamba, Machupicchu, Maras y Yucay.

La señora María, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 5 hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender comida, ella tiene un  pequeño restaurante donde vende desayuno y almuerzo, ella se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para preparar los alimentos y después vender hasta las 3 de la tarde, ella vende cerveza, gaseosa y chicha de jora hasta las 11 de la noche. Ella empezó su negocio en el mercado de Urubamba “PAMPOM” y por la crisis económica tuvo que dejar el negocio pero la socia se las ingenio para abrir el restaurante en su domicilio. María requiere el préstamo para implementar un nuevo ambiente de la casa donde va poder atender a más clientes, ella va comprar mesas y sillas.  Ella nos manifiesta: "Quiero seguir participando en el banco comunal por que me enseñan ahorrar y los préstamos son rápidos”, ella tiene dos años participando en el banco comunal y aprendió administrar mejor el dinero y su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Munay Tika” is made up of men and women who are fighters. They are charismatic and cheerful and look for how to get their families ahead every day. They live in the city of Urubamba which s located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas of the city of Cuzco. The communal bank's meetings are held in the Cotowincho neighborhood, which is located 15 minutes from Urubamba, in the home of María. Among their economic activities the retail business stands out and also, services. The province of Urubamba is located 57 km. northeast of the city of Cuzco, going towards Chinchero. It is 2,875 meters above sea level on a beautiful flatland in the valle that separates the central mountain chain of the andes from the Eastern mountain chain, on the right side of the Urubamba river. The Incas, who knew the earth very well, chose this fertile valley to establish their main towns. This is why the province of Urubamba is made up of the districts where the main Incan architectural momuments can be found: Urubamba, Ollantaytambo, Chinchero, Huayllabamba, Machupicchu, Maras and Yucay. María is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Her main economic activity is selling food. She has a small restaurant where she sells breakfast and lunch. She gets up at 4 a.m. to make the food and later sells until 3 p.m. She sells beer, sodas, and chicha de jora until 11 at night. She started her business in the Urubamba “PAMPOM” market and due to the economic crisis she has to leave the business. However, her partner had the idea of opening the restaurant in her house. Maria needs the loan to give the house a new ambience where more customers will go. She is going to buy more tables and chairs. She tells us: "I want to continue participating in the communal bank because they teach me to save and the loans are fast." She has been participating in the communal bank for two years and she learned to manage her money and her business better.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs the loan to give the restaurant in her house a new ambience

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balel est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des foyers monogames avec en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association des femmes du quartier. 
Elles ont comme activités, l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax,  de fruits et légumes tels la mangue,  des draps de lit et divers condiments alimentaires : poudre de gombo, feuilles de baobab, concentrée de tomate, piments, oignons etc. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et d’améliorer leurs conditions socio économiques, elles ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 6ème  cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq précédents.
Madame Sanata T. qui est un membre du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la vente de fruits et légumes et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 chargements de charrettes en mangues, petit à petit, avec les producteurs de mangue des villages environnants de Ségou comme Banankoro, Diakoro et Nèrèkoro. Elle effectue sa vente à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Sanata T. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000FCFA qui sera réinvestir dans leurs activités, servira à assurer l’éducation et la formation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The Balel group is composed of five married women, most of whom live in monogamous households. They average 44 years of age, with 5 children. All are residents of the Hamdallaye de Ségou neighborhood, in Mali’s 4th administrative region. They became acquainted with one another through participation in a neighborhood women’s group. Their businesses include purchase and resale of pagnes, the beautiful cloth wraps that the women wear, bed linens, and fruits and vegetables, especially mangos, as well as various culinary condiments such as gumbo powder, baobab leaves, tomato concentrate, chiles, onions, etc. In order to augment their operating capital and improve their socio-economic conditions, these women have joined Soro Yiriwaso for a 6th group loan cycle, having repaid five previous loans. Madame Sanata T., a member of the group, specializes in sale of fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan proceeds to purchase 20 carts of mangos, gradually, from small growers in local villages near Ségou, Banankoro, Diakoro and Nèrèkoro. She sells from her home, at the Château market, and walking through Ségou neighborhoods. Her mixed clientele pays cash and she also sells on credit. With the support and encouragement of the other group members, Madame Sanata T. hopes to obtain a monthly benefit of 45,000 CFA which will be reinvested in group activities and will help assure the education and training of their children.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de serigrafía. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio en un espacio muy pequeño de su humilde vivienda, pues siempre está pendiente de sus 3 hijos y como buen padre les ayuda en lo que sea necesario y en lo que él puede, por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos a su familia, a pesar de ser una persona muy humilde es muy trabajador. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pinturas, mantas, tinta, mecate, alambre entre otras cosas. Sueña con ser un gran empresario y ampliar su negocio aun más.
texts.en:
Rolando is 46 years old and he has been working in the silk screen-printing business for more than 13 years. He started working in a very small space in his humble house, as he always takes care of his 3 children and, as every good father, he helps them providing for what they need and any way he can; this is why he is constantly working to improve the income of his family, in spite of being a humble and hard-working man. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy core materials like paints, fabrics, inks, ropes and wires among other things. His dream is to become a big entrepreneur and thus expand his business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers, les condiments alimentaires, les vêtements, les céréales etc.
Pour pouvoir pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus et augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont adhéré  au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire. Les deux premiers ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame Awa Bouaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires en gros au grand marché de Ségou  (poudre de feuilles de baobab, sel de cuisine, piment, poivre, poudre de Sounbala, etc.) 
Elle les revend en détail sur une table au centre du marché Château de Ségou, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Awa Bouaré compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000FCFA par mois en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour être épargné et réinvestis dans leurs activités afin d’augmenter au jour le jour leurs fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women in the Djiguiya group are all married in monogamous families, and on average are 38 years old with four children. They all live in the Hamdallaye borough of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali), and became acquainted as neighbours and through their revenue-generating activities at the Ségou Castle market. This group of women sells a variety of goods: food condiments, clothing, grain cereals, etc. In order to perpetuate their revenue-generating activities and increase their working capital, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso credit loan program. They are now requesting a third group loan, having reimbursed the two preceding ones without any difficulties. Mrs. Awa Bouaré will use her loan to buy food condiments wholesale at Ségou’s main market (powdered baobab leaves, kitchen salt, chilli peppers, pepper, Sounbala powder, etc.). She retails her products at a stand in the centre of the Ségou Castle market, for cash or credit, to mainly women customers. Mrs. Awa Bouaré hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 30,000 FCFA, which will be put into savings and reinvested in their commercial activities to increase day-by-day their working capital.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Rufine Sèna

texts.fr: A. Rufine Sèna est née le 07 Décembre 1986 et est mariée à AGOSSOU Luc, un informaticien. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a près de six ans que Rufine Sèna s'est installée à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Rufine Sèna supporte avec son mari, les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Rufine Sèna n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis quatre ans, Rufine Sèna achète des sacs qu'elle vend au marché de Cocotomey. Rufine Sèna achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Rufine Sèna sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Rufine Sèna a bien effectué le remboursement de son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Rufine Sèna A. was born on December 07, 1986. She is married to Luc Agossou, a computer technician. The couple have two children who attend school. For the past six years Rufine Sèna has lived with her husband and children in the community of Aborney Calayi, in Cocotorney. The income she earns, along with that of her husband, are used to meet the family's expenses. Rufine Sèna did not attend school. For four years she has been buying hand bags which she resells at the market in Cocotorney. Rufine buys her supplies in Lome, Togo and at the Dantokpa international market of Benin. This is the second loan that she has made with ALIDe. The loan will be used to increase the size of her business to better meet the needs of her clientele. Rufine Sèna has successfully repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of hand bags for resale

loans.name: Maxima Del Carmen

texts.es: Máxima del Carmen tiene 37 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de prendas de plata y oro. Hace más de 6 años que dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda para el desarrollo de su actividad. Inicio desde muy joven pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida para mantener a su familia.  Máxima es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y quiere mejorar su negocio cada vez más. Solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar la compra de oro, pulseras, anillos, aretes y cadenas.
texts.en:
Máxima del Carmen is 37 years old. She has been selling silver and golden objects for 6 years and this is not the first time she has been requesting a loan, as this system has been of great help for the development of her business. She started at a young age, as she has always liked working and earning her own money in order to sustain her family. Máxima is a very enterprising and hard-working woman, always willing to improve her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more gold and more products such as bracelets, rings, earrings and chains.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold, bracelets, rings, earrings and chains.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: Zenobia tiene 34 años, comparte su vida con su pareja y sus 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás, pues le da buenos ingresos y la libertad de escoger el horario en el cual hacerlo. Además de esta labor,  se ha unido a un grupo de amigas para dedicarse a la artesanía, que lo realizan por pedidos. Zenobia nunca deja de lado los trabajos que se le presentan, pues es muy empeñosa y siempre trata de salir adelante. En un futuro le gustaría poner un negocio mas estable como un atienda o bazar, pero aún le falta mucho por concretarlos, por ahora continuará trabajando y vendiendo sus cosméticos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 34 years old and shares her life with her husband and four children. They live together in their own home. Zenobia sells beauty products and has been doing so for two years. It provides her with a good income and gives her the freedom to make her own schedule. She has also joined a group that makes crafts from time to time. Zenobia never sets aside work. She is very enthusiastic and always tries to get ahead. In the future she would like to start a more stable business, such as a store or bazaar, but she still needs to solidify her plans. In the mean time she will continue to work, selling her cosmetics. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products in quantity, in order to be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wheat to make bread

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 32 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 1 año se dedica a vender comida en la plazoleta de su comunidad, es así que trabaja durante toda la semana, solo descansando un día. En ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos en el trabajo, pero la mayor parte del tiempo ella lo hace sola hasta el medio día atendiendo a sus clientes, quienes son chóferes que están de paso por su zona. Ha visto que este negocio le es muy rentable por lo que esta pensando más adelante mejorar su local de venta de comida y  extender sus ventas con desayunos y cenas. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP,  será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras de este aporte, ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de utensilios y algunos ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Mary is 32-years-old and lives with her two children in her own house. More than a year ago she began to work selling food in the main square of her community, and this is how she works during the week, only resting for one day. Occasionally her children help with her work, but the majority of the time she works alone until the middle of the day serving her customers who are drivers who pass by her area. She has seen that this business is very profitable and is thinking of improving her food-selling business and expanding sales by offering breakfasts and dinners. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from MFP [Microfinanza Prisma, or Prism Microfinance]. She will be very responsible with her payments and she thanks the people who will contribute to her loan as it will be very useful in advancing her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in utensils and ingredients in bulk for the preparation of meals.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils and ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Afiavi Jeanne

texts.fr: A. Afiavi Jeanne est née le 30 Mai 1975 et est mariée à VONDJESSE, un commerçant. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis cinq ans environs à Hêdomé, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Jeanne assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Jeanne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne mène comme activité principale, la vente de divers articles de mercerie dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Jeanne exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jeanne n'a pas rencontré de difficulté dans le remboursement de son crédit. Jeanne sollicite un deuxième prêt, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en:
Afiavi Jeanne A. was born on May 30, 1975 and is married to Jesse Vond, a businessman. The couple have five children who have all attended school. For the past five years the family has lived in the community of Aborney Calavi. Together, Jeanne and her husband meet the family expenses. Jeanne has never attended school. To meet her many responsibilities, Jeanne's main business activity is selling various sewing items from a shop located in her home. Jeanne buys her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin and at Lome in Togo. Jeanne started this business eight years ago. She has made one previous loan with ALIDe and had no difficulty repaying this loan. Jeanne is requesting a second loan to increase both the size of her business and her operating capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of thread, 10 carton of buttons, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 dozen hair pieces, 15 boxes of beauty products and 8 dozen hand bags

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es: Edgar Antonio tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de reloj. Hace más de 15 años que tiene con esta actividad, esta no es la primera vez que decide realizar financiamientos por lo que él ha siempre el tiene este trabajo que es su medio de vida para continuar generando ingresos para su familia, el ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y quiere mejorar su actividad. El destino del crédito será para la compra de materia prima y comprar una amplia variedad de reloj y ofrecerlo a sus clientes. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edgar Antonio is 54-years-old; his business is buying and selling watches. He has had this business for more than 15 years and this is not the first time he has decided to get a loan. This business is the way that he continues to earn income to support his family. He has shown himself to be an excellent client and a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who wants to improve his business. The loan will be for the purchase of raw materials and a wide variety of watches to offer to his customers. He dreams of growing his business and establishing a grocery store in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa es una mujer trabajadora, desde horas tempranas se levanta para poder palmear sus ricas tortillas que vende día a día,  ya que tiene cinco hijos unos casados y otros solteros, junto a su esposo trabajan para poder lograr equilibrar los gastos ya que todo esta caro, y las ventas se ponen bajas, es por eso que vende también cuajada y pinol para lograr vender mas y aumentar sus ingresos ya que son de pocos recursos económicos,  el trabaja en construcción ambulante.

Con el financiamiento quiere comprar varios quintales de maíz, carbón, aumentar la venta de cuajada para lograr mejores ganancias. Y poder ganarse el sustento cada día digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is a hard-working woman who wakes up early every morning to make her delicious hand-made tortillas to sell. She has five children, some married and some not, and works with her husband in order to be able to pay their expenses now that everything is so expensive and sales are low. Because of this, she also sells cuajada [cheese curd] and pinol [a flavored corn flour used to make a popular beverage] in order to sell more and increase her income as they have few economic resources and her husband works as a mobile construction worker. With this loan she would like to purchase several quintals [100 pound weight measure] of maize and charcoal. She would also like to increase sales of cuajada [cheese curd] to achieve better profits and be able to make a living to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several quintals [100 lbs] of maize to produce more tortillas and pinol [corn flour for beverages]

loans.name: Tarcicia

texts.es: Tarcicia tiene 62 años, comparte su vida con sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. muy joven se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, actividad que le ha enseñado sus padres, ahora es parte D. su vida y lo transmite a sus hijos, quienes la ayudan en el trabajo. En la actualidad se dedica a criar animales como vacas, para comercializar su leche y ovejas para venderlos durante los días sábados en la feria ganadera D. su zona. D. esa manera ha logrado obtener sus ganancias, y por tal motivo ha decidió aumentar la cantidad D. animales que tiene. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP,  será muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras D. este aporte ya que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito, invertirá en la compra D. más ovejas para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Tarcicia is 62 years old, and shares her life with her 5 children in her own home. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young; her parents taught her these skills. Now it is part of her life, and she is teaching it to her own children, who help her with her work. Currently she is raising animals such as cows, to sell their milk, and sheep, to sell on Saturdays in the livestock market in her area. In this way she has managed to generate an income, and for this reason she has decided to increase the quantity of animals that she has. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP. She will be responsible with her payments, and is grateful to the people who will be providing this support, since it will help her to make progress with her business. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of more sheep to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam A. est une femme âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à Dayes, une ville située sur l'une des montagnes de Kpalimé, elle est revendeuse de produits de beauté et des habits des enfants, elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 5 ans. Enyonam vend des produits comme les parfums, les pommades, les déodorants, les talcs et autres. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait acheter des produits de beauté afin d’agrandir son étalage, avec les bénéfices réalisés, Enyonam souhaiterait assurer les besoins de ses enfants sur le plan éducatif et sur le plan sanitaire.
texts.en:
Enyonam A., 37, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Dayes, a town situated in the Kpalimé mountains. She sells cosmetics and children's clothing and she has been doing this for 5 years. Enyonam sells such items as perfumes, pomades, deodorants, talc, etc. With this loan she wants to buy cosmetics to expand her offering, and with the profit, Enyonam would like to cover her children's needs in terms of education and healthcare.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and baby clothes

loans.name: Massa

texts.fr: Massa  E. est une femme de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite à Dayes une ville située sur l'une des montagnes de Kpalimé, elle est revendeuse des produits alimentaires comme savons, sucres, tomates en boîtes, de l’huile et autres. Avec ce prêt, Massa voudrait agrandir sa marchandise en achetant des cartons de savons, d’huile,des cartons de sardines et autres choses aussi. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, Massa souhaiterait épargner de l’argent et le reste de son économie ira dans les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Massa E., 34, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Dayes, a town situated in the mountains, and she sells various items such as soap, sugar, tinned tomatoes, oil, etc. With this loan Massa would like to expand her inventory by buying cartons of soap, oil, cartons of sardines, and so on. With the profit she expects to make, Massa would like to save money and also cover some of the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Ccori - Chuspa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CCORI - CHUSPA”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Urubamba, pertenece al departamento y ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. MARINA; ella tiene 34 años, la socia es conviviente, ella estudió solo en el colegio primaria y secundaria, tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia tiene un taller de costura  en su casa, ella acondicionó un pequeño espacio para poner su máquina de coser y un exhibidor de prendas que ella misma elaboró, su conyugué compra y vende madera, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para su costurería, como hilos y telas. Nuestros otros socios comparten sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la artesanía, servicio de moto taxis, docencia, albañilería, abarrotes y compra y venta de animales menores.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank "CCORI-CHUSPA." They live in the Urubamba district, in the city and department of Cusco. Marina is a member who is 34 years old. She lives with a partner and has 4 children. She completed her studies only through secondary (high) school. She has a dressmaking workshop in her home. She set up a small space in her home where she has her sewing machine and a display cabinet showing the garments that she has made. Her partner buys and sells wood. She requests a loan to buy material for her dressmaking business such as thread and fabric. The other members are engaged in retail trade, handicrafts, taxi service, teaching, masonry, groceries and the purchase and sale of small animals. The members appreciate and value the support provided through these means, and are committed to making their payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she requests a loan to buy materials for her dressmaking business, such as thread and fabric

loans.name: Sonagnon Jacqueline

texts.fr: D. Sonagnon Jacqueline est née le 03 Mai 1981 et est mariée à VADOCHEDOHOUN Antonin, un agent de police. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leur propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a seulement huit mois que la famille s'est installée à Pahou, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Jacqueline vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges du foyer. Jacqueline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Jacqueline exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Parallèlement, Jacqueline vend des mêches, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier. Jacqueline s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Jacqueline a bénéficié déjà de deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Jacqueline désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et accroître sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Jacqueline sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
D. Sonagnon Jacqueline was born on May 3, 1981 and is married to VADOCHEDOHOUN Antonin, a policeman. The couple are raising three children, two of them biological children. All the children are enrolled in school. The family has only been living in Pahou, in the township of Abomey Calavi, for eight months. Jacqueline helps her husband support their family. She left school at the secondary level and learned hairdressing. She has worked in this trade for three years now. At the same time, she sells hair extensions, cloth and cosmetics in her beauty parlor. She buys her inventory in Lomé, Togo. Jacqueline has already received two loans from ALIDé, and she reimbursed both in a timely manner. She would like to add to her stock of products, and that is why she is asking for a third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 boxes of cosmetics and 8 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
El señor José es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de seis hijos, tiene la edad de 56 años, y para el no ha sido fácil poder apoyar  a su familia, pero hace lo posible para lograr que estén bien, su negocio es la venta de ropa, y utensilios de plásticos el cual lleva varios años en las ventas. Negocio que inicio con fondos propios de ahorros de su trabajo en los Estados Unidos.

Con este préstamo comprara: ropa para dama, caballero y utensilios de de cocina de plástico ya que tiene poco inventario, es por eso requiere liquidez de dinero para lograr aumentar su comercio y proseguir con sus ventas. El cual ha logrado estabilidad en su negocio mediante el equilibrio a través de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
José is the hard working father of six children. He is 56 years old and it has not been easy for him to support his family, but he does what her can to make sure that they are well. He sells clothing and plastic utensils and has been doing this for several years. He started this business with the money he earned from working in the United States. He will use the money from this loan to buy women’s and men’s clothing, and plastic kitchen utensils, because his inventory is low at the moment. He needs this working capital in order to be able to increase his inventory and continue his sales. He has been able to stabilize his business with the help of past loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Reine Fifali Essé

texts.fr: A. Reine Fifali Essé est née le 17 Septembre 1991. Mariée et mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé, Reine vit avec sa famille à Gbodjè dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis cinq ans. Reine a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de son enfant. Reine assure avec son mari, les différentes charges familiales. Reine n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Reine vend des vêtements dans sa boutique. De façon secondaire, Reine vend des sacs et des chaussures. C'est à Lomé au Togo, que Reine achète ses produits. Reine mène cette activité depuis trois ans. C'est la première fois que Reine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un prêt, en vue d'augmenter sa quantité d'approvisionnement et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Reine Fifali Essé was born on September 17, 1991. Married and the mother of one child who is enrolled in school, Reine has been living with her family in Gbodjè, in the township of Abomey Calavi, for five years. She is raising another child besides her biological one, and she helps her husband support their family. Reine only attended primary school. To support herself, she sells clothing in her own store. Secondarily, she sells handbags and shoes. She buys her inventory in Lomé, Togo. Reine has been in this business for three years. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to expand her inventory and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Jeudy
