texts.es: Jeudy A. B., tiene la edad de 26 años, está soltera, y no tiene. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jeudy tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Jeudy A. B. is 26, single, and does not have children. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Jeudy has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO”; Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen cada primera semana D. mes en el distrito D. Huanchac provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Antonia; ella tiene 59 años, la socia es casada, y se dedica a comercio minorista, ella tiene una panadería ubicada en su casa propia, la socia elabora los panes y pasteles en su panificadora; la socia contrató personal para trabajar en la panadería vendiendo y elaborando los panes D. diferentes sabores y tamaños. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar levadura y pagar el salario D. uno D. sus trabajadores. Los socios alternan sus actividades en el servicio D. taxis, cosmetología, venta D. productos D. limpieza y en la docencia.

 Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Sembrando Communal Bank. Our members live in the city of Cusco. They meet in the Huanchac province, Cusco department, on the first week of every month. Antonia is one of the members. She is 59 years old and married. She is a small businesswoman. She has a bakery, which is in her own house. She makes breads and cakes in her bakery. She hired personnel to work in her bakery selling and making different types and sizes of bread. She is asking for the loan to buy leavening and pay the salary of one of the workers. The other members have different activities like providing taxi service, cosmetology, selling cleaning products, or teaching. The members appreciate and value the support that has been provided. Therefore, they commit to making their loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leavening and pay the salary of one of the workers

loans.name: Gaviotas Blancas Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Oliva P. C., un integrante del grupo Gaviotas Blancas, que está ubicado en la comunidad de Ajalpan en el Estado de Puebla en México.  En la foto se puede apreciar su tipo de negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado para dama que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra ropa y calzado. Sus clientas dicen que en su negocio pueden encontrar modelos muy bonitos y económicos con pagos accesibles. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con la seguridad de poder incrementar sus ventas.  Tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el quinto año de primaria, es soltera y tiene en total 3 hijos (1 mujer y  2 varones) de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella ya que los otros 2 ya cuentan con la mayoría de edad.  Quiere este crédito para comprar mayor mercancía y poder incluir en su negocio la venta de accesorios para dama.   También espera que con sus ganancias pueda solventar las necesidades económicas que requiere ella y su hijo así como también poder comprar un mueble donde pueda exhibir mejor su mercancía

María del Rocío García B. es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 38 años, es licenciada en pedagogía, casada y tiene un hijo.  Ella se dedica en sus tiempos libre a la venta de cosméticos.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes. 

El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita  un crédito a CrediComún.  Los otros integrantes son:

Margarita C. L.				Vta. De materiales para construcción
María Robertina C. C.			Vta. De tacos.
Modesta Yolanda P. O.		Vta. De medicamentos.  
María del Carmen B. D.			Vta. De calzado.
Cristina B. F.				Vta. De pan y fruta de temporada.
Laura Ramón González				Vta. De canastas.
Sonia Esther C. Gómez			Vta. De ropa.
Juana Inés C. Sánchez			Vta. De tortillas.
Silvia Rodríguez Márquez			Vta. De comida
Emilia Ramón González				Vta. De canastas
texts.en:
This picture was taken in Ms. Olivia P. C.'s shop. She is one of the members of the Grupo Gaviotas Blancas (White Seagulls Group), located in the municipality of Ajalpan, in the Mexican State of Puebla. In the picture it is possible to see what her business activity is: she sells women clothes and shoes, a business she started 10 years ago. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes and shoes. According to her customers, in her shop one can find cheap and very nice models at affordable prices. In requesting this loan she is sure she will be able to increase her income. She is 46 years old, she completed the first five years of primary school, she is single and has three children (1n daughter and 2 sons): only one of them is economically dependent on her, as the other two have already come of age. She is requesting this loan to buy more products and to succeed in expand her business by selling women accessories as well. She also wishes to earn enough money to be able to pay for her son's economic necessities as well as her own, and to be able to buy a counter to better display her products. María del Rocío García B. is the president of the group. She is a 38 year-old woman with a Pedagogy degree, she is married and has one child. She sells cosmetics in her free time, and she is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. The group is composed of 12 members, and this is the first time they are requesting a loan to CrediComún. These are the other members: Margarita C. L.: selling of building materials. María Robertina C. C.: selling of tacos (meat and cheese sandwiches). Modesta Yolanda P. O.: selling of MEDICAMENTOS. María del Carmen B. D.: selling of shoes. Cristina B. F.: selling of bread and season fruit. Laura Ramón González: selling of baskets. Sonia Esther C. Gómez: clothes sales. Juana Inés C. Sánchez: selling of tortillas (a type of bread). Silvia Rodríguez Márquez: selling of meals. Emilia Ramón González: selling of baskets.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pigs and food and vitamins for them

loans.name: Jessica Leonela

texts.es:
Jessica de 25 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos, por la falta de oportunidades ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en arroz por quintal para venderles a sus vecinos. Al pasar el tiempo ella tuvo ingresos para remodelar y su casa y convertir la sala en una pequeña tienda. 

Ahora ella tiene una tienda de vivieres de primera necesidad, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, el quintal de arroz lo vende a $ 32.00, bebidas a $ 0.75 etc. Para poder incrementar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y bebidas para su negocio. 

Pero en el futuro quiere que su tienda sea una de las mejores en todo su sector.
texts.en:
Jessica is 25 years old, she lives in the urban area of Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil and has two children. Owing to the lack of job opportunities, she had to invest all of her savings into buying rice by the kilo to sell it to her neighbors. In time she has earned enough to restructure her house and transform the living room in a small shop. She now owns a shop of basic groceries, where she works form 6am to 10pm selling rice by the kilo for $ 32.00, beverages for $ 0.75, and so on. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice and beverages for her shop and thus to expand her business. She wishes that, in the future, her shop will be the best of her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and beverages

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo A. J., tiene la edad de 30 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo de 5 años que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Edgardo tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Edgardo A. J. is 30 years old and in a common law marriage. He has a five year old son, who is his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Edgardo has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Jenny Guadalupe

texts.es: Jenny Guadalupe A. de 21 años de edad, es una joven la cual se destaca por ser muy responsable tanto como madre como mujer de hogar. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Jenny posee una venta de sandalias la cual esta ubicada en el mercado regional de La Libertad, en donde desde hace 3 años se dedica a este oficio, pero debido a la creciente competencia en el mercado, Jenny ha tratado de ir invirtiendo en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico y otros más, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias. Es por esta razón que Jenny solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más sandalias, y así mismo comprar fardos de papel higiénico, granos básicos, aceite, salsas y consomés por mayor y así mismo surtir el negocio con otros productos más, todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma crecer como comerciante y así mismo mejorar la economía de su hogar y poder brindarle todo lo mejor y lo más necesario a su pequeño hijo, lo cual es lo primordial en su vida.
texts.en:
Jenny Guadalupe A. is 21 years old. She is a young woman standing out both as a very good mother and as a very good housewife. She lives with her husband, who is a trader, and her 2-year-old son. Jenny owns a sandals shop located in the La Libertad (Freedom) regional market, and she has been working in this business for the past 3 years. Owing to the growing competition in the market, however, Jenny has tried to invest in the sale of basic groceries such as: rice, beans, oil, toilet paper and so on, in order to earn more money. For this reason Jenny is requesting a loan: she will use it to buy more sandals as well as wholesale bundles of toilet paper, basic grains, oil, dressings, sauce and consommés, thus supplying her shop with more products. In doing so, her wish is to improve her income, to grow as a trader and improve the economy of her family and offer the best and most necessary commodities to her young son, the most important thing of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and basic groceries

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es:
Don Pedro es padre de familia de cuatro hijos, tiene la edad de 58 años, ha trabajado  mucho para lograr sacar a delante a su familia, hoy en día trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace varios años,  su salario es poco pero es un trabajo fijo, ya que la situación económica no ha marchado bien, lo que los empleos están escasos. Hace años le toco viajar al país de Costa Rica buscando un  trabajo para poder alimentar a sus hijos. En donde trabajo en las bananeras para poder mandar remesas a su familia ya que se le había hecho dificultoso un trabajo en su país.
Con este financiamiento comprara un radio de comunicación  parte de su trabajo para trabajar en equipo con sus compañeros lo que le es de mucha necesidad  esta inversión.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is the father of a family with four children. He is 58 years old and has worked very hard so that his family could get ahead. He has been working as a security guard for several years now. His salary is small but it is a steady job, and now that the economic situation has not been good, jobs are scarce. Years ago, he traveled to Costa Rica looking for a job so he could feed his children. There, he worked on banana plantations so that he could send remittances to his family, since it had been difficult to find work in his own country. He will buy a communication radio with this loan. Part of his job is to work on a team with his coworkers, so this is a much-needed investment.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a personal radio for communicating with co-workers in his job as a security guard

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro S. A., tiene la edad de 25 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Leandro  tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Leandro S. A. is 25 years old and single. He does not have children. He lives with his mother. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Leandro has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
Don José tiene la edad de 49 años, vive en la comunidad Nicaragua Libre, padre de siete hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder cubrir los gastos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.

El señor José trabaja en servicio de seguridad desde hace tres años, su trabajo que ha ejercido por muchos años es el de albañil por cuenta propia. Su salario es bajo, y las mejora de su casa no son tan frecuente por falta de efectivo. Pero lo que desea hacer de mucha necesidad personal es el baño ya que no tiene la comodidad y seguridad e higiene en su casa debido a los pocos recursos que tiene.
Para esto comprara: piedra, arena, cemento para poder levantar su baño de concreto y lograr un mejor aseo personal para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jose, 49, lives in the Nicaragua Libre neighborhood. He is the father of seven children. He and his wife, who sells cosmetics, share responsibility for the family's expenses. Don Jose has worked as a security guard for three years. Before that, he was a laborer on construction sites for many years. He earns very little and hasn't been able to consistently maintain his house because he doesn't have the cash to do so. What he most wants is to build a bathroom, a project that would make his house more comfortable and hygenic, but he hasn't had the resources for it. With this loan, he will buy gravel, sand and cement so that he can build a bathroom for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: Rita Mercedes tiene 59 años, junto a su familia comparte un negocio. Que es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene esta actividad y que ha ayudado para que todos sigan adelante. Sus compras las realiza en diferentes lugares pues todos los días viaja a diferentes comarcas y lugares para ofrecer sus productos, sabe que hay ciertos lugares donde venden ropa de buena calidad, y ella ofrece eso a sus clientes, ropa de buena calidad para que ellos y ellas estén satisfechos. Por lo que siempre está haciendo un esfuerzo por mejorar. El financiamiento es para la compra de ropa de vestir, pantalones faldas, vestidos y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Rita Mercedes, 59, operates a family business selling clothing and cosmetics. She has operated the business for 8 years and it has helped her to pull herself up by her bootstraps. She sells in different places, travelling around from day to day to different parts of town to sell her products. She knows the places where she can sell clothes of good quality so she goes there to meet her customers. She works hard to improve the business all the time. She will use this loan to buy pants, skirts, dresses and other clothing that she will then resell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para ayudar la comunidad

loans.name: Joyas Para Cristo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Alexandra is the coordinator of her group Joyas Para Cristo (Jewels for Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Alexandra is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of running a cafeteria by adding juice to her menu and purchasing the necessary cups, tops, straws and a blender. She will use the profits to save towards her goal of having a chain of cafeterias that she can manage and become very successful. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cups, straws, lids and a blender

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es:
José de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 8 años, para poder mantener a su familia el tuvo que readecuar su casa e invertir sus ahorros en víveres para tener una tienda.   

Comenzó vendiendo enlatados y arroz poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda con la ayuda de su esposa, comprar semanalmente los víveres y trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 20:00pm todos los días. Pero como ya comenzaron clases sus hijos el necesita comprarle los útiles escolares por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y libros.

En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda con mas víveres.
texts.en:
Jose, 34, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children, 9 and 8 years old. To support his family, he had to adapt his house and invest his savings in supplies for a grocery. Jose began selling canned goods and rice and, with his wife's help, gradually built up the store. He buys stock for the store once a week and works there from 6:00am to 8:00pm every day. He now needs to buy the school supplies that his children needs and he wants to use this loan to buy books and other school supplies. In the future, he wants to expand his stores with a wider range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies

loans.name: Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE MOHAMED est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 13 femmes issues toutes du même village et âgées entre la trentaine et la soixantaine d'années. Elles sont mères d'au moins de 2 enfants. Le village héberge un grand marché hebdomadaire d'un renommé régional, ce qui favorise une bonne commercialisation de leurs produits. Cette circonstance a fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue à l'accroissement de l'économie dans le village et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses initiatives économiques et de diversifier ses activités commerciales. Leurs activités tournent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

La présidente du groupe, Madame Mbène S., à l’extrême droit de la photo en tenue blanche raillée de trais croisés en marron, est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont une fille de 14 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce depuis plus de 20 ans, elle vend divers produits culinaires sur table au marché du village et au jour de marché hebdomadaire, les lundis, elle en profite pour s’approvisionner en marchandises pour la semaine suivante. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra à renforcer sa capacité d’autofinancement. Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The SOPE MOHAMED group came into being six months ago and is composed of 13 women who all come from the same village and are between the ages of 30 and 60. They are mothers of at least two children each. The village is home to a big weekly market which is regionally known, and this allows them to sell their products easily. This circumstance permits commercial activities in the village to be permanent and contributes to the expansion of the economy of the village and that of the surrounding area. The new solidarity group loan will allow its members to bolster their economic initiatives and diversify their businesses. Their businesses mostly involve selling local cereals, seafood, peanuts, and ice cream, in the case of those who have refrigerators. The president of the group, Madame Mbène S., on the far right in the photo wearing a white and beige-striped dress, is 50, married, and the mother of four children, including one daughter of 14. She has been selling foodstuffs on the top of a table at the village marketplace for more than 20 years and on weekly market days (Mondays) she buys her inventory for the following week there. Her new loan will permit her to increase her working capital. With the profit she makes, she helps her husband support their family in terms of food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her working capital

loans.name: Mayra Selsa

texts.es: Mayra Selsa tiene 41 años, su actividad es la brindar los servicios de ferretería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que tiene una gran experiencia con sus clientes que recurren a su local. Es una mujer llena de fortaleza y junto a su hijo ha trabajado, en los actúales momentos ha demostrado que ha puesto todo su empeño por mejorar su condición económica por lo que los financiamientos le ayudan a mantenerlo activo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como lámparas, alambres, inodoros, brochas, llaves y bisagras. Sueña con tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra Selsa, 41, operates a hardware business. She has operated the business for more than 5 years and has gained so much experience that her customers come back to her shop time and time again. She is a strong woman who, with her son, has worked hard to build the business. She has shown that she is capable of improving her economic condition and the loans that she's received have helped her to do so. She will use the loan to buy products--lamps, wire, toilets, paintbrushes, keys and other hardware products--that she will resell. She would ultimately like to own another business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Doña Alberta, de 54 años es madre soltera de 6 hijos, pero sólo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia, aunque sus hijos son mayores e independientes, siempre se ocupan de ella, pero Alberta le gusta trabajar ya que así se siente viva. Desde muy pequeña aprendió el trabajo en el campo, ya que sus padres fueron sus maestros, es por eso que ahora le enseña todas las técnicas agrarias a sus hijos quienes le ayudan en el que hacer diario al momento de cultivar café, plátano y palta. Disfruta mucho su actividad y toda aquella practica que se realiza dentro del campo y cuando quiere agilizar su trabajo contrata operarios para que pueda descansar tranquila y asegurar a la vez su producción. Lo que caracteriza a Alberta, es que siempre es precavida, logrando anteponerse ante el mal tiempo y las plagas que afectan de alguna manera su plantación, pues esta convencida de que una excelente cosecha depende mucho de la atención que le dan. Considera que su labor es bastante rentable porque le permitió adquirir muchos bienes, educar a sus hijos y sobre todo brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida. Para su futuro, piensa instalar un negocio de venta de comestible en su casa, porque son varias las personas que le han propuesto este negocio, en su mayoría conductores, ya que su casa esta bien ubicada. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta gustosa de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, porque está integrado por personas buenas, solidarias y muy cumplidas como ella. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios para retirar la maleza de sus cafetales, además comprará sacos de fertilizantes para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Alberta is 54 years old, and a single mother of 6 children. Only 1 of her children lives at home, in the house Alberta owns. The rest of her children are older and independent. Although they are always trying to look after her, Alberta likes working because it makes her feel alive. At a young age she learned how to farm from her parents, so she has also taught farming methods to her children. They help her with the daily tasks involved in growing coffee, bananas, and avocados. She enjoys her work and all the experience she gains in the countryside. When Alberta wants to speed up her operations she hires workers so that she can rest a bit without slowing down her work. Alberta is characterized by her prudence, managing to prevent infection of her crops by common pests and diseases. She is convinced that a good harvest depends mostly on the work put into it. Alberta considers her work to be fairly profitable because she has been able to acquire many goods, educate her children, and above all provide a good quality of life for her family. In the future, she plans to set up a business selling food from home. Many people have already suggested she do this, because her home is in a good location for the business. This is her third loan with MFP and she is happy to continue working with her group because it is made up of good, supportive and responsible individuals like herself. With the loan she is requesting, she will hire workers to weed her coffee plantation, as well as buy sacks of fertilizer to boost her yield.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire workers and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 08 femmes issues toutes du même village et âgées moyennement de cinquante ans exceptées les deux femmes accroupies Awa Michel D. et Dior S. âgées respectivement de 30 et 32 ans. Elles sont mères d'au moins de 2 enfants. Dans le village se trouve un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce qui fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités s’articulent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Fatou D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou bleu-fleurette est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est très dynamique et ne se lasse d’inculquer à chaque fois un esprit de solidarité de dans le groupe. Elle est vendeuse de produits halieutiques tels des poissons séchés, des poissons fumés, des huîtres et du charbon de bois. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The SOPE MAME DIARRA group has been created six month ago. It is composed of eight women, all from the same village and aged around 50, except for the two women shown seated in the picture, Awa michel D. and Diore S., who are 30 and 32 years old, respectively. They each have at least two children. The village has a big weekly market which attracts thousands of visitors each time. This provides for ongoing commercial activity and contributes to the economic development of the village and its surrounding areas. The new solidarity group will allow the group to bolster and diversify its enterprise. Their line of business includes selling local cereals, seafood, peanuts and ice cream (for those who own a refrigerator). Mrs. Fatou D., the group leader, shown on the photo on the right-hand side wearing a blue outfit with flowers, is 56 years old, married and the mother of nine children. She is very energetic and cultivates the solidarity spirit in her group. She sells sea food such as dried or smoked fish and oysters; she also sells charcoal. With her new loan, she would like to increase her stock in order to achieve a higher income and help improve life conditions of her family as concerns food, medical care and schooling of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering, expanding and promoting the group's business activities

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia tiene 59 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura, hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, para que ella pudiera mantener a su familia, siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y trabajadora. Hasta los momentos, sus clientes llegan a su establecimiento con el fin de encargarle sus diferentes prendas de vestir. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de botones, hilos, tijeras y telas. Por lo que sueña con mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo para generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Nubia is 59 years of age and has two children in her care. She offers tailoring services. She has worked in this business for more than 40 years. She started when her parents taught her the business so that she could support her family. She has always been a fighter and a hard-working person. Up until now, her clients have come to her business with the goal of entrusting her with their different items of clothing. The loan she is requesting is to buy buttons, thread, scissors, and fabrics. With it she hopes to improve her business and increase it so that it generates more income.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Loida

texts.es: Loida, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y empeñosa que es soltera, madre de 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la acogedora casa de su madre. Cuando su pareja la dejó, al principio las cosas se hicieron difíciles, sin embargo su prioridad fue sacar adelante a sus hijos, por eso desde hace un año y medio instaló una tienda de venta de comestibles en la casa donde vive y donde ahora labora sola, sin la ayuda de nadie. Desde entonces aprendió a distribuir bien su horario, atendiendo a sus clientes, además que disfruta mucho la compañía de ellos, por otro lado le incomoda tener que trasladar sus productos hasta su establecimiento, porque el trayecto es muy largo y pesado. Pero eso no la detiene, para su futuro, anhela incrementar su bodega, además quiere construir su casa propia dentro de su misma localidad ya que no quiere alejarse de su madre, también quiere ampliar los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres, donde piensa plantar plátano y café, productos muy rentables en la zona y además son los más solicitados. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta y atenta en las decisiones que acuerdan los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería (productos comestibles y de primera necesidad), para comercializarlo en su tienda.
texts.en:
30 year-old Loida is a cheerful and earnest woman. She is a single mother of three children, with whom she lives in her mother's cozy home. Things were difficult at first when her partner left her, but nevertheless, her priority was for her children to get ahead in life. This is why she set up a grocery store in her house a year and a half ago. Now she works there alone, without help from anyone. Since then, she has learned to allocate her time well, attending to her customers, whose company she enjoys very much anyways. On the other hand, it is uncomfortable for her to transport products to her store because the journey is very long and cumbersome. But this does not deter her. She dreams of growing her store in the future and also hopes to build her own house in the same area, because she doesn't want to move far away from her mother. She would also like to develop the land that her parents inherited, where she thinks she would plant bananas and coffee -- very profitable products in the area that are also in high demand. This is the first time that she has a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and she is showing herself to be very enthusiastic and attentive to the decisions agreed upon by the members of her community bank. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy merchandise (food products and household necessities) to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various food products and household necessities to sell

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Martha, es madre de familla de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 51 años, su negocio es una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años, que comenzó con poco productos, con dinero que su esposo dio. Luego para lograr aumentar su inventario recurrió al financiamiento donde ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual esta contenta ya que es su fuente de trabajo para apoyar a sus hijos.
Las ventas son equilibradas hay días buenos y regulares, lo bueno es que no se deja de vender y lograr pagar sus gastos. 
Con este préstamo desea invertir en granos básicos, lácteos, carne, pollo, golosinas para mejorar sus ventas y seguir logrando la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is the mother of three children and 51 years old. Her business is a a small grocery that she managed to start several years ago. With money her husband gave her, she began with just a few products. Later, to increase inventory, she rethought the financing of her business and was able to grow it; she is please to be able to support her children through her work. Her sales are stable and there are regular good days, which means sales don't stop and she can pay her bills. With this loan, she hopes to purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, and candy to improve her sales and continue capturing clients.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, and candy

loans.name: Gloria  Maria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a su propio negocio, un cafetín que administra hace varios años, en un hospital. Inicio con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos.
Desde horas tempranas llega al cafetín para preparar desayunos rápidos, y vender mas,  con el incremento que ah tenido con la inversión de los financiamientos ha logrado mantener rentable su negocio. A si como ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa con el techo, repello de paredes, a un falta pintar y terminar por completo el techo que le falto capital para poder hacer la obra completa.

Con este préstamo hará lo que hace falta, en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros materiales para comenzar la obra y poder estar mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman. She has her own business, a cafeteria that she has run for many years, in a hospital. She began with the desire to help her husband with the bills. In the early hours, she arrives at the cafeteria to prepare breakfasts and sell more. With the increase she has had with the investment of loans, she has been able to maintain the success of her business. In this way, she has been able to make improvements in her home to the roof and walls, but still needs to paint and finish the roof to complete the work for which she still lacks funds.

With this loan, she will be able to finish the work, purchasing construction materials such as zinc, purlings and other materials to begin the work, and she will be able to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, purlings and other construction materials to finish the roof

loans.name: Marilinda

texts.es: Marilinda, tiene 31 años, está casada con Emilio, D. 46 años con quien tiene 4 hijos, está noble familia vive en su casa propia, ubicado en una zona céntrica D. la Merced. Quiso ayudar a tener mayores ingresos en su casa, por eso desD. hace 5 meses, venD. dulces, galletas, caramelos, bebidas gasificas, productos comestibles y D. primera necesidad, mientras que su pareja trabaja como técnico enfermero. Durante los fines D. semana, ambos van a trabajar al campo, pues poseen plantaciones D. café y plátano. Todas estas actividades son muy rentables, ya que les permite tener una vida cómoda y sin preocupaciones, además gracias a sus oficios compraron terrenos agrícolas, en donD. desarrollan sus cultivos D. manera muy fructífera. Para Marilinda, no le incomoda despertarse todos los días muy temprano porque está segura que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa, su meta ahora es incrementar su producción, además D. construir habitaciones en su casa para alquilar y así generarse mayores ingresos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta porque sabe que podrá continuar compartiendo gratos momentos con su grupo, pues a ella, le gusta laborar con los integrantes D. su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunos productos comestibles que necesita en su bodega, además D. contratar operarios para que dejen limpio su chacra D. café.
texts.en:
Marilinda is 31 years old. She is married to Emilio, 46, and they have 4 children. This noble family lives in their own house, located in a central area of La Merced. Marilinda really wanted to help earn more money for the household, so for five months she has sold sweets, cookies, candies, soft drinks, foodstuffs and basic necessities, while her husband works as a nursing technician. On the weekends, they both go to work in the countrysiD., where they have coffee and plantain fields. All these activities are very profitable, since they permit Marilinda and Emilio to have a comfortable, worry-free life. Besides this, thanks to their jobs they bought farmland where they grow their crops very productively. For Marilinda, it is no problem to wake up very early everyday because she is sure that every sacrifice has its reward. Her goal now is to increase her production. She also wants to build rooms onto her house to rent them out and earn more income. This is Marilinda's third loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic because she knows she can continue to share good times with her group, since she likes to work with the members of her communal bank. With the credit she is requesting, she will buy some food items that she needs in her grocery store, as well as hiring workers to clear her coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store and hire workers to clear her coffee fields

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 39 años, la socia es casada, y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes, La socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar su pequeño negocio Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño bar en la calle meloc y la socia acondicionará un espacio mayor al que ya tiene y lo decorará y comprará nuevos vasos y algunas bebidas. Nuestros otros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el negocio como, prestar servicio de transporte, protesista dental, ingeniero electrónico, secretaria, empleados en negocios de restaurantes.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members are part of the communal bank, “'Banco del Desarrollo,” or, Development Bank. Our members live in the Huanchac province in the department of Cusco [region around the city of Cusco]. One of our members is Eva; she is 39-years-old, married, and has two adolescent children. She is requesting this loan to expand her small business. She has a small bar on Meloc Street which she will convert to a larger space than she now has, decorate, and buy glasses and some drinks. Our other members alternate their different household activities with businesses and jobs such as: transportation provider, dental technician, electronic engineer, secretary, and as employees in the restaurant business. The partners are thankful for and value greatly the support provided by this means and promise to meet the payments on their debts in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan to expand small bar.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Del Centro Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Gardenias del centro” nombre elegido por el gusto que tienen por esta flor. Es integrado por cuatro mujeres y un hombre. Los representa doña María Elena G. A., tiene 2 hijos (que están en la foto), ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos de varios sabores, hielo, paletas y venta de tortilla que vende en su domicilio,  doña Rosa tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta por catalogo, con el crédito  hará sus pedidos en Villahermosa, comprará sábanas, cobertores, toallas, etc. , doña Rosario  tiene 2 hijos, su negocio es la cría de pollos y tiene una galera en la parte de atrás de su domicilio. Los hijos de doña Gloria ya no viven con ella,  tienen una tiendita en su casa,  comprara huevos, azúcar, refrescos, sal, sabritas, galletas, leche, jabón, cloro  y doña Mary Cruz tienen 2 hijos también tiene una tiendita.  


Don Charo, como lo conocen, es el único hombre en el grupo, el crédito lo necesitará para comprar pollos, alimento, vitaminas,  para vender aliñados o en pluma. Además de la actividad, trabaja como albañil, trabajo que realiza en la semana para tener ingresos que le ayuden a pagar  el estudio de sus 2 hijos, ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, es por eso que no quiere que la historia se repita en sus hijos. 

Son un grupo muy unido, alegre, amable  y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo familiar  y se conocen desde hace varios años.  

Agradecen de antemano el gran apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación y KIVA por creer en ellos para otorgarles un financiamiento.
texts.en:
The group, “Las Gardenias del centro,” or, Gardenia from the Center was named for the affection that the members have for this flower. It is made up of four women and one man. They are represented by Maria, who has two children (who are in the photo). She works selling soft drinks of various flavors, ice, popsicles, and tortillas that she sells from her home. Rosa has two children and works selling from catalogs. With this loan she will order from Villahermosa [a mail-order company]: sheets, blankets, towels, etc. Rosario has two children, her business is raising chickens and she has a chicken coop behind her home. Gloria's children no longer live with her. They have a small store in their house. They will buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, salt, chips, cookies, milk, soap, and bleach. Mary Cruz has two children and also has a store. Charo, as he is known, is the only man in the group. He needs this loan to buy chickens, feed, an vitamins. He sells the chickens both seasoned and still in their feathers. In addition to this business, he also works as a mason. This is work he does during the week in order to have income that helps him to pay for his children's schooling. He did not have the opportunity to go to school and as a result does not want history to repeat itself with his children. They are a very united, happy, and friendly group with many different businesses. The group is like a family and they have known each other for many years. They would like to thank the Foundation and Kiva in advance for their support and for believing in them and offering this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of the following products: soft drinks, ice, popsicles, tortillas, sheets, blankets, towels, chickens, eggs, sugar, salt, chips, cookies, milk, soap, and bleach.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, es una agradable mujer, muy dedicada al trabajo, tiene 55 años y lleva 13 años separada de su pareja, con quien tuvo 2 hijos, sin embargo sólo vive con uno de ellos, en su vivienda propia. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y verduras en su  tienda, ubicado en su propia casa. Paralelamente a este trabajo, prepara comida en especial parrilla de pollo, vendiéndolo los fines de semana durante las tardes. Es así que desde muy temprano su  bodega es el primer establecimiento en abrir sus puertas, en ocasiones la ayuda de su hijo. Antes  de emprender este negocio, observó que era muy concurrido y no se equivocó, ahora le es muy rentable, sus ganancias le permiten vivir cómodamente, es por eso ahora que quiere ampliar su local, además se abastecerá de más productos, ya que sus vecinos y clientes le solicitan diferentes productos e incluso pretende vender útiles de escritorio, mercería, perfumería y adornos para el hogar. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y confiesa que le gusta trabajar en su grupo  comunal, porque sus integrantes son comprensivos y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará artículos descartables (plásticos), además de verduras y productos comestibles para la tienda.
texts.en:
Norma is a friendly woman who is very dedicated to her work. She is 55-years-old and has been separated from her partner with whom she had two children for 13 years. Now she lives with one of her children in her own house. She has worked for ten years selling food products and vegetables in the store located in her house. In addition to this work, she also prepares food in a special grill for chicken that she sells on the weekends during the afternoon. From very early on, her store has been the first establishment to open its doors. Occasionally her son helps her. Before opening this business, she observed that it was very busy there and she wasn't wrong, now it is very profitable. Her earnings permit her to live comfortably, this is why she wants to expand her location. She would also like to supply more products as her neighbors and customers request different products and she would even like to offer office supplies, hats, perfume, and home furnishings. This is her third time getting a loan from MFP and she admits to liking to work in a communal group because its members are caring and responsible. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy disposable plastic items, vegetables, and food products for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products to supply her store.

loans.name: Sayda Melania

texts.es:
La Señora Sayda Melania es casada, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, la venta en la misma es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. Debido al trabajo y el buen manejo de su negocio hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
 Por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos sería conveniente brindarle todo el apoyo necesario. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, pan y galletas. Su deseo es aumentar cada los números de clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Sayda Melania is married and has a small store in her home. Her sales provide her gratification since she has a considerable number of customers and satisfactory income. With the help of her husband, she has been able to move forward with determination, hard work, and dedication. By operating and managing her business well, Sayda has turned into a successful businesswoman who is constantly making progress.

Since Sayda has demonstrated that she is a responsible and honest person in all of her commitments, it is appropriate to provide her with all the necessary support. Therefore, her loan requested will be granted so that she can buy basic grains, candy, detergents, bread, and cookies. Her wish is to increase the number of customers that she serves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  “Emmanuel” (significa Dios con Nosotros), por que para ellos es muy  importante poner todo en las manos de Dios. Esta conformado por nueve integrantes los cuales se ubican en la Colonia Cerro del Márquez a las orillas del municipio de Valle de Chalco en el Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Ana María Clara F. Martínez (Venta de manualidades de foamy), Angélica O. García (Venta de pan), Adelina M. O. (Venta de joyería de plata), Gabriela M. (Venta de joyería de pedrería), María Olivia Hernández Hernández (Venta de manteles y carpetas), Ascensión R. A. (Venta de ganado y leche),     América A. R. (Venta de colchas y edredones por catalogo), Paulina V. G. (Venta de zapatos por catalogo y pescado por pedido) y Oliva O. García (Venta de ajos y canela).

Ella es Ana María Clara F. Martínez integrante del grupo, su familia esta conformada por su esposo quien trabaja de chofer y sus tres hijos los cuales estudian actualmente la preparatoria, primaria y preescolar. Ana María se dedica a la venta de manualidades de foamy desde hace año y medio ya que se vio en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y así tener un mayor ingreso, ella elabora dulceros, recuerdos, centros de mesa, basándose en las revistas que compra, ya que no ha tenido la oportunidad de tomar cursos para esto, la venta la realiza con sus vecinos y gente que llega a buscarla por recomendación de otros clientes.

Con este crédito que le ha sido brindado, quiere invertirlo en sus manualidades comprando material como: ojitos movibles, foamy, Silicon, abate lenguas, diamantina, F. artificiales, etc. Los planes que ella tiene para el futuro es poder tomar clases de manualidades e irse innovando y   darles una mejor vida a sus hijos para que ellos puedan terminar de estudiar. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere poner un local para poder mostrar todos sus artículos y que así la gente la conozca.

Emmanuel se siente muy afortunado de que los prestatarios de Kiva estén dispuestos para ayudarlos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Emmanuel (which means “God With Us”) because the members believe it is important to leave everything in the hands of God. The group consists of nine individuals who live in Cerro del Márquez, which is on the outskirts of the town of Valle de Chalco in the State of Mexico. They are as follows:

Ana María Clara F. Martínez (sells foam crafts) Angélica O. García (sells bread) Adelina M. O. (sells silver jewelry) Gabriela M. (sells jewelry with precious stones) María Olivia Hernández Hernández (sells tablecloths and table covers) Ascensión R. A. (sells cattle and milk) América A. R. (sells quilts and comforters through catalogs) Paulina V. G. (sells shoes through catalogs and fish by order) Oliva O. García (sells garlic and cinnamon)

Ana María Clara F. Martínez is one of the group members. Her family consists of her husband, who works as a chauffeur, and their three children who attend preparatory school, elementary school, and preschool respectively. Ana María has been selling foam crafts for a year and a half because she needed to help with the household expenses and generate a better income. She makes party favors, souvenirs, and table centerpieces based on pictures she sees in magazines since she has not taken any formal courses. Ana María sells her products to neighbors and people who have been referred to her by other customers.

With the loan she has been given, Ana María will invest in craft materials such as moveable doll eyes, craft foam, silicon, tongue depressors, glitter, artificial flowers, and other items. Her plans for the future include taking craft classes so that she can innovate and provide a better life for her children that will allow them to finish school. Using her earnings, she wants to open a store where she can display her products so that people will know about them.

The Emmanuel Group feels very fortunate that Kiva lenders are willing to help them succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr Americo,  él socio  es secretario del grupo comunal y él se dedica a las construcciones civiles siendo el maestro de obras, Nuestro socio tiene a su cargo personal de trabajo otros obreros que él los contrA. para trabajar en diferentes construcciones y una vez que le pagan a él este les paga a sus operarios obreros, el socio solicita el préstamo para iniciar algunos trabajos y contratar personal. Nuestros otros socios se dedican al servicio de taxis, comerciantes minoristas, trabajadores en construcción.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor” Communal Bank. They live in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sr. Americo, who serves as the Communal Bank secretary. He works in civil construction as a master builder. Americo is in charge of a staff of workers hired for different construction projects and is responsible for paying them. He is requesting a loan so that he can start some new projects and hire the necessary labor. The other members of the group provide taxi services, operate small businesses, or work in construction.

The members appreciate and value the support that has been provided to them. Therefore, they promises to complete their payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers needed to start new construction projects

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 64 años, está felizmente casado con Marcelina de 55 años, la compañera de toda su vida, ellos tienen 8 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Orgulloso, siembra café, plátano, palta, y piña, en sus terrenos propios,  junto a su amada esposa y con la ayuda de sus hijos, cada día labora con mucho esfuerzo y ahínco desde muy temprano hasta al anochecer, como se lo enseñaron sus padres. Lleva 40 años trabajando en la agricultura y en memoria de su padre y por su familia siente que debe trabajar muy duro para producir en cantidad y en calidad. Lo que más le gusta es dedicarse a trabajar la tierra, pues siente la tranquilidad del campo. Con el tiempo espera construir una casa en la ciudad de Pichanaki, para instalar un negocio de comestibles pues las fuerzas para seguir cultivando se le esta acabando, por eso viene comprando chacras donde cultivar los productos naturales que crecen en esta zona, para heredárselos a sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está contento de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque es muy apreciado por los socios y eso le hace sentir muy bien. Con el crédito que solicita, contratará operarios quienes tendrán que traspasar las plantas de café de su vivero hacía sus terrenos agrícolas, además comprará sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Sixto is 64 years old and happily married to Marcelina, who is 55 years old and his companion for life. They have eight children, but only three still live with them in their own home. He is proud to be growing coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapple on his own land. Together with his loving wife and the help of his children, Sixto works each day with great effort. He begins very early in the morning and works until late afternoon, just as he learned from his parents. Sixto has been farming for 40 years. To honor his family and the memory of his father, he feels he must work extremely hard to produce in both quantity and quality. What he enjoys most is working on his land because he feels the peacefulness of the countryside. In the future, he hopes to build a house in the city of Pichanaki and start a grocery business for when he no longer has the strength to continue farming. Yet he continues to buy land for cultivating natural products grown in the region so that he can leave an inheritance for his children.

This is his third loan with MFP. Sixto is happy with the work of his Communal Bank. The other members appreciate him, which makes him feel good. With the loan he requested, Sixto will hire workers to transplant coffee seedlings from the nursery to the fields. He will also buy sacks of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & hire workers to transplant coffee seedings

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal FUERZA 2008 está formado por mujeres y varones luchadores, alegres y carismáticos que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias, ellos viven en la ciudad del cusco.  Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios como por ejemplos: venta de comestibles, empleado de restaurante turístico, policía nacional, lavado de carros, docente, venta de leña, pollería, videos juegos y panadería. Las zonas más pobres de la ciudad del Cusco son los distrito de Santiago, San Jerónimo y San Sebastián de donde provienen los socios, ellos no tienen muchas oportunidad de trabajo, los salarios son bajos y  las autoridades muy poco hacen por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría de los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios y con las ganancias darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación. La mayoría de las socias quiere ver profesionales a sus hijos pues ellas no tuvieron esa oportunidad de estudiar y por ese motivo ellas trabajan todo el día y hasta en doble turno.   

La señora Estefanía, tiene 35 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos  y estudio a hasta quinto de secundaria, su esposo Américo es taxista. La socia es una de las más entusiastas del banco comunal y con su carisma hace amena las reuniones, ella no se deja aminarla con la crisis económica y por eso ella se dedica al lavado de vehículos. Estefanía requiere el préstamo para uso personal como por ejemplo la educación de sus hijos. 
   
(La socia T. aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pues llego tarde al desembolso)
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Fuerza” (Strength) 2008 is made up of determined, cheerful, and charismatic women and men who look at each day as an opportunity to move their families forward. They live in the city of Cusco. The following list includes the types of small businesses, services, or occupations the members are involved in: grocery store, employee at a tourist restaurant, officer for the national police force, car wash, school teacher, firewood sales, poultry shop, video game parlor, and bakery. The poorest areas within the city of Cusco are the districts of Santiago, San Jerónimo, and San Sebastián, which is where the members live. They do not have many job opportunities. Their wages are low and the authorities do very little to support them. For this reason, many of the residents start their own businesses and use their earnings to provide their children an education and a better quality of life. Most of the members want to see their children become professionals since they did not have the opportunity to study. This explains why they work all day and even perform double shifts. Estefanía is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She was able to study through the fifth year of secondary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Estefanía is one of the most enthusiastic members of the Communal Bank and her charismatic personality livens up the meetings. She is not deterred by the economic crisis, which is why she dedicates herself to operating a car wash. Estefanía is requesting a personal loan to pay for her children’s education. (Group member T. appears separately at the bottom of the photo, since she arrived late to the loan disbursement meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for children's education

loans.name: Bernarda Del Socorro

texts.es: Bernarda Del Socorro tiene 58 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene esta actividad,  Su madre siempre le dio el consejo en iniciar esta actividad, de esa manera logra conseguir el sustento económico. Eligió vender bolsos, pantalones, faldas, toallas, sabanas y calzado por lo que le genera buenas ganancias para comercializar en mayor cantidad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria pues tiene ciertos pedidos. Desea terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Bernarda Del Socorro is 58 years old and her business is buying and selling general merchandise. She has done this for more than 15 years. Her mother always gave her the advice to start this business, and she manages to sustain herself financially in this way. She chose to sell bags, trousers, skirts, towels, sheets and shoes therefore she generates good profits in order to sell greater quantities. The loan that she is asking for is to buy necessary raw material as she has certain orders. She wants to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Por lo que Ana tiene una gran experiencia con su actividad, por lo que tiene más de  7 años en este negocio, a pesar de las dificultades que se le han presentado ha sabido salir adelante. Ya que el haber proporcionado a sus hijos lo que ellos necesitan como son los estudios,  pues debido a que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues decidió emprender este negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como verduras, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y frutas. Sueña con ampliar su actividad hasta convertirlo en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 33 years old and makes a living selling food. Because Ana has a great deal of experience in this business (more than 7 years), she has known how to get ahead despite the difficulties she has faced. In this way, she has provided for her children's needs, such as their education. She did not have the opportunity to study so she decided to learn this business. Now she is requesting this loan in order to buy staples like vegetables, rice, sugar, beans, oil, and fruits. She dreams of expanding her business until she can turn it into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like vegetables, rice, sugar, beans, oil, and fruits

loans.name: Pachapaccari Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pachapaccari está formado por personas luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias y viven en la ciudad del Cusco.  El nombre del banco comunal “Pachapacari” es proveniente de la lengua quechua y traducida al castellano significa “Amanecer”. Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios como por ejemplos: venta de artesanía, venta de alimento de cuyes, venta de ropa, venta de comida, empleado de hotel, electricista, venta de carne, tipeos en computadoras y panadería. Las zonas más pobres de la ciudad del Cusco son los distrito de Santiago, San Jerónimo y San Sebastián de donde provienen los socios, ellos no tienen muchas oportunidad de trabajo, los salarios son bajos y  las autoridades muy poco hacen por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría de los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios y de esta  manera poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación. 

El socio Cesar tiene 55 años y es el presidente del banco comunal, el es natural de la ciudad de Lima y tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la industria y la transformación de papel, el tiene una tienda de imprenta llamada “Dadis’s Imprenta” en la avenida San Andrés que está cerca a la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco.  El  socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material de trabajo como por ejemplo papel y tintes.    

(El socio Cesar es el que esta levantado la mano).
texts.en:
The Pachapaccari community bank is made up of charismatic, happy, and strong-spirited people from the city of Cusco who are searching day in and day out for ways to come out ahead with their families. The name of the community bank, “Pachapacari,” comes from the Quechua language, and in English it means “Dawn.” Of all their economic activities, retail and services stand out, for example: hotel work, electric work, word processing, baking, and the sale of artisan crafts, meat, clothing, guinea pig feed, and food items. The poorest zones in the city of Cusco are the Santiago, San Jerónimo, and San Sebastián districts where the community members are from. They do not have many work opportunities, the salaries are low in these areas, and the authorities do very little to help them. For these reasons, the majority of residents have begun to form their own businesses to give their children a better education and quality of life. Cesar is 55 years old and is the president of the community bank; he is a native of the city of Lima and has four sons. His principal economic activity is the production of paper products, and he has a print shop called “Dadi’s Imprenta” on San Andrés Avenue, which is close to the Plaza de Armas in the city of Cusco. He is requesting this loan to buy more materials for his work, such as paper and dyes. (Cesar is member of the group who is raising his hand)

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials, such as paper and ink

loans.name: Melba Mercedes

texts.es: Melba Mercedes tiene 46 años, Melba tiene 2 hijos y están a su cargo. Su actividad es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, inicio este negocio por su Mama ya que le enseño este rubro como un medio de vida para ella, se levanta temprano para realizar las compras de los granos básicos, verduras, frutas, bolsas, leña entre otras cosas. Por lo que se siente muy contenta con esta actividad. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de mejorar su actividad y comprar los productos necesarios. Sueña con ampliar su negocio para que sus hijos puedan administrarlo.
texts.en:
Melba Mercedes is 46 years old. She has 2 children who are still in her care. Her business is preparing and selling food. She has done this work for more than 15 years; she started her business thanks to her mother, who taught her this work as a way of making a living. Melba Mercedes gets up early to buy her supplies, including grains and beans, vegetables, fruit, containers and firewood, among others. She feels very satisfied with this work. She is applying for the loan in order to improve her business and buy the supplies she needs. Her dream is to expand her business so that her children can run it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Renecer De Ayarmaca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal de “Renacer de Ayarmaca” está conformado por 10 mujeres y 4 varones responsables, alegres y carismáticos, ellos viven en la comunidad de Ayarmaca del distrito de Chinchero. Ayarmaca es una zona rural como muchas del Perú donde la pobreza extrema y la falta de oportunidades son los principales problemas que atraviesa la población para salir adelante. Aquí los meses junio,  julio y agosto son duros, las noches y las madrugadas el clima es helado.  Chinchero se encuentra a 30 Km. al norte de la ciudad del Cusco y está conformado por la zona urbana, 14 comunidades indígenas y dos asociaciones de productores. La población del distrito que según distintas fuentes supera los 10 mil habitantes aún conserva el trueque como forma tradicional de comercio. La principal actividad económica en Chinchero es la agricultura. Poco más de la mitad de los agricultores se dedica al cultivo de papa principalmente. Además, se cultivan en la zona cereales, tubérculos menores, leguminosos, entre otros. Por el lado de la ganadería, destaca la producción de ovejas y el ganado vacuno, y también de llamas traídas de las punas. Entre sus actividades económicas sobresale el comercio minorista y también brindar servicios como por ejemplos: venta de animales menores, venta de comida, venta de leña, venta de arboles, elaboración de artesanía y servicios de construcción. 

La señora Braulia, tiene 46 años, vive en la comunidad de Ayarmaca, es casada, tiene  4 hijos  y su esposo Rafael trabaja como albañil. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos, etc. Su actividad complementaria es la agricultura y ganadería. Braulia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.
texts.en:
The Renacer de Ayamaca Communal Bank is comprised of ten women and four men. They are responsible, happy and charismatic. They live in the Ayarmaca community in the Chinchero district. Ayarmaca is a rural area, like many in Peru, where there is extreme poverty and the lack of opportunities. These are the main problems that the population deals with in order to get ahead. The months of June, July, and August are hard here. It is freezing cold at night and at dawn. Chinchero is 30 kilometers to the north of the city of Cusco. It is comprised of the urban zone, 14 indigenous communities, and two producer associations. According to different sources, the district population is over ten thousand inhabitants. They still barter as a traditional way of doing business. The primary economic activity in Chinchero is agriculture. A little over half of the farmers mainly grow potatoes. They also grow grains, small tubers, vegetables, and other things. In regards to the livestock; sheep, cattle, and llamas brought in from the mountains are notable. The economic activities that stand out are retail businesses and providing services. For example they sell small animals, sell food, sell firewood, sell trees, make handicrafts, and provide construction services. Braulia, age 46, lives in the Ayarmaca community. She is married and has four children. Her husband, Rafael, works as a bricklayer. Her main activity is raising small animal like guinea pigs, hens, and chickens, etc. Her supplemental activity is farming and livestock. Braulia needs the loan to buy more small animals like guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more small animals like guinea pigs

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San N., age 47, operates her own small business planting various crops. She harvests and sells the crops to buyers when they come to maturity. San N. has a life partner in her husband who assists her in growing the crops and also fishes in and around the river for extra profit. The couple helps each other in order to feed their six children since they were young. Two of them now are married and the other four are single. As she hopes for a good result in this cultivation season, San N. is applying for assistance on Kiva to grow crops. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will buy more tools for fishing.

loans.use: To grow crops.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa A. is from the village of Tugas. She is 61 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Alfonsa owns & operates a business venture selling ocean-caught fish. Alfonsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2002, Alfonsa  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfonsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alfonsa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing materials. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Alfonsa from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn A. is from the village of CAWA-CAWA. She is 27 years old. Jonalyn is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling a variety of meats in the local community. Jonalyn is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to start up her meat butchering business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jonalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start up a meat butchering business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia A. is from the village of R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Rogelia owns & operates a general store. Another source of income for the business is the salary of her husband. Rogelia has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rogelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rogelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
