El financiamiento que están solicitando es para la compra de punches, camarones, jaibas, pescado y chuletas. Sueñan con algún día ser el acopio más grande del mercado.
texts.en:
The Grupo Solidario Lucia (G.S. Lucia) is comprised of Teofila and Cristina, both fighters and very admirable. The desire to succeed with their businesses and families gives them the motivation everyday to try even harder. They both sell seafood. They used to be street vendors and took different routes. Now they both know how to manage their business very well. They have a space in the market where they have a variety of clients. They talk to their clients and offer them the best so their clients always return. The loan they are requesting is to purchase crabs, shrimp, crayfish, fish and chops. One day they dream of being the largest store in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Las Margaritas, es un grupo que se compone de miembros que están trabajando día a día para mejorar sus vidas a pesar de las dificultades que deben enfrentar. Ellos viven en la comunidad de Tlapala a las orillas del centro de Chalco, en la ciudad de México. Un grupo integrado por cinco mujeres, decidieron que su grupo se llamara así ya que a ellas les gustan las flores en especial las margaritas por que son lindas. Ellas se sienten a gusto con cada integrante ya que para este grupo es importante el apoyo mutuo que se pueden brindar.

Candelaria B. García  de 49 años, orgullosamente originaria del estado de Oaxaca, con   un esposo que trabaja de albañil y con cuatro hijos ya mayores tres de ellos ya casados y uno soltero. Ella se ha dedicado a las ventas desde hace 20 años, ya que es una persona  a la cual le preocupa su familia y por ayudar a sus padres quienes aun viven en Oaxaca. Candelaria se dedicaba a la venta de comidas pero tuvo que dejar de vender por cuestiones enfermedad, así que decidió emprender un nuevo negocio que no implicara mucho trabajo y comenzó con la venta de productos de limpieza como: fibras, clara sol, pino, cubetas, tinas, sosa, etc. La gente que le compra dice que la atención que brinda es muy buena y siguen comprándole. Los planes que ella quiere alcanzar es poder poner un local fijo para tener sus productos para que no se le maltraten y poder tener un poco mas surtido y arreglar un poco mas su casa.

Los demás integrantes son: Angélica F. Hernández (Venta de abarrotes y cremería), Adela Victoria C. (Venta de pollo)  Teresa M. S. (venta de frutas y legumbres) y María Elena L. (Tienda) y aunque es un grupo pequeño los deseos de superarse son enormes y quieren invertir  para así tener un ingreso mas .
texts.en:
Las Margaritas ("The Daisies") is a group made up of members who are working daily to improve their lives despite the difficulties they must face. They live in the Tlapala community on the banks of the centre of Chalco, in Mexico City. A group of five women, they decided that their group would be called Las Margaritas because they like flowers, especially daisies, because they are beautiful. They each feel comfortable with each other, as the mutual support they offer each other is important. Candelaria B. G., 49, is proud to be from the state of Oaxaca. Her husband works as a mason and they have four grown children, three of whom are married and one who is single. She has sold merchandise for 20 years, as she is a person who looks after her family and helps her parents, who still live in Oaxaca. Candelaria used to sell food, but had to stop because of illness, so she decided to learn a new business that would not require much work. She started selling cleaning products like: fibers, Clarasol, pine, buckets, tubs, sodas, etc. The people who buy her products say that her service is very good and they continue to buy. She wants to have a fixed location to sell her products, so that she is not mistreated and can have a little more stock, and can fix up her house a little more. The other members are: Angélica F. Hernández (grocery and dairy products sales), Adela Victoria C. (chicken sales), Teresa M. S. (fruit and vegetable sales) and Maria Elena L. (store). Since it is a small group their desire to improve is enormous and they want to invest in order to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, eggs, refreshments, cream, ham, chicken, buckets, bleach, cloth, pine, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Cruz Emilda

texts.es: Cruz Emilda tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene que viajar hasta Managua para realizar las compras de sus productos, pues es aquí donde le resulta más favorable comprar al por mayor. Ella recomienda comprar una gran diversidad de productos así sus clientes tendrán diferentes productos que escoger, los cuales vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores e incluso la llegan a buscar a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, vestidos, camisetas, calzado y cosméticos. Sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cruz Emilda is 53 and sells clothing and cosmetics. She has done this for more than three years and she has to travel to Managua in order to buy her products, where it is easier to buy in bulk. She buys a large variety of products, and this way her clients have different products to choose from, which she sells in businesses in her community and the surrounding area, and customers come to her house. Her microenterprise has helped to improve the quality of life of her family considerably. The requested loan is for the purchase of basic materials like pants, dresses, shirts, footwear and cosmetics. She dreams of increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Libra Group

texts.es:
Libra es un grupo que se ubica en la Colonia Toluca en Chalco, Estado de México. María se informo acerca del trabajo que hace Fundación Realidad, y conversando con sus vecinas decidieron formar el grupo para poder solicitar un crédito que las beneficiara con sus negocios. Las integrantes son amas de casa a quienes les gusta tener sus propias ganancias y ayudar con los gastos de su familia, conformado por: Yolanda Román (venta de ropa de niña y bisutería), María Elena Solís (venta de juguetes y bolsas de regalo), Diana Karina Rodríguez (venta de calzado por catalogo) y María de Jesús D. Solís (venta de cosméticos por catalogo).
 
María de Jesús es la representante del grupo, su familia la conforma su hijo que cursa el primer grado y Juan su esposo quien trabaja de chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo desde hace dos años, gracias a la motivación que recibió por parte de su cuñada fue que se decidió emprender un negocio, actualmente ella se siente satisfecha con sus ventas, el cambio de catálogos lo hace cada dos meses y trata de aprovecharlos, la mayoría de su clientela son mujeres. Sus planes son ahorrar parte de sus ganancias para poder comprar un terreno y construir su casa. María planea utilizar el crédito para la inversión de sus productos,
 
Cada integrante con expectativas diferentes, pero con deseos de salir adelante, planean invertir su crédito en la compra de productos que les hagan falta como: bolsas de regalos, juguetes, catálogos, ropa, compra de zapatos, artículos de bisutería y agradecen el apoyo que reciben de Kiva.
texts.en:
Libra is a group located in Toluca in Chalco, Mexico. Maria learned about the work that Fundacion Realidad does, and after talking with her neighbours they decided to form a group in order to be able to request a loan that will benefit their businesses. The members are housewives who like to have their own income and help with family expenses: Yolanda R. (children's clothing and costume jewellery sales), María Elena Solís (toy and gift bag sales), Diana Karina Rodríguez (footwear sales through a catalogue) and María de Jesús D. Solís (cosmetics sales through a catalogue). María de Jesús is the group's representative; her family is made up of her child who is in first grade, and her husband Juan who is a driver. She has sold cosmetics through a catalogue for two years, when thanks in part to the motivation of her sister in law she decided to learn a business. Now she is satisfied with her sales, and catalogues are changed every two months. She tries to take advantage of this, most of her clients are women. She plans to save part of her earnings to buy a plot of land and build her home. Maria plans to use the loan to invest in her products. Each member has different hopes, but they each want to get ahead and plan to invest the loan in the purchase of products that they need, such as: gift bags, toys, catalogues, clothing, footwear, and costume jewellery. They are grateful for the help they receive from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gift bags, costume jewellery, toys, footwear and cosmetics catalogues, children's clothing

loans.name: Nkongoro Goat Rearing Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Hardworking S. Steven, aged 48, operates a livestock business that deals in goat rearing and sales in Kanyampumo in Ntungamo. The married father of three children engages in the purchase of small goats which he grazes and sells at a later stage at a greater price. This has seen him fetch 200,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis that has helped him in taking up his family responsibilities like paying his children’s school fees.

However, in most cases Steven’s profits depend on how much capital he has invested in his business. He is very much into restocking more goats on his farm and thus needs this loan to help him achieve his objective; it will derive him more sales revenue in the near future.

Steven is happy to say that, apart from his goat selling business, he earns additional income from the sale of bananas and that he was a driver before all this transformation. What made him change to goat rearing and selling was because the demand was so high yet nobody could supply promptly. He is really grateful for his loans.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Maritza Felicita

texts.es: Maritza Felicita tiene 56 años, Este es su noveno ciclo con Fundación, ella es comerciante de venta de repuestos y llantas, hace más 17 años y labora de lunes a sábado, vende principalmente a sus familiares, personas conocidas y también recorre por la ciudad visitando a sus clientes fijos, ahora con su nuevo crédito va a comprar materia prima como llantas, repuestos, herramientas entre otras cosas. Para en un futuro le gustaría mejorar la condición de su vivienda que es lo que les dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Felicita is 56 years old. This is her ninth loan with the Leon Foundation. She is a merchant who sells spare parts and tires. She has done this for more than 17 years, and works from Monday to Saturday. She sells mostly to her relatives, people she knows, and also travels across the city to visit her regular customers. With her new loan, she is going to buy primary materials, like tires, spare parts, and tools, among other things. In the future, she would like to improve the condition of her home, because it is what she will leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of primary materials

loans.name: Merline Nadège

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 35ans,célibataaire avec un enfant de 12ans.Elle est dans ce commerce (vente des poissons salés) depuis l'an 2004 et ce commerce lui permet de s'occupper de la scolarité de sa fille.elle est au marché à partir de 8h du matin et quitte vers 16h de l'après midi.Elle a une clientelle très active et variée, car le Poisson salé est  apprecié dans sa Zone D'activité.
Ce prêt lui permettra d'améliorer la qualité de son activité en achetant 10 cartons de poissns salés, 10 cartons de poissons thons, 5 cartons morues,elle choisie toujours les meuilleurs poissons et agrandir son étallage.Pour la croissance de son commerce,elle vend aux prix hors concurence pour mieux attirer la clientelle, elle est une bonne gestionnaire.
dans son quartier et au marché, on la qualifie  de brave femme,elle se bat pour l' éducation futur de sa fille en lui offrant des études à létranger et s'organiser pour améliorer ses condition de vie.
texts.en:
This lady, 35, is single and has a child of 12. She has been in sales (selling salted fish) since 2004, and this business has allowed her to pay school fees for her daughter. She arrives at the market at 8 am every day and leaves around 4 pm. She has an active and varied clientele since salted fish is much in demand in her area. This loan will allow her to expand her business by buying 10 cartons of salted fish, 10 cartons of tunafish, and 5 cartons of codfish. She always chooses the best fish and expands her display. In order to grow her business, she sells at very competitive prices so as to attract more customers. She is a good manager. In her neighborhood and at the market, she is considered to be a respectable woman who struggles to educate her daughter and to allow her to study abroad and to be organized so as to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cartons of salted fish wholesale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  se llama mujeres emprendedoras decidieron ponerle este nombre por que  para ellas el iniciar con un crédito en fundacion realidad fue emprender algo nuevo las siete integrantes son:  Guadalupe vende pollo, Cecilia tiene tienda de abarrotes, Alfonso tiene una herrería, Araceli ella tiene  deposito de refresco, ángel Manuel se dedica al cultivo de maíz, Lorenza ella tiene una bonetería y mercería y por ultimo la Sra. Mayra se dedica al cultivo de maíz todos los integrantes pertenecen a la colonia de la nopalera municipio de Axochiapan  Morelos.

Guadalupe fue la representante del grupo anteriormente, se caso con el Sr. jerónimo Cardoso con el procrearon 4 hijos, ana cecilia Cardoso G. de 32 años, Abiel Cardoso G. de 29 años, Rosalba jazmín Cardoso G. de 25 años y la mas pequeña es dulce Montserrat Cardoso G. de 17 años ella se dedica ala venta de pollo lo vende entero y destazado, vende en su domicilio, nos comenta que le conviene mejor salir a venderlo a domicilio por que lo vende mejor, ella puso este negocio en su localidad  nadie vendía sus vecinos tenían que ir a comprar el pollo hasta el centro y esta algo retirado

Con el crédito Guadalupe comprara mas mercancía para tener surtido su negocio y seguir obteniendo ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida y no sufrir carencias.


Guadalupe nos dice que se siente muy contenta de pertenecer al grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y fundacion realidad, por apoyarlos con los créditos.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women], decided to call themselves that because for them, getting a loan was embarking on something new. The seven members of the group are: Guadalupe, who sells chicken; Cecilia, who owns a grocery store; Alfonso, who is a blacksmith; Araceli, who owns a beverage warehouse; Angel Manuel, who grows corn, Lorenza, who owns a sewing and notions shop, and Mayra, who grows corn. All of the group members live in the Axochiapan Morelos neighborhood. Guadalupe is the group representative. She married Jerónimo Cardoso, and had four children: Ana Cecilia Cardoso G. who is 32, Abiel Cardoso G. who is 29, Rosalba Jazmín Cardoso G. who is 25, and the youngest, Dulce Montserrat Cardoso G. who is 17. She works selling chickens, both whole and in pieces. She sells from her home, because there were no vendors in her neighborhood, and her neighbors had to go buy chicken in the center of town, which was out of the way. With this loan, Guadalupe will buy more merchandise to have a well stocked shop, which will help her make more money in order to have a better quality of life and not suffer shortages. Guadalupe is very happy to belong to the group of enterprising women, and is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva and Fundación Realidad for supporting them with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Imagen (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo Imagen, integrado por cuatro mujeres las cuales tienen valentía,  coraje y muchas ganas de trabajar, además de un gran espíritu de visión y determinación y que trabajan diariamente para salir adelante. Habitando en la comunidad de Ixtapaluca en el Estado de México. Un grupo integrado no por personas desconocidas sino por cuatro buenas amigas desde hace cinco años que decidieron informarse acerca de Fundación Realidad y hacer realidad sus sueños.

Guadalupe A. V. mejor conocida como Lupita tiene 40 años, con dos hijos que estudian preescolar y primaria, se dedica a venta de joyería de plata y venta de Mary Kay por catalogo desde hace 10 años, ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, diariamente sale a ofrecer sus productos con la gente que conoce tanto en la escuela de sus hijos y con quienes sus clientes la recomiendan. Lupita no solamente vende cerca de su casa si no sale hasta donde la llamen para ver sus productos, para ella las temporadas buenas es en fechas festivas y baja la venta en temporada de vacaciones le es muy fácil el trato con la gente porque no es una persona tímida sino todo lo contario siempre tiene una sonrisa. Los planes que ella tiene es que sus hijos tengan una carrera, poder tener un carro rosa y llegar a ser directora de Mary Kay. El crédito lo tiene destinado para la inversión de sus productos como : pulseras, aretes, collares y así tener un poco mas surtido para sus ventas.

Las integrantes son: Ana Karen García Flores, Guadalupe A. V., Clara M. Rodríguez y Eli Ana Gómez C.. Cada una se dedica diariamente a diferentes oficios como Eli Ana tiene una estética, Guadalupe vende joyería de plata y Mary Kay, Ana tiene una estética y Clara vende comida. Cada una con planes y expectativas diferentes pero con deseos de hacerlos realidad y agradeciendo a Kiva el apoyo que se les da a través de Fundación.
texts.en:
The Imagen Group is made up of four women whose bravery, courage, desire to work, and great spirit of vision and determination inspire them to work each day so they may be successful. They are located in the community of Ixtapaluca in the state of Mexico. This group is not made up of strangers, but of four good friends that decided to learn more about the Realidad Foundation five years ago so they could make their dreams a reality.

Guadalupe A. V., better known as Lupita, is 40-years-old with two children -- one in preschool and the other in primary school. She has been selling silver jewelry and Mary Kay products by catalog for 10 years. Because she wants to provide her children with a better future, she goes out everyday to sell her products to people she knows at her children's school as well as to clients that are recommended to her. Lupita not only sells near her house but is often called out for others to see her products. For her, business is good during holidays and slower during vacation season. It is very easy for her to work with people because she is not a shy individual and on the contrary, always has a smile. Lupita has plans for her children to have careers, to be able to have a pink car, and to become the director of Mary Kay. The loan will be used to buy products such as bracelets, earrings, and necklaces so that she has a bit more variety in what she sells.

The members of the Imagen Group include: Ana Karen García Flores, Guadalupe A. V., Clara M. Rodríguez, and Eli Ana Gómez C.. Each one works daily at a different trade. Eli Ana and and Ana Karen have their own beauty salons, Guadalupe sells silver jewelry and Mary Kay products, and Clara sells food. Each one has different plans and expectations but all have the desire to make their dreams come true. They are all grateful to Kiva and to the support they receive through the Realidad Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, catalogs, food, and beauty products (hair dye, shampoo, hair treatments)

loans.name: Imara Yaoska

texts.es: La señora Imara Yaoska tiene 26 años de edad, es ama de casa muy dedicada su familia, pero que también se dedica a un negocio que sabe que le reporta beneficios económicos para salir adelante con su familia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, por eso dedica tiempo para todo lo que ama, su familia, su trabajo, su casa y para ella misma. tambien se dedica a la venta de cd, en su vivienda pues tiene que diversificar sus ingresos. Para ella el mayor sueño es seguir y seguir con su negocio, sabe que trabajando y esforzándose conseguirá lo que tanto ansia, confía en la Fundación, por eso no se rinde en el trabajo. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es con el fin de comprar materia prima y entregar los pedidos que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Señora Imara Yaoska is 26 years old, a homemaker and very dedicated to her family. But she is also dedicated to her business, which she knows yields the profits that allow her to improve her family's situation. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. She sets aside time for everything she loves, her family, her work, her home and for herself. She also sells CDs from here home to diversify her income. Imara's greatest hope to keep her business going. She knows that by working and putting forth the effort, she will get what she so longs for. She places her trust in Fundación, which is why she doesn't give up on her work. She is requesting the financing to purchase raw materials and to deliver the orders that she currently has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
N. Zam highly values that adage that says “hard work pays”. It’s the sole reason why she is always rising with the lark early in the morning to diligently shoulder the duties associated with her produce sales business in Senyi Center, Lugazi.

For the last five years, this happy-go-lucky married mother of five has been selling primarily bananas to earn her livelihood. What has additionally played into her favor is the fact that she has a farming background. She employs men to help her off-load her matooke (green bananas) like she appears in the photo.

Before becoming an individual client, Zam was a member of Kyakuwa Women's Group until her business was booming highly and she graduated to become an individual client. With this loan, she says she wants to inject financial momentum into her business. She wants to buy substantial bunches of bananas that she will later resell to her increasing clientele.

Zam has future plans of becoming a wholesale supplier of matooke in Senyi Landing Site and, so far, she has also managed to build rentals for more income.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 33 años de edad, convive con su pareja y sus 3 hijos, Songer, Roy, y Cirilo de 10, 6 y 4 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Fortuna es consciente de las limitaciones que tiene, ya que solamente curso de manera incompleta la educación secundaria, pero eso no lo tomó como pretexto para no seguir con el sueño que ella tenia, “de poder tener sus propios ingresos con su propio negocio”, desde luego aprovechó los conocimientos y experiencia de su familia y amigos, sobre el cultivo, preservación y extracción de café. Ahora se esfuerza y asiste a charlas educativas que brinda su municipalidad con respecto a la actividad agrícola, con la finalidad de mejorar su producto. Hoy ya tiene dos productos como: café y cacao, dándole buenas satisfacciones personales y económicos, es por ello que se siente agradecido con su pareja por la ayuda que le ha dado durante la etapa de siembra, solo que en temporada de cosecha necesita de operarios, para que extraigan y transporten su producto a los centros de acopio de su comunidad y desde ahí venderlos a un buen precio. Fortunata anhela tener en un futuro muy cercano, una tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de obtener nuevos ingresos económicos, por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además esta contento con su grupo comunal, por la transparencia y puntualidad que ejercen cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá para aplicar abono a sus plantaciones de cacao y café, con la finalidad de mejorar la producción y asegurar una buena venta.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 33, lives with her partner and their 3 children: Songer (10), Roy(6) and Cirilo(4). They all live together in the community of Sirenachayocc, located in the beautiful rainforest of Cusco, where they have their own house. Fortunata is aware of the limitations she has, since she only completed part of her secondary education, but this does not stop her from pursuing her dream of "having her own income through her own business." Accordingly, she took advantage of the knowledge and experience of her family and friends regarding the cultivation, preservation and harvesting of coffee. Now she is working and attending educational lectures provided by her municipality regarding agricultural activities, with the objective of improving her production. Currently she has 2 products: coffee and cocoa, which give her personal and economic satisfaction. She is grateful to her partner for the help he has given her during the sowing season. Only in the harvest season does she need to hire workers, to extract the coffee and transport it to the collection centers in her community, where she sells it for a good price. Fortunata hopes in the very near future to have a grocery store, which would provide a new source of income that would allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time. In addition, she is satisfied with her communal bank for the transparency and timeliness exercised by each of its members. With the loan that she requests she will buy organic fertilizer to apply to her cultivations of cocoa and coffee, with the objective of improving her production and ensuring a good sale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to apply to her cultivations of coffee and cocoa.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
On top of being a vibrant entrepreneur, Joyce is married to a fire service personnel member and together they have three kids from age 6-11 years. Currently, all her kids are pursuing education at primary and junior high school levels. It is one of Joyce’s dreams to support her kids through university education.

Joyce has been selling groceries like candies, evaporated milk, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. for the past three years. Petty trading like sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Joyce plans to invest the loan in purchase of groceries in bulk to meet the demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es: Esta emprendedora joven Rosa Estela es una joven madre de 25 años tiene una niña de apenas 3 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio desde que inicio con su negocio  le ha ido muy bien se siente muy contenta, pues es el primer crédito que tiene  con Fundación espera incrementar su actividad cada día más por lo que está ubicado en su vivienda en donde diariamente es visita por diferentes clientes. Su deseo es tener un triciclo para ofrecer sus tortillas de manera ambulante. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como leña, cal, maíz, comal, bolsas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur, Rosa Estela, is a young mother 25 years old with a daughter barely 3 years old. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She has done this business for more than 3 years, and it has gone very well for her since she started it, she is quite content. With this first loan she has taken through the Fundación, she hopes to increase her business activity more every day, since it is located in her house and is visited daily by different clients. She hopes to have a three-wheel bicycle cart to sell her tortillas as a street vendor. The financing is to purchase raw materials such as firewood, lime, corn, hotplates, and sacks among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Greivin

texts.es: Greivin C. G., tiene la edad de 23 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Greivin tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Greivin C. G. us 23 years old and single. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Greivin has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es una mujer con iniciativa, de 56 años de edad,  mujer que apoyado a sus hijos para que tengan una vida mejor, hoy en día trabaja como cocinera en un colegio desde hace varios años.
Su casa es de concreto y ha ido con los financiamientos haciendo las mejoras, para una mejor seguridad de su  familia. Con este préstamo embaldosara el porche y cambiara varias hojas de zinc de su techo que están en mal estado.
Para lograr una mejor higiene en el porche ya que aun es de tierra, así como poder dormir tranquila sin que se le pase el agua en este invierno.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria, 56, is a woman with initiative. She helped her children to have a better life, now she has worked for several years as a school cook. Her house is built of concrete, and she has taken loans to make improvements for the greater security of her family. With this loan she will tile the porch and will replace some zinc shingles on her roof that are in bad repair, providing greater cleanliness for the porch which currently has a dirt floor, and being able to sleep peacefully without leaks this coming winter.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Oscar Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oscar de 24 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, el comenzó dando recargas telefónicas “Porta” (compañía telefónica del Ecuador). Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación fue incrementando su negocio de recargas telefónicas. 

Para tener una mejor atención compro una cabina telefónica para dar el servicio de llamadas a todo el mundo. En la actualidad a tenido una muy buena rentabilidad trabajando desde las 07:30am hasta las 20:30pm todos los días. En ocasiones vende accesorios telefónicos. 

Para poder readecuar su negocio necesita tener mas ingresos por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar tarjetas de recargas para celulares. En el futuro quiere tener uno de los centro de llamadas mas grande de su sector.
texts.en:
Oscar, 24, lives in a suburban area of Guayaquil. He started selling "Porta" mobile phone recharges (Equador Telephone Company). Little by little, with effort and dedication, his mobile recharge business grew. To provide greater service, he purchased a phone booth in order to provide service to everybody. Currently he generates a good profit, working from 7:30am to 8:30pm every day. He occasionally also sells phone accessories. In order for his business to adapt, he needs to increase his income. Therefore, with this loan, he wants to buy recharge cards for cellular phones. In the future he hopes to have one of the biggest call centers in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cellular cards

loans.name: Lipsia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Lipsia Del Carmen es casada, tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su vivienda ella nos dice que  es muy gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio. Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. Con el trabajo y el buen manejo de su negocio hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso. Y con este financiamiento planea comprar productos como golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, pan y galletas. Su deseo es tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lipsia Del Carmen is married and she runs a small general store in her house. She told us it is very satisfactory and that she can already count on a considerable number of customers, and that the earnings are quite satisfactory as well. Thanks to her husband's help they are getting by through their will, hard work and dedication. Thanks to her work and good management of her business she has now transformed her activity into a successful small business that is continuously growing. With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy products such as sweets, basic grains, bread and biscuits. She wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products for her shop.

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en:
Salifu is industrious and a resourceful man. He is thirty-nine years old and is responsible for a child who is 12 years old. Salifu is married to a seamstress. He loves selling cereals like maize, the business through which he makes a living for his family. 

Salifu has sold maize for the past eighteen years. His experience over the years on top of his good customer service has made him one of the successful maize traders in the cereal market. He plans to invest the loan to purchase maize in bulk to fill the demand. Salifu is an achiever and his biggest dream is to become a wholesaler of maize.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Anta y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar a las socia de banco comunal ella nos manifestó. Yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en comprar en cantidades zapatos y después los vende para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar a si mejorar nuestro negocios. 
Desde ese momento nuestra vida comenzó a cambiar ya que contábamos con un capital, y en ese sentido nos pusimos a trabajar mi esposo y yo así como también mis hijos y desde entonces cambio todo para nosotros tanto en lo económico como en lo familiar, porque desde ese momento empezó a crecer mi negocio. 

Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces  quiero aumentar más mercadería por lo cual necesito el crédito para comprar más zapatos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in the city of Anta and belongs to the communal bank Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta. Upon interviewing the members of the communal bank, she told us: "I have a small business which consists of buying large quantities of shoes and selling them. In the beginning, it was a little bit difficult because I did not have much capital. Then I was presented with the opportunity to belong to the communal bank of the Asociacion Arariwa, which offered us support with monetary loans. This way a number of us could start improving our own businesses. From that moment, our lives began to change because we had a source of capital. My husband, my children and I all started working, and since then everything changed for us, both economically and as a family, because at that moment my business started to grow. Now that my business is growing and I have a source of capital, it is going very well. Now I want to increase my supply of merchandise, so I need a loan to buy more shoes."

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more shoes (merchandise).

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Residen en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propio casa. Claudia sabe muy bien para emprender cualquier actividad dependerá de las cosas que hagas y el esfuerzo que le ponga. Es por ello que se dedica de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao y la hoja de coca y esto gracias a las enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres. Su éxito se debe a la calidad de su producto como la atención que da hacia sus clientes. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio competitivo, esto le da mucha satisfacción por el trabajo que ha logrado hasta el momento. Su prioridad es ampliar su cultivo en otras zonas estratégicas con la necesidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, ya así tendrá buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su esposo y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, además siempre tratan de mejorar nuevas técnicas de cuidado para sus plantaciones, dedicándose desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago de manera oportuna, además se siente fortalecido y seguro con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar una pequeña parcela de terreno y pueda sembrar semillas de cacao.
texts.en:
Claudia is 44 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. They live in the community of Sirenachayocc, which is located in the beautiful forests of Cusco where they have their own house. Claudia knows very well that carrying out any activity depends on the work you do and the efforts you put in. That is why she puts all her time into agriculture, specifically the cultivation and commercialization of cacao and the coca leaf, thanks to the lessons her parents taught her. Her success is due to the quality of her product and the attention she gives to her clients. Generally, her products are sold in the market centers of her community, at competitive prices. This gives her much satisfaction for the work she has accomplished so far. Her priority is to expand her crops to other strategic areas to minimize cost and time. That way she will have good economic results. Generally, she receives help from her husband and together they make a good working team. Also, they are always trying to improve new techniques to care for their plantations, working from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening. This is their second loan from MFP, for which she promises to comply faithfully with the payment obligations in a timely manner. She also feels strengthened and more secure with her communal group. With the requested loan, she will buy a small parcel of land to plant cacao seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a parcel of land to grow cacao.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel Q. A., tiene la edad de 35 años, está en unión libre, y vive con señora y dos hijos, ellos son su mayor prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 4 y 10 años de edad.  El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha, además para pagar la mano de obra. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Miguel tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Miguel Q. A., age 35, is in a common law marriage. He lives with his life partner and their two children. They are his greatest priority. Their children are four and ten years old. He wants the loan to help with his farm. Specifically, it is to help with the coffee crop. That way he will get a better quality and obtain greater income when it is time to sell the harvest. He will also use the loan to pay for labor. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Miguel has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with the coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El señor Augusto tiene 70 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Anta y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar al socio de banco comunal él nos manifestó. Soy chofer y cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en comprar en cantidades zapatos y después los vende para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la unidad de microfinanzas Asociación Arariwa y mi me prestaron por primera vez 100 dólares. Desde ese momento nuestra vida comenzó a cambiar ya que contábamos con un capital, y en ese sentido nos pusimos a trabajar mi esposa Esperanza y yo así como también mis hijos y desde entonces cambio todo para nosotros tanto en lo económico como en lo familiar, porque desde ese momento empezó a crecer nuestro negocio. 

Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces  quiero aumentar más mercadería por lo cual necesito el crédito para comprar más zapatos.
texts.en:
Augusto is 70, married with four children, lives in the city of Anta and belongs to the community bank "Manuela Ramos de Ischucha Anta". When we interviewed him, he told us: "I am a driver and have a small business which consists of buying large quantities of shoes and selling them. At first it was a bit difficult as I did not have much capital; later I was given the opportunity to belong to the Asociacion Arariwa community bank and they lent me my first 100 dollars. At that moment, our lives began to change since we had capital. I and my wife Esperanza and our children got to work, and since then everything has changed for us, both economically and in our family, because that was when our business started to grow. Now that my business is growing and we have capital, things are going well. Now I want to obtain more merchandise, so I need this loan: to buy more shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a hard-working businesswoman who sells earrings, beads, bangles, and cosmetics like make-up to customers in the central market of Kumasi. She is married to a teacher. She is thirty-eight years old and she's the mother of three children from age 3-7 years. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and also supporting her kids in school. 

She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. Dorcas believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful traders in this product line. She plans to invest the loan to purchase assorted make-up to meet the demand. Dorcas is optimistic about the future and she hopes to acquire a bigger shop to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Reside en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la selva cusqueña peruana, donde tienen su casa propia. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, por falta recursos económicos no pudo terminar de estudiar, pese a ello no se desanimo, así que emprendió a trabajar en el cultivo de cacao, pero no lo iba de la mejor manera, hasta que se tuvo que cambiar de trabajo. Ahora la venta de productos en general es lo que se dedica, por ello agradece a su esposo por el apoyo que le dio. Este negocio le está brindando buenas ganancias económicas, además ya tiene una buena cantidad de fieles compradores. En tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero usualmente trabaja sola. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma casa, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio en otras localidades para que así diversifique su mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus cuotas de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la seriedad que tiene cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías, para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Dolores is 44 and married with four school-aged children. She lives in the Sirenachayocc community, located in Cusco's Peruvian rainforest, where they have their own home. Despite not having completed elementary school (due to lack of economic resources, not for lack of encouragement), she learned to cultivate cocoa; but she did not do it the best way, so she had to change jobs. She now sells general products, and she thanks her husband for the support he has given her. This business is providing her with good earnings, and she already has a good number of loyal customers. During holidays, her children help her, but she usually works alone. She sells out of her house, from 5 am to 9 pm. Her greatest wish is to expand her business into different areas in order to diversify her market. This is her second loan with MFP, which ensures that she will meet repayment quotas faithfully. She also thanks her community group for the reliability each member displays. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise, in order to stock her store with general grocery items.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock

loans.name: Yadira Esther

texts.es:
Yadira Esther V. R. es una señora que vive con su cónyuge e hijos en  la municipalidad de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Ella tiene 7 hijos en las edades entre 12 y 30 años, trabaja en la fabricación de fritos y también vende  mercancía variada. Yadira se inició en el negocio de almuerzos desde hace 10 años en Santa Marta, la capital del Departamento del Magdalena, y cuando su esposo fue trasladado a la ciudad de Barranquilla ella decidió irse con él y continuó con su negocio, porque ella siempre ha contado con su respaldo y el de sus hijos;  por eso fue capaz de volver a empezar en un nuevo sitio, donde permaneció por dos años hasta que obtuvo un subsidio de vivienda en Malambo, donde aun tiene su casa y continuó con su negocio de fritos. Como es una mujer emprendedora y empezó a conocer mucha gente, comenzó a vender bolsos, calzado, y artículos para el hogar y también se compró una máquina de coser para poner una clínica de ropa. 
Yadira siempre ha trabajada independiente lo que le permite manejar su tiempo y estar pendiente de sus hijos, junto con su hija de 21 años, aprendió también a trabajar manualidades en foamy, con las que hace figuras decorativas  y obtiene ingresos adicionales cuando hace decoración de productos para fiestas o  embellecimiento de espacios familiares y fabrica artesanias que vende por docenas. 

Se enteró de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y vio una oportunidad para mejorar su negocio, ya que antes cuando necesitaba recursos, buscaba paga diarios, pero aunque les quedó muy bien, se dio cuenta que estos eran bastante costosos y decidió no volver a acudir a estos prestamistas.  Este es su primer crédito con esta organización, por valor de $ 1.000.000 COP, con los que  piensa comprar  25 bolsos, 4 docenas de sabanas, 4 docenas de toallas, 7 docenas de ropa interior y materia prima para los fritos. Su meta es continuar apoyando a su esposo para continuar sacando adelante su numerosa familia, mejorar su nivel de ventas e ingresos para aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Yadira Esther R. V. lives with her spouse and children in the city of Malambo, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She has seven children between the ages of 12 and 30 years old. She prepares fried dishes and also sells various merchandise. Yadira started preparing business lunches 10 years ago in Santa Marta, the capital of the Department of Magdalena. When her husband was transferred to the city of Barranquila, she decided to go with him and continued her business because she has always had the support of her husband her children. For this reason, she was able to start in a new location, where she remained for two years until she received a housing subsidy in Malambo, where she still has her home and continues her frying business. As she is an enterprising woman and she started to meet many people, she started to sell bags, shoes, and household items. She also purchased a sewing machine to open a clothing store. Yadira has always worked independently which has allowed her to manage her time and to care for her children. With her daughter of 21 years, she also learned to create crafts with foam, with which she has made decorative figurines and obtains additional income when she decorates items for parties or creates home furnishing and sells crafts by the dozen. She learned of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and saw an opportunity to improve her business. Before when she needed resources, she looked to the daily pay; although the resources were good, she realized that they were quite expensive and decided not to take part in these lenders. This is her first loan with this organization, amounting to $525, with which she plans to purchase 25 bags, 4 dozen sheets, 4 dozen towels, 7 dozen pairs of underwear and ingredients for fried foods. Her goal is to continue to support her husband to continue to help her large family, increase her sales and income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for fried foods and raw materials for merchandise, such as 25 bags, 4 dozen sheets, 4 dozen towels, 7 dozen pairs of underwear

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Rafaela tiene la edad de 52 años, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, el cual inicio hace varios años con dinero de su trabajo como cocinera, ha invertido en cosmético y ropa, pero luego decide poner su pulpería que ha ido invirtiendo en inventario con los financiamiento que la institución ha dado.
Para mejorar su pulpería, su casa es de concreto aun falta poner el piso aun es de suelo, pero lo que quiere hacer es subir un poco mas el techo ya que es bien baja y produce mucho calor, es por eso la necesidad de levantar mas las paredes para poder estar en mejores condiciones. Para esto comprara, bloques, cemento, hierro, madera, clavos y comenzara  hacer la obra, contenta por que a través de estos préstamos esta logrando un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Rafaela is 52 years old. Her business is a small store where she sells a variety of products, which she started several years ago with money from her job as a cook. She had invested in cosmetics and clothing, but later decided to create her store for which she has been investing in stock with the funding provided by the institution. To improve her store, her house is made of concrete although it still lacks a ground floor. However, what she wants is to do is raise the roof a little more, since it is rather low and generates a lot of heat. For this reason, there is the need to put up walls in better condition. For this, she will purchase blocks, cement, iron, wood, nails, and will began to do the work. She is pleased that through these loans she is obtaining a better roof.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blocks, sand, cement, wood to raise the walls for the roof (which is currently too low and generates heat)

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro tiene 44 años, este no es el primer financiamiento de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  ella decidió realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Empezó Poco a poco incrementando los productos que vendía, así continuo hasta ahora que tiene una variedad de productos que ofrecer.  El brindar a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan le hace sentir muy bien y obtener nuevos clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, vestidos y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Janett del Socoro is 44 years old. This is not her first funding. Her business is selling clothes. As she has always been a fighter and an entrepreneur, she has decided to make home improvements. She gradually began to increase the products that she sold, and continued until now to offer a variety of products. The offer to her clients is to make them feel good and gain new customers. The loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, dresses and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de cartes de recharge téléphoniques, il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. sa clientèle grandit tous les jours parce qu'il a une façon très intéressante de convaincre ses clients.la demande de sa clientèle ces temps est élevée, pour les satisfaire convenablement, il doit hausser son stock raison pour laquelle il sollicite un premier crédit afin de s'acheter des cartes de recharges Togocel, Moov et Illico.
il est marié et père d'un enfant, c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has a revenue-generating retail business selling phone recharge cards.  He operates this commerce door-to-door.  His customer base is growing all the time because he has a very interesting way of convincing his customers.  Recently, the demand has been high.  To satisfy his customers appropriately, he must increase his inventory.  This is why he is requesting an initial loan in order buy some TogoCel, Moov, and ILLICO cards. He is married and the father of one child.  With the revenues from his commerce, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying phone recharge cards

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
La señora Casimira tiene 43 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad  de Inquilpata y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar a la socia de banco comunal, ella nos manifestó. Yo cuento con un pequeño negocio de crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes y vacas, el negocio consiste en comprar animales críos en la feria de Inquilpalta y después los engorda y luego de varios meses los vende en la misma feria para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa, el cual me brindo un apoyo de varios préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar a mejorar mi negocio.
 
Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces requiero el crédito para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos y cuyes.
texts.en:
Casimira is 43, married with two children, and lives in the town of Inquilpata. She is a member of the community lending association called “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”. Casimira maintains a small business raising animals such as pigs, cows and "cujes" (a native rodent). She buys young animals at the Inquilpalta Fair, and fattens them for market over a period of several months. She then sells the adult animals at the same fair for profit. Casimira is constrained by having little operating capital, and for this reason became a member of the Asociación Arariwa, to access loans to build up her business. She has seen her animal raising activities prosper as a result of increased operating capital, which has allowed her to increase the number of animals for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased operating capital to buy additional farm animals

loans.name: Ayelé Mawunya

texts.fr: cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle exerce son commerce au marché local d'akodessewa, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement elle sent le besoin d'agrandir son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 10 sacs de maïs,8 sacs de farines et divers. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
This a woman who has a revenue-generating business involving grains. She operates this business at the local market of Akodessewa and has been doing so since 2003. Her customers include anyone. She currently feels the need to expand her stock of merchandise. This is the reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of corn, eight sacks of flour, and other items. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, flour, and other items

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.es:
Violeta es un grupo que se formo por personas decididas a salir adelante, entre todos los integrantes propusieron varios nombres hasta que por unanimidad decidieron el nombre. Ellos se ubican en L. Colonia Jardín en Valle D. Chalco Solidaridad, Estado D. México. 

ElL. es L. señora Teresa N. D. L. C. representante del grupo, D. 54 años D. edad y con seis hijos ya casados. Teresa solo pudo cursar el primer grado D. primaria y desD. entonces tuvo que trabajar, desafortunadamente  hace ocho meses quedo viuda y actualmente se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos como: tacos, quesadillas, gorditas, venta D. dulces, papas y también renta D. viviendas, comenzó con su negocio aproximadamente hace 2 años ya que se vio en L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso mas, diariamente sale  vender afuera D. su casa y cuando se pueD. va a los eventos que se hacen (bailes). Teresa trata D. vender lo más que se pueD. ya que con este recurso elL. se va ayudando ya que no cuenta con ningún apoyo. Siempre trata D. tener los insumos para L. elaboración D. su comida y así vender por las noches. Aunque siempre se L. pase corriendo con sus ventas trata D. salir adelante. Sus planes son poner otro negocio D. comidas y poder darle una arregladita a su casa. El crédito lo tiene destinado para L. inversión D. su negocio D. antojitos y otra parte para el arreglo D. su casa 

Los otros once integrantes son: EsteL. Díaz N. (venta D. fotografías D. artistas), Ricardo Ramírez Gómez (tienda D. ropa), Viridiana C. Díaz ( tostaderia), Ofelia B. B. (venta D. piñatas). Efrén Martínez V. (venta D. dulces), MariseL. F. Hernández (repostería), Nancy S. M. (maderería), Laura N. Guzmán (venta D. dulces), Yolanda F. Hernández (Antojitos, carnitas), Rene E. E. (venta D. dulces) y Roberto C. M. (venta D. fotos D. artistas), y quieren el préstamos para poder comprar lo necesario para tener un poco mas surtido como: dulces, fotos, insumos para L. comida, harinas, gelatinas, desechables y asi poder tener un poco mas D. clienteL.. 

Ellos se sienten afortunados por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva atraves D. Fundacion Realidad ya que asi pueden trabajar con el credito brindado
texts.en:
Violeta is a group which was formed by people dedicated to moving ahead in life; all the founding members proposed various groups names until “Violeta” was chosen in a unanimous decision. The group is located in the Colonia Jardín in the Chalco Solidaridad Valley, in the state of Mexico. The founders of the group are: Mrs. Teresa N. D. L. C. is the representative of the group; she is 54 years old with six married children. Teresa only finished the first graD. of primary school, and since that time, she has had to work. Unfortunately, she was widowed eight months ago. She sells snack foods such as tacos, quesadillas, and gorditas; she also sells candies and potatoes, and she rents out homes. She began her business roughly two years ago; as she saw the need to increase her income, she goes out daily to sell her products and when she can, she goes to events such as dances. Teresa tries to sell as much as she can, and with this source of income she goes about supporting herself now that she has no family to support her. She always tries to have the ingredients ready for the preparation of her food in time to sell her products at night. Even if she is busy running to keep up with her sales, she will always try to come out ahead. Her plans are to put in another food stall and to do some home improvement projects. She has decided to take out this loan to invest in her snack stall business, and the other part in fixing up her house. The other nine founding members of the group are: EsteL. Díaz N. (sale of artistic photographs), Ricardo Ramírez Gómez (clothing store), Viridiana C. Díaz (sale of tostados), Ofelia B. B. (sale of piñatas). Efrén Martínez V. (sale of sweets), MariseL. F. Hernández (bakery), Nancy S. M. (woodworking), Laura N. Guzmán (sale of sweets), Yolanda F. Hernández (sale of snack foods), Rene E. E. (sale of sweets) and Roberto C. M. (sale of artistic photographs). They would like a loan to be able to buy necessary items to increase their stocks if items such as candy, photos, raw materials for food, flour, gelatin, and disposable items. Increasing their stocks will allow them to have more customers. The group feels fortunate to be able to work with support from Kiva through Fundacion Realidad.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, artistic photographs, wood, tostadas, oil, gelatin moulds, puddings, and milk

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry C. U., tiene la edad de 29 años, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra de frijoles y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Henry  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Henry C. U. is 29, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents. He wants the loan for his bean crops. The idea is to prepare the land for planting the beans and to give the crop adequate maintenance. This is so that they will be ready to harvest. Then he will be able to sell them and get better earnings. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Henry has several years of agricultural experience, especially with basic grains. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant basic grains (beans)

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un homme célibataire très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, il s'est lancé dans le commerce en détail de postes téléviseurs, réfrigérateurs et autres. la demande de ses clients est élevée en ce mois ci, pour les satisfaire convenablement il doit rehausser son stock raison pour laquelle il sollicite chez WAGES un premier crédit pour l'achat de postes télévisions, réfrigérateurs et autres.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is a very energetic unmarried man. To support himself, he embarked on a retail business involving television sets, refrigerators, and more. The demand from his customers is high this month. To satisfy them appropriately, he must increase his inventory, for which he is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy TV sets, refrigerators, and other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying televisions, refrigerators, and other items

loans.name: Genith Deidania

texts.es:
Genith de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella construyo en una parte de su casa un local para tener una papelería. 

Comenzó a vender cuadernos y papeles en su pequeño local, poco a poco fue incrementando su papelería y también vendiendo dulces para los niños que iban con sus padres, ahora trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar caramelos, carpetas y plumas para su papelería. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su papelería y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Genith, age 42, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban landscape that was originally more varied, with hills, streams and lakes that still appears as the remains of a dissolving ecology). In order to help her family with the household expenses, she built up a part of her house as a paper goods shop. She began to sell notebooks and paper in her small shop; little by little her paper store grew, and she also sold sweets for the children that came along with their parents. Now, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day. With this loan, she plans to buy candies, folders and pens for her paper shop. In the future, she wants to stock her shop more and in that way have security in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies, folders, and pens

loans.name: Volcanes Flat Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Volcanes (Flat), porque a los integrantes les agrada la vista que tienen de ellos. Están ubicados en la Colonia Plutarco Elías Calles en Ixtapaluca, Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por cinco integrantes que se conocen no solo por ser vecinos sino por que además tienen una amistad. Volcanes se formo gracias a que escucharon comentarios de una vecina sobre el trabajo que realiza Fundación Realidad así que decidieron comenzar con sus reuniones.

El representante del grupo se llama María Guadalupe C. Hernández tiene 45 años,  estudió solo la secundaria y tiene en total dos hijos, una mujer que ya esta casada y un varón quien aun vive con ella. María se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y pantalones de mezclilla por pedido desde hace mas de cinco años, pero hace año y medio había dejado de vender ya que estaba atravesando por una crisis económica muy difícil, María logro salir adelante gracias a los esfuerzos que hizo y actualmente conserva parte de la gente que ya tenia como clientes, ella sale a mostrar sus catálogos cada tercer día, y cuando la gente la cita para que se los lleve. Los planes que ella tiene es poner un negocio mas grande y así ayudarse con los gastos de su casa, la razón por la cual pidió el préstamo es para comprar catálogos nuevos y surtir los pedidos que tiene tanto de zapatos como de pantalones, la gente escucha de su negocio por recomendaciones de otras personas. María desea aumentar su negocio, para obtener ganancias  con las cuales pueda ayudar a su mama quien es una persona ya adulta y requiere de cuidados y medicamentos.

Los otros cuatro integrantes son: Rosa Isela Hernández Z. (venta de cosméticos por catalogo), Ricardo R. Jiménez (costura y confección), Martha Patricia Juárez O. (venta de ropa interior) y Erika S. García (venta de lencería en general) y quieren el préstamo para invertir en la compra de: telas, ropa interior, lencería en general, compra de zapatos, cosméticos y así tener un ingreso mas para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus familias y agradecen la ayuda que se les brinda.
texts.en:
This group calls themselves Volcanes (Flat) because the members enjoy the view that they have of the volcanoes. They are located in Colonia Plutarco Elías Calles in Ixtapaluca, state of Mexico. The group is comprised of five members who know each other from not only being neighbors but because they also have a friendship. The Volcanes came together thanks to hearing reports from a neighbor about the work that the Fundación Realidad does, and they decided to begin with their meetings. The group's representative is María Guadalupe C. H.. She is 45 years old. She studied up to secondary school and has 2 children, one girl who is already married and one boy who still lives with her. María has sold catalog-order shoes and denim pants to made order for the last five years, but a year and a half ago she stopped her sales because she was facing a very difficult economic crisis. María managed to get ahead thanks to her own efforts, and she retained some of the people she used to have as clients. She went out to present her catalogs every three days and when people would call her to bring them. She plans to have a larger business so she can help meet her household expenses. The reason she is requesting this loan is to buy new catalogs and to supply as many orders for shoes that she has for pants. People hear about her business through the recommendations of others. María wants her business to grow and to have greater earnings, with which she could help her elderly mother who needs care and medications. The other four members are: Rosa Isela Hernández Z. (cosmetic sales by catalog), Ricardo R. Jiménez (sewing and clothing), Martha Patricia Juárez O. (sales of underclothes) y Erika S. García (general lingerie sales). They want a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fabric, underwear, lingerie, shoes, cosmetics, and therefore earn an income that will give them a better quality of life with their families, and they are grateful for the help that you offer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabrics, cosmetics, shoes, lengerie, ladies' underwear, and catalogs

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Doña Gertrudis tiene la edad de 46 años, madre de dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, zapatos, negocio que desde hace varios años inicio, con ahorros productos de su esposo el cual trabaja como técnico de operaciones.
Últimamente las ventas han bajado, hay días regulares como días buenos, es por eso trata de comprar productos accesibles y bonitos de precios para lograr equilibrar las ventas. Con los financiamientos ha mejorado la infraestructura de su casa, como la inversión de su negocio.
 
Con el crédito anterior logro remodelar un cuarto, ahora comprara hojas de zinc para cambiar parte del techo de su casa, que por ser ya de varios años tiene muchos agujeros el cual desea poder cambiar para que no se le pase el agua ya que es una situación muy incomoda. 
Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño negocio para lograr apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y en la economía de su hogar ya que la situación esta muy difícil hoy en día.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 46 years old and a mother of 2. Her business is in the sale of clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and shoes, a business that she has had for a number of years, beginning with the savings from her husband who works as an operations technician. Lately her sales have been down. There are average days just like there are good days; because of this she tries to buy things that are pretty and accessible in price in order to balance her sales. With loans she has improved the infrastructure of her home as well as invested in her business. Through a previous loan, she remodeled a room; now she will buy zinc sheets in order to change part of her home's roof that for years now has had various holes. She wants to be able to change it so that water no longer leaks through since that makes for an uncomfortable situation. Her plans are to keep investing in her small business so she can support her children in their studies and in the economic management of her some since that situation is very difficult these days.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc sheets and other materials in order to make changes in her roof that now leaks water and causes discomfort

loans.name: Kodjo Sévérin

texts.fr: ce monsieur est marié et père de 2 enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'anfame qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il s'est lancé dans le commerce de détail de peinture, huile à moteur et divers, il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1994. actuellement il fait face à une baisse de stock de marchandises, pour se réapprovisionner il s'adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un premier crédit qui lui servira à acheter des bidons de peintures et des bidons d'huile à moteur.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and the father of two children.  He lives with his family in Anfame, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé.  To provide for his family, he embarked on a retail business involving paint, motor oil, and more.  He started this business in 1994.  He currently is facing an inventory shortage.  To stock up again, he is turning to WAGES to obtain an initial loan that will be used to buy containers of paint and motor oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying containers of paint and motor oil

loans.name: Oscar Nevil

texts.es:
Oscar de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, el aunque no tuvo un estudio avanzado en reparación de equipos electrónicos por la necesidad de dinero tuvo que trabajar en “Casa Soni” donde aprendió toda la practica que necesitaba para tener su propio negocio. 

Cuando le bajaron el sueldo aprobecho para tener su propio ingresos e independizarse. En la actualidad el tiene un taller de reparación de equipos electrónicos. Repara televisores a $ 80.00, DVD  a $ 15.00, etc.  Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Con el fin de reparar mas aparatos electrónicos el quiere comprar mas repuestos con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere vender repuestos y readecuar el local para tener mas espacio.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 39, lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil. Even though he did not have advanced studies in repairing electronic equipment, he had to work en “Casa Soni” because he needed money. There he got all of the training he needed to have his own business. He took the opportunity, when his salary was lowered, to have his own income and become independent. He currently has a repair shop for electronic equipment. He repairs televisions for $80.00 and DVDs for $15.00, etc. He works from nine a.m. until six p.m. everyday. In order to repair more electronic equipment, he wants to use the loan to buy more replacement parts. In the future he wants to sell replacement parts and recondition his place in order to have more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: à 33 ans cette femme reste une femme très dynamique, elle est marié et mère d'un enfant,elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'anfame qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de cadre photo pour les décorations et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock actuel de marchandises est en baisse, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 40 cadres photos de décoration. avec le revenu de son activité elle contribue aux charges financières de son foyer.
texts.en:
This woman of 33 is still very dynamic; she is married and the mother of one child, and she lives with her family in the Anfame neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lome. She retails decorative picture frames to earn a living and buys her inventory at the big open-air market of Lomé. Her present stock of merchandise is low, and in order to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 40 decorative picture frames. With the income from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 40 decorative picture frames for resale

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto H. A., tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos. Tienen 26,24, 22,20,19 y 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de frijoles. La idea es  preparar  el terreno para la siembra de frijoles y darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de frijol, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Carlos  tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, el está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
