Doña Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, y también a la cría de animales como son vacas, borregos, cuyes lo que en su mayor parte es para su consumo y en sus necesidades los vende, nuestra socia va a invertir el crédito en la comprar de una maquina para soldar ya que su hijo la necesita para el taller de latonería que es dueño, su sueño es tener salud y así apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo que este a su alcance.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario P. has been with the community bank for three loan cycles. She lives in the El Cruce area of the Sinincay parish located north-east of the canton of Cuenca. The parish of Chiguintad lies to the north, to the east and south is the city of Cuenca, and to the west is the parish of Sayausí. The artisans of Sinincay specialize in the production of marble and the manufacture of tiles and bricks. Some of the women make hats from toquilla fiber. The parish church is renowned for its architectural beauty and its picture of the Visitation of the Virgin. The church is the parish’s most important attraction and is frequently visited by tourists. Bank member Rosario is 53 years old, married, and has eight children. The four oldest have jobs and help their mother financially; the four youngest attend high school or primary school. Rosario tells us that she is also responsible for her three nephews and nieces as her sister has gone overseas to bring them a better standard of living. With her and her husband’s hard work, they managed to build their own home. As well as all her household chores, Sra. Rosario raises animals such as cows, sheep, and guinea pigs mostly for her family’s consumption but sometimes she sells them out of necessity. She is going to use the loan to buy a soldering machine as her son needs one for the body shop that he owns. Her greatest wish is to remain healthy so she can help her children achieve whatever is within their reach.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Wolimata

texts.fr: Wolimata D. est une femme de 66 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 08 aout 2006 et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers comme des halieutiques, des céréales locales, des fruits etc. son crédit lui permettra de continuer la réalisation de son projet. A partir de ses bénéfices elle a pu acheter du ciment et du sable et fait des briques en vue de construire une maison en dur et son objectif est la réalisation de cette maison tout en participant à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Wolimata D., 66, is married and the mother of six children who still depend on her. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since August 8, 2006. She has received eight consecutive loans and has always reimbursed them without difficulty. She sells various items such as seafood, local cereals, fruit, etc., and her loan will allow her to continue to strive to achieve her goal. With her profit, she has been able to buy cement and sand and is making bricks so that she can construct a permanent house. Her goal is to build this house, while also participating in improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia P. vive en el sector del Cruce del Carmen, perteneciente a la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte, con la parroquia Chiquintad, al este y al sur, con la ciudad de Cuenca, y al oeste, con la parroquia Sayausí. Dentro de Sinincay, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial es tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la colonial imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella, es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.

Nuestra socia  tiene una papelería hace 10 años en su casa, trabaja de domingo a domingo, también se dedica a la pastelería, la cual aprendió gracias a un curso hace 6 años y realiza solo bajo pedido
.
Doña Julia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija esta cursando los estudios universitarios y su segundo hijo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 12 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio, ahora con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su papelería, su meta es de crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia P. lives in Cruce del Carmen, which is part of the Sinincay Parish. This parish is located northeast of the Cuenca Canton. It's border to the north is the Chiquintad Parish; to the east and south, the city of Cuenca; and to the west, the Sayausí Parish. Within Sinicay, local artisans specialize in marble production and brick and tile manufacture. Some women make panama hats. The parish's church is traditional in its architectural beauty and its colonial image of the Virgin Mary of the Visitation, who is buried there. The Virgin's grave is the parish's most important attraction and is visited by many tourists. Our partner has run a school supply store from her home for the past ten years. She works seven days a week. In addition, Julia bakes. She learned six years ago after taking a course on cake-making and now bakes to order. Julia is 34 years old. She is married with two children, who are 19 and 12 years old. Her eldest daughter is currently pursuing a college education, while her younger son is still in school. Her husband is a bricklayer. The family does not have its own house, because they live with Julia's mother. Julia has been part of her community bank for 12 years. The loans she has received in the past have allowed her to build her business. With her new loan, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her school supply store. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, ballpoint pens, books, pencils, paper

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa P. vive en el sector del Cruce, que es perteneciente a la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte, con la parroquia Chiquintad, al este y al sur, con la ciudad de Cuenca, y al oeste, con la parroquia Sayausí. Dentro de Sinincay, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la colonial imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella, es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.

Doña Rosa esta cerca de cumplir los 60 años tiene dos hijos, su primera hija es de profesión costurera y su segundo hijo albañil y son los que ayudan  a la economía del hogar, con mucho y orgullo de ello ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestras socia tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende bien ya que cuenta con su clientela, nos comenta que al principios le fue muy difícil ya que no tenia mucho dinero para incrementar su negocio pero poco a poco ha logrado superarse, se encuentra hace dos ciclos en el bankito y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras; con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería y su meta es que su tienda crezca.
texts.en:
Rosa P. lives in the Cruce area, which is part of Sinincay parish. This parish is located to the northeast of the canton of Cuenca. Its border to the north is the Chiquintad Parish; to the east and south, the city of Cuenca; and to the west, the Sayausí Parish. Within Sinincay, artisans specialize in the production of marble, the production of tile, bricks, and some women make straw hats. The traditional parish church, with its beautiful architecture and colonial image of the Virgin of the Visitation, who is buried there, is the most important attraction offered by the parish and is visited by many tourists. Rosa is about to turn 60 years old. She has 2 children. Her eldest daughter is a dressmaker, and her son is a bricklayer, and they both help out with the household expenses. She takes great pride in having built her own home. Rosa has a small store which is selling well and has an established customer base. She tells us that at first it was very difficult because she didn't have much money to expand her business, but gradually she managed to overcome this problem. She has had two loan cycles with her communal bank, and has developed a great friendship with her fellow group members. With her new loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise, since her goal is to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. María Sánchez vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector de Indurama,  esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosas calles, iglesias, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es muy amable cordial y hospitalaria.

Nuestra socia del banco comunal Despertar, tiene 27 años de edad y es de la ciudad de Machala, se encuentra casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer; en su unión conyugal ha procreado 1 hijo, cual tiene 11 años de edad y estudia en el Liceo Americano.

María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, es comerciante ambulante, también vende su mercadería en la ciudad de Machala, así aprovecha para comprar  más mercadería, realiza esta actividad desde hace 4 años.  
También labora en el bar de un colegio de la ciudad de Cuenca en el cual trabaja solo medio día.

 Se encuentra en su sexto ciclo y nos comenta que los prestamos le están beneficiando en el crecimiento de su negocio, tiene una bonita amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal y se caracteriza por ser una persona muy carismática, con el préstamo de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería, su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Sánchez lives in the Indurama sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its beautiful streets, churches, and the four rivers that bathe the city. The people are nice, friendly, and hospitable. She is a member of the Despertar Communal Bank. She is 27 years old, and she is from the city of Machala. She is married, and her husband works as a driver. They have one child. He is 11 years old, and he goes to school at the Liceo Americano. María sells all types of clothes as a traveling salesperson. She also sells her merchandise in the city of Machala. That way she takes advantage of being there to buy more merchandise. She has been doing this for four years. She also works in a snack bar of a school in the city of Cuenca; she only works there half of the day. She is in her sixth cycle. She tells us that the loans are helping her with the growth of her business. She has a lovely friendship will all of the members of her communal bank. She is characterized as being a very charismatic person. She will use the loan from the Fundación to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, underwear, and blouses

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Salimata N. est âgée de 62 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de banc villageois depuis le 23 aout 2007. En trois ans d’existence dans le banc villageois elle a capitalisé un bon niveau d’épargne et des économies qui lui ont permis d’acheter du ciment et du sable pour faire de briques en vue de construire une maison. Elle est vendeuse de poissons fumés, de poissons séchés et d’huile de palme et avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement. Elle cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et à leur chercher un abri.
texts.en:
Salimata N., 62, is a widow and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the Banc villageois since August 23, 2007. During her thee years with the Banc villageois she has been able to put aside a tidy sum and enough savings to buy cement and bricks in view of constructing a house. She sells smoked fish, dried fish, and palm oil, and with her new loan she plans to increase her inventory. Her goal is to improve living conditions for her children and provide shelter for them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business

loans.name: Miriam Robertina

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam P. es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosas calles, iglesias, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es muy amable cordial y hospitalaria.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido una hija de 5 años de edad, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo los buses urbanos, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros.

Doña Miriam se dedica a la venta aretes y productos Yanbal, actividad que realiza hace 4 años y le va bien en su negocio ya que cuenta con su clientela, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 3 años, siendo invitada por su mamá, los créditos anteriores ha invertido en su hogar y negocio, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos Yanbal, su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miriam P. is a member of the Despertar Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its beautiful streets, churches, and the four rives that bathe the city. The people are nice, friendly, and hospitable. Our member is 33 years old and married. They have a five year old daughter. Her husband is a driver. He drives urban buses. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her in-laws' house. Miriam sells earrings and Yanbal products. She has been doing this for four years. Her business is going well for her, and she has customers she can count on. She has been in the communal bank for three years; her mother invited her. She has used the previous loans to invest in her home and her business. She will use the new loan to buy more Yanbal products. Her goal is to come to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Productos y bisuteria Yambal.

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Damaris tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de tres años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como operario de maquinas en la empresa Gildan. La señora Damaris tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio está localizado en la salida de la zona franca. Ella ya tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio cuando nació su hijo, debido a que necesitaban buscar una fuente alternativa de ingresos para la manutención del mismo, con el tiempo, observo que el negocio brindaba buenas ganancias y se ha dedicado a él desde esa fecha. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, ella aprovecha el momento en que salen los trabajadores para vender sus productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente están habitando donde sus suegros. Además desea hacer un negocio más grande y tener una buena fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris is 23 years old, married, and has 1 child, who is 3 years of age. Her husband works as a machine operator for Gildan company. Damaris has her own business selling fruits and vegetables. Her business is located at the exit to the Free Trade Zone. She has operated the business for 3 years. She started it when her baby was born because she needed to find an alternative source of income to maintain her child. In time, she noted that the business offered good earnings and she has dedicated herself to it ever since. Damaris is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. She takes advantage of the moment the workers are leaving work to sell her products. Her dream always has been to have her own home, since at present, they are living in her in-laws house. In addition, she wants to have a bigger business and a good source of income for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Ruth Yessenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ruth Sánchez es socia del banco comunal Despertar, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace seis ciclos, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus hermosas calles, iglesias, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es muy amable cordial y hospitalaria.

Doña Ruth es de la provincia del Oro, y ha llegado a esta ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, tiene 30 años de edad, viven unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 14, 9 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija cursa los estudios en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos se encuentran en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos L´bel, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años y le va bien ya que vende a sus amigas, hace un mes ha empezado a trabajar en un restaurante, en la cual labora de lunes a domingo de 4 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m., su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos L´bel, su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ruth Sánchez is a member of the Despertar Communal Bank. She has been in the communal bank for six cycles. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its beautiful streets, churches, and its four rivers that bathe the city. The people are nice, friendly, and hospitable. Ruth is from the Oro province. She came to this city looking for better work. She is 30 years old, and she is in a common law marriage. They have three children; who are 14, 9, and 6 years old. Her first daughter is in high school, and the last two are in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic. They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live. Our member has been selling L’bel products for five years. It is going well for her; she sells to her friends. A month ago she started to work in a restaurant. She works there from Monday through Sunday from four p.m. until 12 midnight. She will use the loan to buy more L’bel products. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy L'bel cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Tercer Cuartel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TERCER CUARTEL porque la comunidad en la cual habitan se divide en cuarteles en Atlacomulco, México. Es un lugar en donde la mayor parte de la población fundamenta su economía en cultivo y venta de verdura, son personas muy trabajadoras. El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes y es la TERCERA vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 
Esta foto fué tomada en la casa de la Sra. Rosa María D. E., donde se hacen las reuniones semanales. Se ve el trabajo que realiza la Sra. Rosa María D. E. quien es la primera de derecha a izquierda en la foto. Tiene 48 años; en la primaria solo aprendió a leer y a escribir, se dedica a la venta de bolsas de mandado, a la costura y artículos por temporada principalmente, lo comercializa en las plazas (tianguis) de los diferentes municipios, como lo es Atlacomulco, Ixtlahuaca, El oro por mencionar algunos, tiene 22 años dedicándose a estas actividades, menciona que el crédito le ha servido para invertir en su negocio y eso ha permitido darle la oportunidad de estudiar la universidad a 1 de sus 6 hijos por el momento, pero tiene planeado seguir trabajando arduamente como lo ha venido haciendo por años, para darle esas misma oportunidad a los otros 3 hijos más pequeños ya que desafortunadamente a 2 de los mayores no tuvo la oportunidad de darles estudio, siempre busca la diversificación de su producto de acuerdo a lo que los clientes le piden.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bolsas, ajos, hilos, telas y sombreros. Sus compañeras comentan que la Sra. Rosa María D. E. se ha superado gracias a su negocio y a la dedicación.  
Su principal objetivo en la vida es dejarles una gran herencia a sus hijos que es el estudio para que puedan tener una vida mejor. Eso es lo admirable de las personas principalmente las señoras que integran los diferentes grupos, que a pesar de las dificultades que enfrenten siempre está por encima la educación de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Carmela López R.       (vta. de plástico), 
Antonia S. L.     (vta. de sombreros), 
Josefina B. S. 
Lourdes D. E.     (vta. De comida), 
Olivia S. D.      
Lisbeth D. D.       (vta. De artículos de temporada), 
Beatriz López S.      (Hojalatería), 
María Inés D. Martínez (Miscelánea)
texts.en:
This group is called “Tercel Cuartel” (3rd Quarter) because Atlacomulco where they live is divided into quarters. Here the majority of the population have an economic base in the cultivation and sale of vegetables. These are very hard working people. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the 3rd time they have solicited a loan from CrediComun. The photo was taken in the house of Mrs. Rosa Maria where their weekly reunions are held. Let's look at the Rosa Maria's work. She is the 1st person right to left in the photo. She is 48 years old and only learned to read and write in primary school. She sells pockets ordered by dressmakers and seasonal articles, primarily in the public markets of different municipalities, like Atlacomulco, Istlahuaca, and El Oro, to mention a few. Rosa Maria has been doing this for 22 years. She mentions that previous loans invested in her business have given 1 of her 6 children the opportunity to study in the university at present, and she plans to continue working assiduously as she has been doing for years, to give this same opportunity to the 3 youngest children, since, unfortunately, the 2 oldest never had the chance to study. She always looks for ways to diversify her products in accord with her customers' demands. Rosa Maria is requesting the loan to purchase sewing materials, cloth, and hats. Her companions comment that she has gotten ahead thanks to her business and her dedication. Her principal objective in life is to provide a heritage to her children, which is an education that will offer them a better life. This is the admirable thing about the women who make up these different groups, that despite the difficulties they face, always, their primary goal is the education of their children. The other members of the group are: Carmela L. R. (sale of plastics) Antonia S. L. (sale of hats) Josefina B. S. Lourdes D. E. (sale of meals) Olivia S. D. Lisbeth D. D. (sale of seasonal articles) Beatriz L. S. (tin-ware) Maria Ines D. M. (miscellany)

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SEWING MATERIALS, THREAD, CLOTH, AND HATS

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma T. is from the village of Salimpuno,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Vilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used purchase fertilizers for her coconut. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to grow coconuts.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio P. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Leoncio is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leoncio owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor repair services to local community members. Leoncio has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoncio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Leoncio from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve her motor repair business.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita S. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Melita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Melita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Melita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa Y. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Elsa is widowed and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling peanut brittle in the local community member. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en: This group loan includes two people located in Ha Bour village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Yan C. is the group leader, selected by the other member who will use a small part of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Yan C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to support her family and she is also a construction worker. Currently she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Yan C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is widow with a child who is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Felisa's Group

texts.en:
Felisa J. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 62 years old. Felisa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Felisa is married. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a Buy and Sell Ready to War (RTW) business. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 38,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Felisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more Ready to Wear clothes.

loans.name: Melania's Group

texts.en:
Melania D. is from the village of Calatunan. She is 52 years old. Melania is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Melania is married. To make a living, Melania owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melania has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Melania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melania has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Melania is requesting a new loan of 43,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Melania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Three people make up this group loan, located in Ha Bour village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Ly S. is the group leader, selected by the other members, each of whom will use their pieces of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Ly S. is 40 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Choun Soy, have a small child. They are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice to support their family. In addition, her husbandworks as a laborer. Although they try to maximizetheir business, they believe they can earn more of an income. For this reason, to improve the standard of living of her family, Mrs. Ly S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig feed in order to start a new business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Keatha

texts.en: Mrs. Keatha P., age 27, lives in Bos village in Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice, which she sells to support her family. She has encountered a problem in that her field contains infertile soil. In addition, it is far away from any irrigation system. For this reason, to improve production, Mrs. Keatha P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine. Her husband, Mr. Sothey Phen, pictured with her here, is a construction worker. They have two small children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine for her rice field

loans.name: Raem

texts.en: Mrs. Raem P., who is living in Chres village in Prey Veng Province, was born 37 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Rat Roeurng  (shown in the photo with her) are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land upon which they grow cane to sell to support their family. Although this couple tries to work hard they earn only a small income to support the family, so  Raem is requesting a loan to buy a plow to start a new business. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is a student in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a plow to start a new business

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli P. is from the village of Basagan, Katipunan. She is 60 years old. Araceli is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Araceli owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety products in the local community. Araceli has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Araceli joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Araceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Araceli is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Araceli from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Rasi

texts.en:
In Prolueng Meas village in Prey Veng province lives a person named Mrs. Rasi N.. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which to cultivate rice to support her family. 

Now her problem is that her field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Rasi N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband Mr. Lang Sor is a construction worker. With these activities, they support three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are students in the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Glorita

texts.en:
Mrs. Glorita C. is from the village of Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Glorita is married and blessed with 2 children of school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store business. She’s been engaged in this kind business for 7 years already and earned approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this business activity. 

This year, Glorita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glorita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obatin additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie N. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 38 years old. Jessie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma M. is from the village of Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. To make a living, Thelma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. Thelma has been engaged in her business for 24 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. At present, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Chorn Chea, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. 

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to a middleman, who in turn sells them at a Phnom Penh market. In addition to weaving, Mr. Chorn Chea also climbs up palm trees to collect palm juice. 

Sopheap has asked for a Kiva loan once before. Because the door and windows of her house are old and not strong, she decided to replace them. But, she does not have enough money for this. Hence Sopheap is applying for her second loan of $200 to make the replacements.

loans.use: To replace the door and widows of her house.

Imelda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-onn S. (pictured here), aged 40 years old, is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
 
Sam-onn has been a primary school teacher for 20 years. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to renovate the house where she lives. She will use part of her loan to buy silk materials for her sister’s weaving business.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives and to buy silk materials for her sister’s weaving business.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun S. is 54 years old and has been farming since he was young. His wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Norng, is 41 years old and has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. The couple has been married since 1980 and has seven children: three sons and four daughters. Three of them married and live outside the family home, three others attend school and another one assists his father with his farming business. Saroeun and his wife are both in the photo. 

Saroeun grows sesame and ginger. He does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his sesame and ginger farm. So, he is asking for a loan of $400 to help his capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a widowed mother who is blessed with five children. One is now married and lives in a different house, while the other four are single and live in the family home. To help control the family’s financial crisis, one of her children works as a local professional teacher in a primary school.

K., age 47, pursues her daily income by making and selling Khmer cake for children. Due to the fact that the current income she earns is not sufficient to serve them, she is applying for a loan in order to buy piglets to raise in a stall she has built. From this business she hopes she will earn more profit to ensure that her family has a comfortable living.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 50, is a low-income person living in a rural area of Battambang Province. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now takes care of a school-aged child, while another three are ready married and have started new homes.

To earn a daily income, S. always buys fish paste in bulk to resell in the local market. Also, she orders fresh fish and turns them into fish paste to sell. In a day she is typically able to make $3 to control the financial problems of her family.

Because her current business is a very profitable one for her family, S. applies for a loan to sustain its growth.

loans.use: To sustain her business

loans.name: Si

texts.en:
This humble woman, Mrs. Si P., 44 years old, resides in a medium-sized wooden house with other family members. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a district policeman and who earns a small income for the family. The couple has two young children who go to school every day.

To feed the family, Si P. has a small trade selling vegetables and some cooking ingredients in the market. She is taking out her loan to renovate her vegetable store and increase her business capital.

loans.use: To renovate her vegetable store and increase her business capital

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
T., aged 55, operates her own small business planting various crops such as morning glory, cabbage, rice, etc. She normally harvests and sells the crops to buyers when the crops come to maturity.

As she lacks water to irrigate her crop, T. requested a loan to buy an irrigation pump. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will improve her crop-growing trade.

T. is widowed and the mother of two children: one is married and one is single and employed. She is hopeful that the loan will provide good benefits that will enable her to meet her family’s financial crisis and pay her loan installments.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old John is the married father of four children who are all adults. He is a dairy farmer from Central Kenya near Murang'a town where he has been farming for over thirty years. He has employed two people from the community to help on his farm. His main product is milk which he sells to Brookside Company in Murang’a town. He also earns income from coffee, bananas and maize that he sells to the local market.

John’s major challenge is lack of a stable market, poor milk prices and transportation problems during the rainy season.

John has requested this Kes 53,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn enough income to enable him to pay his workers and meet his other basic needs.

In five years time, John intends to acquire a pure breed of dairy cattle producing over 50 liters of milk per day.
He says "Juhudi is doing a commendable job in improving the lives of peasant farmers.”

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

Cristina owns and operates a business providing trisikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
